spacr.gui_elements 

   1import os, threading, time, sqlite3, webbrowser, pyautogui, random, cv2
   2import tkinter as tk
   3from tkinter import ttk
   4import tkinter.font as tkFont
   5from tkinter import filedialog
   6from tkinter import font
   7from queue import Queue
   8from tkinter import Label, Frame, Button
   9import numpy as np
  10import pandas as pd
  11from PIL import Image, ImageOps, ImageTk, ImageDraw, ImageFont, ImageEnhance
  12from concurrent.futures import ThreadPoolExecutor
  13from skimage.exposure import rescale_intensity
  14from IPython.display import display, HTML
  15import imageio.v2 as imageio
  16from collections import deque
  17from skimage.draw import polygon, line
  18from skimage.transform import resize
  19from scipy.ndimage import binary_fill_holes, label
  20from tkinter import ttk, scrolledtext
  21from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
  22from xgboost import XGBClassifier
  23from sklearn.metrics import classification_report, confusion_matrix
  24
  25fig = None
  26
  27def restart_gui_app(root):
  28    """
  29    Restarts the GUI application by destroying the current instance
  30    and launching a fresh one.
  31    """
  32    try:
  33        # Destroy the current root window
  34        root.destroy()
  35        
  36        # Import and launch a new instance of the application
  37        from spacr.gui import gui_app
  38        new_root = tk.Tk()  # Create a fresh Tkinter root instance
  39        gui_app()
  40    except Exception as e:
  41        print(f"Error restarting GUI application: {e}")
  42
  43def create_menu_bar(root):
  44    from .gui import initiate_root
  45    gui_apps = {
  46        "Mask": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='mask'),
  47        "Measure": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='measure'),
  48        "Annotate": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='annotate'),
  49        "Make Masks": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='make_masks'),
  50        "Classify": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='classify'),
  51        "Umap": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='umap'),
  52        "Train Cellpose": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='train_cellpose'),
  53        "ML Analyze": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='ml_analyze'),
  54        "Cellpose Masks": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='cellpose_masks'),
  55        "Cellpose All": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='cellpose_all'),
  56        "Map Barcodes": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='map_barcodes'),
  57        "Regression": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='regression'),
  58        "Activation": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='activation'),
  59        "Recruitment": lambda: initiate_root(root, settings_type='recruitment')
  60    }
  61
  62    # Create the menu bar
  63    menu_bar = tk.Menu(root, bg="#008080", fg="white")
  64
  65    # Create a "SpaCr Applications" menu
  66    app_menu = tk.Menu(menu_bar, tearoff=0, bg="#008080", fg="white")
  67    menu_bar.add_cascade(label="SpaCr Applications", menu=app_menu)
  68
  69    # Add options to the "SpaCr Applications" menu
  70    for app_name, app_func in gui_apps.items():
  71        app_menu.add_command(
  72            label=app_name,
  73            command=app_func
  74        )
  75
  76    # Add a separator and an exit option
  77    app_menu.add_separator()
  78    #app_menu.add_command(label="Home",command=lambda: restart_gui_app(root))
  79    app_menu.add_command(label="Help", command=lambda: webbrowser.open("https://spacr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest"))
  80    app_menu.add_command(label="Exit", command=root.quit)
  81
  82    # Configure the menu for the root window
  83    root.config(menu=menu_bar)
  84
  85def set_element_size():
  86
  87    screen_width, screen_height = pyautogui.size()
  88    screen_area = screen_width * screen_height
  89    
  90    # Calculate sizes based on screen dimensions
  91    btn_size = int((screen_area * 0.002) ** 0.5)  # Button size as a fraction of screen area
  92    bar_size = screen_height // 20  # Bar size based on screen height
  93    settings_width = screen_width // 4  # Settings panel width as a fraction of screen width
  94    panel_width = screen_width - settings_width  # Panel width as a fraction of screen width
  95    panel_height = screen_height // 6  # Panel height as a fraction of screen height
  96    
  97    size_dict = {
  98        'btn_size': btn_size,
  99        'bar_size': bar_size,
 100        'settings_width': settings_width,
 101        'panel_width': panel_width,
 102        'panel_height': panel_height
 103    }
 104    return size_dict
 105    
 106def set_dark_style(style, parent_frame=None, containers=None, widgets=None, font_family="OpenSans", font_size=12, bg_color='black', fg_color='white', active_color='blue', inactive_color='dark_gray'):
 107
 108    if active_color == 'teal':
 109        active_color = '#008080'
 110    if inactive_color == 'dark_gray':
 111        inactive_color = '#2B2B2B' # '#333333' #'#050505'
 112    if bg_color == 'black':
 113        bg_color = '#000000'
 114    if fg_color == 'white':
 115        fg_color = '#ffffff'
 116    if active_color == 'blue':
 117        active_color = '#007BFF'
 118
 119    padding = '5 5 5 5'
 120    font_style = tkFont.Font(family=font_family, size=font_size)
 121
 122    if font_family == 'OpenSans':
 123        font_loader = spacrFont(font_name='OpenSans', font_style='Regular', font_size=12)
 124    else:
 125        font_loader = None
 126        
 127    style.theme_use('clam')
 128    
 129    style.configure('TEntry', padding=padding)
 130    style.configure('TCombobox', padding=padding)
 131    style.configure('Spacr.TEntry', padding=padding)
 132    style.configure('TEntry', padding=padding)
 133    style.configure('Spacr.TEntry', padding=padding)
 134    style.configure('Custom.TLabel', padding=padding)
 135    style.configure('TButton', padding=padding)
 136    style.configure('TFrame', background=bg_color)
 137    style.configure('TPanedwindow', background=bg_color)
 138    if font_loader:
 139        style.configure('TLabel', background=bg_color, foreground=fg_color, font=font_loader.get_font(size=font_size))
 140    else:
 141        style.configure('TLabel', background=bg_color, foreground=fg_color, font=(font_family, font_size))
 142
 143    if parent_frame:
 144        parent_frame.configure(bg=bg_color)
 145        parent_frame.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 146        parent_frame.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 147
 148    if containers:
 149        for container in containers:
 150            if isinstance(container, ttk.Frame):
 151                container_style = ttk.Style()
 152                container_style.configure(f'{container.winfo_class()}.TFrame', background=bg_color)
 153                container.configure(style=f'{container.winfo_class()}.TFrame')
 154            else:
 155                container.configure(bg=bg_color)
 156
 157    if widgets:
 158        for widget in widgets:
 159            if isinstance(widget, (tk.Label, tk.Button, tk.Frame, ttk.LabelFrame, tk.Canvas)):
 160                widget.configure(bg=bg_color)
 161            if isinstance(widget, (tk.Label, tk.Button)):
 162                if font_loader:
 163                    widget.configure(fg=fg_color, font=font_loader.get_font(size=font_size))
 164                else:
 165                    widget.configure(fg=fg_color, font=(font_family, font_size))
 166            if isinstance(widget, scrolledtext.ScrolledText):
 167                widget.configure(bg=bg_color, fg=fg_color, insertbackground=fg_color)
 168            if isinstance(widget, tk.OptionMenu):
 169                if font_loader:
 170                    widget.configure(bg=bg_color, fg=fg_color, font=font_loader.get_font(size=font_size))
 171                else:
 172                    widget.configure(bg=bg_color, fg=fg_color, font=(font_family, font_size))
 173                menu = widget['menu']
 174                if font_loader:
 175                    menu.configure(bg=bg_color, fg=fg_color, font=font_loader.get_font(size=font_size))
 176                else:
 177                    menu.configure(bg=bg_color, fg=fg_color, font=(font_family, font_size))
 178
 179    return {'font_loader':font_loader, 'font_family': font_family, 'font_size': font_size, 'bg_color': bg_color, 'fg_color': fg_color, 'active_color': active_color, 'inactive_color': inactive_color}
 180
 181class spacrFont:
 182    def __init__(self, font_name, font_style, font_size=12):
 183        """
 184        Initializes the FontLoader class.
 185
 186        Parameters:
 187        - font_name: str, the name of the font (e.g., 'OpenSans').
 188        - font_style: str, the style of the font (e.g., 'Regular', 'Bold').
 189        - font_size: int, the size of the font (default: 12).
 190        """
 191        self.font_name = font_name
 192        self.font_style = font_style
 193        self.font_size = font_size
 194
 195        # Determine the path based on the font name and style
 196        self.font_path = self.get_font_path(font_name, font_style)
 197
 198        # Register the font with Tkinter
 199        self.load_font()
 200
 201    def get_font_path(self, font_name, font_style):
 202        """
 203        Returns the font path based on the font name and style.
 204
 205        Parameters:
 206        - font_name: str, the name of the font.
 207        - font_style: str, the style of the font.
 208
 209        Returns:
 210        - str, the path to the font file.
 211        """
 212        base_dir = os.path.dirname(__file__)
 213        
 214        if font_name == 'OpenSans':
 215            if font_style == 'Regular':
 216                return os.path.join(base_dir, 'resources/font/open_sans/static/OpenSans-Regular.ttf')
 217            elif font_style == 'Bold':
 218                return os.path.join(base_dir, 'resources/font/open_sans/static/OpenSans-Bold.ttf')
 219            elif font_style == 'Italic':
 220                return os.path.join(base_dir, 'resources/font/open_sans/static/OpenSans-Italic.ttf')
 221            # Add more styles as needed
 222        # Add more fonts as needed
 223        
 224        raise ValueError(f"Font '{font_name}' with style '{font_style}' not found.")
 225
 226    def load_font(self):
 227        """
 228        Loads the font into Tkinter.
 229        """
 230        try:
 231            font.Font(family=self.font_name, size=self.font_size)
 232        except tk.TclError:
 233            # Load the font manually if it's not already loaded
 234            self.tk_font = font.Font(
 235                name=self.font_name,
 236                file=self.font_path,
 237                size=self.font_size
 238            )
 239
 240    def get_font(self, size=None):
 241        """
 242        Returns the font in the specified size.
 243
 244        Parameters:
 245        - size: int, the size of the font (optional).
 246
 247        Returns:
 248        - tkFont.Font object.
 249        """
 250        if size is None:
 251            size = self.font_size
 252        return font.Font(family=self.font_name, size=size)
 253
 254class spacrContainer(tk.Frame):
 255    def __init__(self, parent, orient=tk.VERTICAL, bg=None, *args, **kwargs):
 256        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
 257        self.orient = orient
 258        self.bg = bg if bg else 'lightgrey'
 259        self.sash_thickness = 10
 260
 261        self.panes = []
 262        self.sashes = []
 263        self.bind("<Configure>", self.on_configure)
 264
 265        self.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 266        self.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 267
 268    def add(self, widget, stretch='always'):
 269        print(f"Adding widget: {widget} with stretch: {stretch}")
 270        pane = tk.Frame(self, bg=self.bg)
 271        pane.grid_propagate(False)
 272        widget.grid(in_=pane, sticky="nsew")  # Use grid for the widget within the pane
 273        self.panes.append((pane, widget))
 274
 275        if len(self.panes) > 1:
 276            self.create_sash()
 277
 278        self.reposition_panes()
 279
 280    def create_sash(self):
 281        sash = tk.Frame(self, bg=self.bg, cursor='sb_v_double_arrow' if self.orient == tk.VERTICAL else 'sb_h_double_arrow', height=self.sash_thickness, width=self.sash_thickness)
 282        sash.bind("<Enter>", self.on_enter_sash)
 283        sash.bind("<Leave>", self.on_leave_sash)
 284        sash.bind("<ButtonPress-1>", self.start_resize)
 285        self.sashes.append(sash)
 286
 287    def reposition_panes(self):
 288        if not self.panes:
 289            return
 290
 291        total_size = self.winfo_height() if self.orient == tk.VERTICAL else self.winfo_width()
 292        pane_size = total_size // len(self.panes)
 293
 294        print(f"Total size: {total_size}, Pane size: {pane_size}, Number of panes: {len(self.panes)}")
 295
 296        for i, (pane, widget) in enumerate(self.panes):
 297            if self.orient == tk.VERTICAL:
 298                pane.grid(row=i * 2, column=0, sticky="nsew", pady=(0, self.sash_thickness if i < len(self.panes) - 1 else 0))
 299            else:
 300                pane.grid(row=0, column=i * 2, sticky="nsew", padx=(0, self.sash_thickness if i < len(self.panes) - 1 else 0))
 301
 302        for i, sash in enumerate(self.sashes):
 303            if self.orient == tk.VERTICAL:
 304                sash.grid(row=(i * 2) + 1, column=0, sticky="ew")
 305            else:
 306                sash.grid(row=0, column=(i * 2) + 1, sticky="ns")
 307
 308    def on_configure(self, event):
 309        print(f"Configuring container: {self}")
 310        self.reposition_panes()
 311
 312    def on_enter_sash(self, event):
 313        event.widget.config(bg='blue')
 314
 315    def on_leave_sash(self, event):
 316        event.widget.config(bg=self.bg)
 317
 318    def start_resize(self, event):
 319        sash = event.widget
 320        self.start_pos = event.y_root if self.orient == tk.VERTICAL else event.x_root
 321        self.start_size = sash.winfo_y() if self.orient == tk.VERTICAL else sash.winfo_x()
 322        sash.bind("<B1-Motion>", self.perform_resize)
 323
 324    def perform_resize(self, event):
 325        sash = event.widget
 326        delta = (event.y_root - self.start_pos) if self.orient == tk.VERTICAL else (event.x_root - self.start_pos)
 327        new_size = self.start_size + delta
 328
 329        for i, (pane, widget) in enumerate(self.panes):
 330            if self.orient == tk.VERTICAL:
 331                new_row = max(0, new_size // self.sash_thickness)
 332                if pane.winfo_y() >= new_size:
 333                    pane.grid_configure(row=new_row)
 334                elif pane.winfo_y() < new_size and i > 0:
 335                    previous_row = max(0, (new_size - pane.winfo_height()) // self.sash_thickness)
 336                    self.panes[i - 1][0].grid_configure(row=previous_row)
 337            else:
 338                new_col = max(0, new_size // self.sash_thickness)
 339                if pane.winfo_x() >= new_size:
 340                    pane.grid_configure(column=new_col)
 341                elif pane.winfo_x() < new_size and i > 0:
 342                    previous_col = max(0, (new_size - pane.winfo_width()) // self.sash_thickness)
 343                    self.panes[i - 1][0].grid_configure(column=previous_col)
 344
 345        self.reposition_panes()
 346
 347class spacrEntry(tk.Frame):
 348    def __init__(self, parent, textvariable=None, outline=False, width=None, *args, **kwargs):
 349        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
 350        
 351        # Set dark style
 352        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
 353        self.bg_color = style_out['inactive_color']
 354        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
 355        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
 356        self.outline = outline
 357        self.font_family = style_out['font_family']
 358        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
 359        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
 360        
 361        # Set the background color of the frame
 362        self.configure(bg=style_out['bg_color'])
 363
 364        # Create a canvas for the rounded rectangle background
 365        if width is None:
 366            self.canvas_width = 220  # Adjusted for padding
 367        else:
 368            self.canvas_width = width
 369        self.canvas_height = 40   # Adjusted for padding
 370        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=self.canvas_width, height=self.canvas_height, bd=0, highlightthickness=0, relief='ridge', bg=style_out['bg_color'])
 371        self.canvas.pack()
 372        
 373        # Create the entry widget
 374        if self.font_loader:
 375            self.entry = tk.Entry(self, textvariable=textvariable, bd=0, highlightthickness=0, fg=self.fg_color, font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size), bg=self.bg_color)
 376        else:
 377            self.entry = tk.Entry(self, textvariable=textvariable, bd=0, highlightthickness=0, fg=self.fg_color, font=(self.font_family, self.font_size), bg=self.bg_color)
 378        self.entry.place(relx=0.5, rely=0.5, anchor=tk.CENTER, width=self.canvas_width - 30, height=20)  # Centered positioning
 379        
 380        # Bind events to change the background color on focus
 381        self.entry.bind("<FocusIn>", self.on_focus_in)
 382        self.entry.bind("<FocusOut>", self.on_focus_out)
 383        
 384        self.draw_rounded_rectangle(self.bg_color)
 385
 386    def draw_rounded_rectangle(self, color):
 387        radius = 15  # Increased radius for more rounded corners
 388        x0, y0 = 10, 5
 389        x1, y1 = self.canvas_width - 10, self.canvas_height - 5
 390        self.canvas.delete("all")
 391        self.canvas.create_arc((x0, y0, x0 + radius, y0 + radius), start=90, extent=90, fill=color, outline=color)
 392        self.canvas.create_arc((x1 - radius, y0, x1, y0 + radius), start=0, extent=90, fill=color, outline=color)
 393        self.canvas.create_arc((x0, y1 - radius, x0 + radius, y1), start=180, extent=90, fill=color, outline=color)
 394        self.canvas.create_arc((x1 - radius, y1 - radius, x1, y1), start=270, extent=90, fill=color, outline=color)
 395        self.canvas.create_rectangle((x0 + radius / 2, y0, x1 - radius / 2, y1), fill=color, outline=color)
 396        self.canvas.create_rectangle((x0, y0 + radius / 2, x1, y1 - radius / 2), fill=color, outline=color)
 397    
 398    def on_focus_in(self, event):
 399        self.draw_rounded_rectangle(self.active_color)
 400        self.entry.config(bg=self.active_color)
 401    
 402    def on_focus_out(self, event):
 403        self.draw_rounded_rectangle(self.bg_color)
 404        self.entry.config(bg=self.bg_color)
 405
 406class spacrCheck(tk.Frame):
 407    def __init__(self, parent, text="", variable=None, *args, **kwargs):
 408        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
 409        
 410        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
 411        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
 412        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
 413        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
 414        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
 415        self.variable = variable
 416
 417        self.configure(bg=self.bg_color)
 418
 419        # Create a canvas for the rounded square background
 420        self.canvas_width = 20
 421        self.canvas_height = 20
 422        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=self.canvas_width, height=self.canvas_height, bd=0, highlightthickness=0, relief='ridge', bg=self.bg_color)
 423        self.canvas.pack()
 424
 425        # Draw the initial rounded square based on the variable's value
 426        self.draw_rounded_square(self.active_color if self.variable.get() else self.inactive_color)
 427
 428        # Bind variable changes to update the checkbox
 429        self.variable.trace_add('write', self.update_check)
 430
 431        # Bind click event to toggle the variable
 432        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle_variable)
 433
 434    def draw_rounded_square(self, color):
 435        radius = 5  # Adjust the radius for more rounded corners
 436        x0, y0 = 2, 2
 437        x1, y1 = 18, 18
 438        self.canvas.delete("all")
 439        self.canvas.create_arc((x0, y0, x0 + radius, y0 + radius), start=90, extent=90, fill=color, outline=self.fg_color)
 440        self.canvas.create_arc((x1 - radius, y0, x1, y0 + radius), start=0, extent=90, fill=color, outline=self.fg_color)
 441        self.canvas.create_arc((x0, y1 - radius, x0 + radius, y1), start=180, extent=90, fill=color, outline=self.fg_color)
 442        self.canvas.create_arc((x1 - radius, y1 - radius, x1, y1), start=270, extent=90, fill=color, outline=self.fg_color)
 443        self.canvas.create_rectangle((x0 + radius / 2, y0, x1 - radius / 2, y1), fill=color, outline=color)
 444        self.canvas.create_rectangle((x0, y0 + radius / 2, x1, y1 - radius / 2), fill=color, outline=color)
 445        self.canvas.create_line(x0 + radius / 2, y0, x1 - radius / 2, y0, fill=self.fg_color)
 446        self.canvas.create_line(x0 + radius / 2, y1, x1 - radius / 2, y1, fill=self.fg_color)
 447        self.canvas.create_line(x0, y0 + radius / 2, x0, y1 - radius / 2, fill=self.fg_color)
 448        self.canvas.create_line(x1, y0 + radius / 2, x1, y1 - radius / 2, fill=self.fg_color)
 449
 450    def update_check(self, *args):
 451        self.draw_rounded_square(self.active_color if self.variable.get() else self.inactive_color)
 452
 453    def toggle_variable(self, event):
 454        self.variable.set(not self.variable.get())
 455
 456class spacrCombo(tk.Frame):
 457    def __init__(self, parent, textvariable=None, values=None, width=None, *args, **kwargs):
 458        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
 459        
 460        # Set dark style
 461        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
 462        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
 463        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
 464        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
 465        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
 466        self.font_family = style_out['font_family']
 467        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
 468        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
 469
 470        self.values = values or []
 471
 472        # Create a canvas for the rounded rectangle background
 473        self.canvas_width = width if width is not None else 220  # Adjusted for padding
 474        self.canvas_height = 40   # Adjusted for padding
 475        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=self.canvas_width, height=self.canvas_height, bd=0, highlightthickness=0, relief='ridge', bg=self.bg_color)
 476        self.canvas.pack()
 477        
 478        self.var = textvariable if textvariable else tk.StringVar()
 479        self.selected_value = self.var.get()
 480        
 481        # Create the label to display the selected value
 482        if self.font_loader:
 483            self.label = tk.Label(self, text=self.selected_value, bg=self.inactive_color, fg=self.fg_color, font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size))
 484        else:
 485            self.label = tk.Label(self, text=self.selected_value, bg=self.inactive_color, fg=self.fg_color, font=(self.font_family, self.font_size))
 486        self.label.place(relx=0.5, rely=0.5, anchor=tk.CENTER)
 487        
 488        # Bind events to open the dropdown menu
 489        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.on_click)
 490        self.label.bind("<Button-1>", self.on_click)
 491        
 492        self.draw_rounded_rectangle(self.inactive_color)
 493
 494        self.dropdown_menu = None
 495
 496    def draw_rounded_rectangle(self, color):
 497        radius = 15  # Increased radius for more rounded corners
 498        x0, y0 = 10, 5
 499        x1, y1 = self.canvas_width - 10, self.canvas_height - 5
 500        self.canvas.delete("all")
 501        self.canvas.create_arc((x0, y0, x0 + radius, y0 + radius), start=90, extent=90, fill=color, outline=color)
 502        self.canvas.create_arc((x1 - radius, y0, x1, y0 + radius), start=0, extent=90, fill=color, outline=color)
 503        self.canvas.create_arc((x0, y1 - radius, x0 + radius, y1), start=180, extent=90, fill=color, outline=color)
 504        self.canvas.create_arc((x1 - radius, y1 - radius, x1, y1), start=270, extent=90, fill=color, outline=color)
 505        self.canvas.create_rectangle((x0 + radius / 2, y0, x1 - radius / 2, y1), fill=color, outline=color)
 506        self.canvas.create_rectangle((x0, y0 + radius / 2, x1, y1 - radius / 2), fill=color, outline=color)
 507        self.label.config(bg=color)  # Update label background to match rectangle color
 508
 509    def on_click(self, event):
 510        if self.dropdown_menu is None:
 511            self.open_dropdown()
 512        else:
 513            self.close_dropdown()
 514
 515    def open_dropdown(self):
 516        self.draw_rounded_rectangle(self.active_color)
 517        
 518        self.dropdown_menu = tk.Toplevel(self)
 519        self.dropdown_menu.wm_overrideredirect(True)
 520        
 521        x, y, width, height = self.winfo_rootx(), self.winfo_rooty(), self.winfo_width(), self.winfo_height()
 522        self.dropdown_menu.geometry(f"{width}x{len(self.values) * 30}+{x}+{y + height}")
 523        
 524        for index, value in enumerate(self.values):
 525            display_text = value if value is not None else 'None'
 526            if self.font_loader:
 527                item = tk.Label(self.dropdown_menu, text=display_text, bg=self.inactive_color, fg=self.fg_color, font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size), anchor='w')
 528            else:
 529                item = tk.Label(self.dropdown_menu, text=display_text, bg=self.inactive_color, fg=self.fg_color, font=(self.font_family, self.font_size), anchor='w')
 530            item.pack(fill='both')
 531            item.bind("<Button-1>", lambda e, v=value: self.on_select(v))
 532            item.bind("<Enter>", lambda e, w=item: w.config(bg=self.active_color))
 533            item.bind("<Leave>", lambda e, w=item: w.config(bg=self.inactive_color))
 534
 535    def close_dropdown(self):
 536        self.draw_rounded_rectangle(self.inactive_color)
 537        
 538        if self.dropdown_menu:
 539            self.dropdown_menu.destroy()
 540            self.dropdown_menu = None
 541
 542    def on_select(self, value):
 543        display_text = value if value is not None else 'None'
 544        self.var.set(value)
 545        self.label.config(text=display_text)
 546        self.selected_value = value
 547        self.close_dropdown()
 548
 549    def set(self, value):
 550        display_text = value if value is not None else 'None'
 551        self.var.set(value)
 552        self.label.config(text=display_text)
 553        self.selected_value = value
 554
 555class spacrDropdownMenu(tk.Frame):
 556
 557    def __init__(self, parent, variable, options, command=None, font=None, size=50, **kwargs):
 558        super().__init__(parent, **kwargs)
 559        self.variable = variable
 560        self.options = options
 561        self.command = command
 562        self.text = "Settings"
 563        self.size = size
 564
 565        # Apply dark style and get color settings
 566        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
 567        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
 568        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
 569
 570        # Button size configuration
 571        self.button_width = int(size * 3)
 572        self.canvas_width = self.button_width + 4
 573        self.canvas_height = self.size + 4
 574
 575        # Create the canvas and rounded button
 576        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=self.canvas_width, height=self.canvas_height, highlightthickness=0, bg=style_out['bg_color'])
 577        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=0)
 578
 579        # Apply dark style and get color settings
 580        color_settings = set_dark_style(ttk.Style(), containers=[self], widgets=[self.canvas])
 581        self.inactive_color = color_settings['inactive_color']
 582        self.active_color = color_settings['active_color']
 583        self.fg_color = color_settings['fg_color']
 584        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
 585
 586        # Create the button with rounded edges
 587        self.button_bg = self.create_rounded_rectangle(2, 2, self.button_width + 2, self.size + 2, radius=20, fill=self.inactive_color, outline=self.inactive_color)
 588
 589        # Create and place the label on the button
 590        if self.font_loader:
 591            self.font_style = self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size)
 592        else:
 593            self.font_style = font if font else ("Arial", 12)
 594
 595        self.button_text = self.canvas.create_text(self.button_width // 2, self.size // 2 + 2, text=self.text, fill=self.fg_color, font=self.font_style, anchor="center")
 596
 597        # Bind events for button behavior
 598        self.bind("<Enter>", self.on_enter)
 599        self.bind("<Leave>", self.on_leave)
 600        self.bind("<Button-1>", self.on_click)
 601        self.canvas.bind("<Enter>", self.on_enter)
 602        self.canvas.bind("<Leave>", self.on_leave)
 603        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.on_click)
 604
 605        # Create a popup menu with the desired background color
 606        self.menu = tk.Menu(self, tearoff=0, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color)
 607        for option in self.options:
 608            self.menu.add_command(label=option, command=lambda opt=option: self.on_select(opt))
 609
 610    def create_rounded_rectangle(self, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=20, **kwargs):
 611        points = [
 612            x1 + radius, y1,
 613            x2 - radius, y1,
 614            x2 - radius, y1,
 615            x2, y1,
 616            x2, y1 + radius,
 617            x2, y2 - radius,
 618            x2, y2 - radius,
 619            x2, y2,
 620            x2 - radius, y2,
 621            x1 + radius, y2,
 622            x1 + radius, y2,
 623            x1, y2,
 624            x1, y2 - radius,
 625            x1, y2 - radius,
 626            x1, y1 + radius,
 627            x1, y1 + radius,
 628            x1, y1
 629        ]
 630        return self.canvas.create_polygon(points, **kwargs, smooth=True)
 631
 632    def on_enter(self, event=None):
 633        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.button_bg, fill=self.active_color)
 634
 635    def on_leave(self, event=None):
 636        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.button_bg, fill=self.inactive_color)
 637
 638    def on_click(self, event=None):
 639        self.post_menu()
 640
 641    def post_menu(self):
 642        x, y, width, height = self.winfo_rootx(), self.winfo_rooty(), self.winfo_width(), self.winfo_height()
 643        self.menu.post(x, y + height)
 644
 645    def on_select(self, option):
 646        if self.command:
 647            self.command(option)
 648
 649    def update_styles(self, active_categories=None):
 650        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style(), widgets=[self.menu])
 651
 652        if active_categories is not None:
 653            for idx in range(self.menu.index("end") + 1):
 654                option = self.menu.entrycget(idx, "label")
 655                if option in active_categories:
 656                    self.menu.entryconfig(idx, background=style_out['active_color'], foreground=style_out['fg_color'])
 657                else:
 658                    self.menu.entryconfig(idx, background=style_out['bg_color'], foreground=style_out['fg_color'])
 659
 660class spacrCheckbutton(ttk.Checkbutton):
 661    def __init__(self, parent, text="", variable=None, command=None, *args, **kwargs):
 662        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
 663        self.text = text
 664        self.variable = variable if variable else tk.BooleanVar()
 665        self.command = command
 666        self.configure(text=self.text, variable=self.variable, command=self.command, style='Spacr.TCheckbutton')
 667        style = ttk.Style()
 668        _ = set_dark_style(style, widgets=[self])
 669
 670class spacrProgressBar(ttk.Progressbar):
 671    def __init__(self, parent, label=True, *args, **kwargs):
 672        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
 673
 674        # Get the style colors
 675        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
 676
 677        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
 678        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
 679        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
 680        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
 681        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
 682        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
 683
 684        # Configure the style for the progress bar
 685        self.style = ttk.Style()
 686        
 687        # Remove any borders and ensure the active color fills the entire space
 688        self.style.configure(
 689            "spacr.Horizontal.TProgressbar",
 690            troughcolor=self.inactive_color, # Set the trough to bg color
 691            background=self.active_color,    # Active part is the active color
 692            borderwidth=0,                   # Remove border width
 693            pbarrelief="flat",               # Flat relief for the progress bar
 694            troughrelief="flat",             # Flat relief for the trough
 695            thickness=20,                    # Set the thickness of the progress bar
 696            darkcolor=self.active_color,     # Ensure darkcolor matches the active color
 697            lightcolor=self.active_color,    # Ensure lightcolor matches the active color
 698            bordercolor=self.bg_color        # Set the border color to the background color to hide it
 699        )
 700
 701        self.configure(style="spacr.Horizontal.TProgressbar")
 702
 703        # Set initial value to 0
 704        self['value'] = 0
 705
 706        # Track whether to show the progress label
 707        self.label = label
 708
 709        # Create the progress label with text wrapping
 710        if self.label:
 711            self.progress_label = tk.Label(
 712                parent,
 713                text="Processing: 0/0",
 714                anchor='w',
 715                justify='left',
 716                bg=self.inactive_color,
 717                fg=self.fg_color,
 718                wraplength=300,
 719                font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size)
 720            )
 721            self.progress_label.grid_forget()
 722
 723        # Initialize attributes for time and operation
 724        self.operation_type = None
 725        self.additional_info = None
 726
 727    def set_label_position(self):
 728        if self.label and self.progress_label:
 729            row_info = self.grid_info().get('rowID', 0)
 730            col_info = self.grid_info().get('columnID', 0)
 731            col_span = self.grid_info().get('columnspan', 1)
 732            self.progress_label.grid(row=row_info + 1, column=col_info, columnspan=col_span, pady=5, padx=5, sticky='ew')
 733
 734    def update_label(self):
 735        if self.label and self.progress_label:
 736            # Start with the base progress information
 737            label_text = f"Processing: {self['value']}/{self['maximum']}"
 738            
 739            # Include the operation type if it exists
 740            if self.operation_type:
 741                label_text += f", {self.operation_type}"
 742            
 743            # Handle additional info without adding newlines
 744            if hasattr(self, 'additional_info') and self.additional_info:
 745                # Join all additional info items with a space and ensure they're on the same line
 746                items = self.additional_info.split(", ")
 747                formatted_additional_info = " ".join(items)
 748
 749                # Append the additional info to the label_text, ensuring it's all in one line
 750                label_text += f" {formatted_additional_info.strip()}"
 751
 752            # Update the progress label
 753            self.progress_label.config(text=label_text)
 754
 755class spacrSlider(tk.Frame):
 756    def __init__(self, master=None, length=None, thickness=2, knob_radius=10, position="center", from_=0, to=100, value=None, show_index=False, command=None, **kwargs):
 757        super().__init__(master, **kwargs)
 758
 759        self.specified_length = length  # Store the specified length, if any
 760        self.knob_radius = knob_radius
 761        self.thickness = thickness
 762        self.knob_position = knob_radius  # Start at the beginning of the slider
 763        self.slider_line = None
 764        self.knob = None
 765        self.position = position.lower()  # Store the position option
 766        self.offset = 0  # Initialize offset
 767        self.from_ = from_  # Minimum value of the slider
 768        self.to = to  # Maximum value of the slider
 769        self.value = value if value is not None else from_  # Initial value of the slider
 770        self.show_index = show_index  # Whether to show the index Entry widget
 771        self.command = command  # Callback function to handle value changes
 772
 773        # Initialize the style and colors
 774        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
 775        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
 776        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
 777        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
 778        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
 779
 780        # Configure the frame's background color
 781        self.configure(bg=self.bg_color)
 782
 783        # Create a frame for the slider and entry if needed
 784        self.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
 785
 786        # Entry widget for showing and editing index, if enabled
 787        if self.show_index:
 788            self.index_var = tk.StringVar(value=str(int(self.value)))
 789            self.index_entry = tk.Entry(self, textvariable=self.index_var, width=5, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, insertbackground=self.fg_color)
 790            self.index_entry.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=5)
 791            # Bind the entry to update the slider on change
 792            self.index_entry.bind("<Return>", self.update_slider_from_entry)
 793
 794        # Create the slider canvas
 795        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, height=knob_radius * 2, bg=self.bg_color, highlightthickness=0)
 796        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="ew")
 797
 798        # Set initial length to specified length or default value
 799        self.length = self.specified_length if self.specified_length is not None else self.canvas.winfo_reqwidth()
 800
 801        # Calculate initial knob position based on the initial value
 802        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
 803
 804        # Bind resize event to dynamically adjust the slider length if no length is specified
 805        self.canvas.bind("<Configure>", self.resize_slider)
 806
 807        # Draw the slider components
 808        self.draw_slider(inactive=True)
 809
 810        # Bind mouse events to the knob and slider
 811        self.canvas.bind("<B1-Motion>", self.move_knob)
 812        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.activate_knob)  # Activate knob on click
 813        self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-1>", self.release_knob)  # Trigger command on release
 814
 815    def resize_slider(self, event):
 816        if self.specified_length is not None:
 817            self.length = self.specified_length
 818        else:
 819            self.length = int(event.width * 0.9)  # 90% of the container width
 820        
 821        # Calculate the horizontal offset based on the position
 822        if self.position == "center":
 823            self.offset = (event.width - self.length) // 2
 824        elif self.position == "right":
 825            self.offset = event.width - self.length
 826        else:  # position is "left"
 827            self.offset = 0
 828
 829        # Update the knob position after resizing
 830        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
 831        self.draw_slider(inactive=True)
 832
 833    def value_to_position(self, value):
 834        if self.to == self.from_:
 835            return self.knob_radius
 836        relative_value = (value - self.from_) / (self.to - self.from_)
 837        return self.knob_radius + relative_value * (self.length - 2 * self.knob_radius)
 838
 839    def position_to_value(self, position):
 840        if self.to == self.from_:
 841            return self.from_
 842        relative_position = (position - self.knob_radius) / (self.length - 2 * self.knob_radius)
 843        return self.from_ + relative_position * (self.to - self.from_)
 844
 845    def draw_slider(self, inactive=False):
 846        self.canvas.delete("all")
 847
 848        self.slider_line = self.canvas.create_line(
 849            self.offset + self.knob_radius, 
 850            self.knob_radius, 
 851            self.offset + self.length - self.knob_radius, 
 852            self.knob_radius, 
 853            fill=self.fg_color, 
 854            width=self.thickness
 855        )
 856
 857        knob_color = self.inactive_color if inactive else self.active_color
 858        self.knob = self.canvas.create_oval(
 859            self.offset + self.knob_position - self.knob_radius, 
 860            self.knob_radius - self.knob_radius, 
 861            self.offset + self.knob_position + self.knob_radius, 
 862            self.knob_radius + self.knob_radius, 
 863            fill=knob_color, 
 864            outline=""
 865        )
 866
 867    def move_knob(self, event):
 868        new_position = min(max(event.x - self.offset, self.knob_radius), self.length - self.knob_radius)
 869        self.knob_position = new_position
 870        self.value = self.position_to_value(self.knob_position)
 871        self.canvas.coords(
 872            self.knob, 
 873            self.offset + self.knob_position - self.knob_radius, 
 874            self.knob_radius - self.knob_radius, 
 875            self.offset + self.knob_position + self.knob_radius, 
 876            self.knob_radius + self.knob_radius
 877        )
 878        if self.show_index:
 879            self.index_var.set(str(int(self.value)))
 880
 881    def activate_knob(self, event):
 882        self.draw_slider(inactive=False)
 883        self.move_knob(event)
 884
 885    def release_knob(self, event):
 886        self.draw_slider(inactive=True)
 887        if self.command:
 888            self.command(self.value)  # Call the command with the final value when the knob is released
 889
 890    def set_to(self, new_to):
 891        self.to = new_to
 892        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
 893        self.draw_slider(inactive=False)
 894
 895    def get(self):
 896        return self.value
 897
 898    def set(self, value):
 899        """Set the slider's value and update the knob position."""
 900        self.value = max(self.from_, min(value, self.to))  # Ensure the value is within bounds
 901        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
 902        self.draw_slider(inactive=False)
 903        if self.show_index:
 904            self.index_var.set(str(int(self.value)))
 905
 906    def jump_to_click(self, event):
 907        self.activate_knob(event)
 908
 909    def update_slider_from_entry(self, event):
 910        """Update the slider's value from the entry."""
 911        try:
 912            index = int(self.index_var.get())
 913            self.set(index)
 914            if self.command:
 915                self.command(self.value)
 916        except ValueError:
 917            pass
 918
 919def spacrScrollbarStyle(style, inactive_color, active_color):
 920    # Check if custom elements already exist to avoid duplication
 921    if not style.element_names().count('custom.Vertical.Scrollbar.trough'):
 922        style.element_create('custom.Vertical.Scrollbar.trough', 'from', 'clam')
 923    if not style.element_names().count('custom.Vertical.Scrollbar.thumb'):
 924        style.element_create('custom.Vertical.Scrollbar.thumb', 'from', 'clam')
 925
 926    style.layout('Custom.Vertical.TScrollbar',
 927                 [('Vertical.Scrollbar.trough', {'children': [('Vertical.Scrollbar.thumb', {'expand': '1', 'sticky': 'nswe'})], 'sticky': 'ns'})])
 928
 929    style.configure('Custom.Vertical.TScrollbar',
 930                    background=inactive_color,
 931                    troughcolor=inactive_color,
 932                    bordercolor=inactive_color,
 933                    lightcolor=inactive_color,
 934                    darkcolor=inactive_color)
 935
 936    style.map('Custom.Vertical.TScrollbar',
 937              background=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', active_color)],
 938              troughcolor=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', inactive_color)],
 939              bordercolor=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', inactive_color)],
 940              lightcolor=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', active_color)],
 941              darkcolor=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', active_color)])
 942
 943class spacrFrame(ttk.Frame):
 944    def __init__(self, container, width=None, *args, bg='black', radius=20, scrollbar=True, textbox=False, **kwargs):
 945        super().__init__(container, *args, **kwargs)
 946        self.configure(style='TFrame')
 947        if width is None:
 948            screen_width = self.winfo_screenwidth()
 949            width = screen_width // 4
 950
 951        # Create the canvas
 952        canvas = tk.Canvas(self, bg=bg, width=width, highlightthickness=0)
 953        self.rounded_rectangle(canvas, 0, 0, width, self.winfo_screenheight(), radius, fill=bg)
 954
 955        # Define scrollbar styles
 956        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
 957        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
 958        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
 959        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']  # Foreground color for text
 960
 961        # Set custom scrollbar style
 962        style = ttk.Style()
 963        spacrScrollbarStyle(style, self.inactive_color, self.active_color)
 964
 965        # Create scrollbar with custom style if scrollbar option is True
 966        if scrollbar:
 967            scrollbar_widget = ttk.Scrollbar(self, orient="vertical", command=canvas.yview, style='Custom.Vertical.TScrollbar')
 968        
 969        if textbox:
 970            self.scrollable_frame = tk.Text(canvas, bg=bg, fg=self.fg_color, wrap=tk.WORD)
 971        else:
 972            self.scrollable_frame = ttk.Frame(canvas, style='TFrame')
 973        
 974        self.scrollable_frame.bind(
 975            "<Configure>",
 976            lambda e: canvas.configure(scrollregion=canvas.bbox("all"))
 977        )
 978        canvas.create_window((0, 0), window=self.scrollable_frame, anchor="nw")
 979        if scrollbar:
 980            canvas.configure(yscrollcommand=scrollbar_widget.set)
 981        
 982        canvas.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
 983        if scrollbar:
 984            scrollbar_widget.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="ns")
 985
 986        self.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 987        self.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 988        if scrollbar:
 989            self.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=0)
 990        
 991        _ = set_dark_style(style, containers=[self], widgets=[canvas, self.scrollable_frame])
 992        if scrollbar:
 993            _ = set_dark_style(style, widgets=[scrollbar_widget])
 994
 995    def rounded_rectangle(self, canvas, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=20, **kwargs):
 996        points = [
 997            x1 + radius, y1,
 998            x2 - radius, y1,
 999            x2 - radius, y1,
1000            x2, y1,
1001            x2, y1 + radius,
1002            x2, y2 - radius,
1003            x2, y2 - radius,
1004            x2, y2,
1005            x2 - radius, y2,
1006            x1 + radius, y2,
1007            x1 + radius, y2,
1008            x1, y2,
1009            x1, y2 - radius,
1010            x1, y2 - radius,
1011            x1, y1 + radius,
1012            x1, y1 + radius,
1013            x1, y1
1014        ]
1015        return canvas.create_polygon(points, **kwargs, smooth=True)
1016
1017class spacrLabel(tk.Frame):
1018    def __init__(self, parent, text="", font=None, style=None, align="right", height=None, **kwargs):
1019        valid_kwargs = {k: v for k, v in kwargs.items() if k not in ['foreground', 'background', 'font', 'anchor', 'justify', 'wraplength']}
1020        super().__init__(parent, **valid_kwargs)
1021        
1022        self.text = text
1023        self.align = align
1024
1025        if height is None:
1026            screen_height = self.winfo_screenheight()
1027            label_height = screen_height // 50
1028            label_width = label_height * 10
1029        else:
1030            label_height = height
1031            label_width = label_height * 10
1032
1033        self.style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
1034        self.font_style = self.style_out['font_family']
1035        self.font_size = self.style_out['font_size']
1036        self.font_family = self.style_out['font_family']
1037        self.font_loader = self.style_out['font_loader']
1038
1039        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=label_width, height=label_height, highlightthickness=0, bg=self.style_out['bg_color'])
1040        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="ew")
1041        if self.style_out['font_family'] != 'OpenSans':
1042            self.font_style = font if font else tkFont.Font(family=self.style_out['font_family'], size=self.style_out['font_size'], weight=tkFont.NORMAL)
1043        self.style = style
1044
1045        if self.align == "center":
1046            anchor_value = tk.CENTER
1047            text_anchor = 'center'
1048        else:  # default to right alignment
1049            anchor_value = tk.E
1050            text_anchor = 'e'
1051
1052        if self.style:
1053            ttk_style = ttk.Style()
1054            if self.font_loader:
1055                ttk_style.configure(self.style, font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size), background=self.style_out['bg_color'], foreground=self.style_out['fg_color'])
1056            else:
1057                ttk_style.configure(self.style, font=self.font_style, background=self.style_out['bg_color'], foreground=self.style_out['fg_color'])
1058            self.label_text = ttk.Label(self.canvas, text=self.text, style=self.style, anchor=text_anchor)
1059            self.label_text.pack(fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)
1060        else:
1061            if self.font_loader:
1062                self.label_text = self.canvas.create_text(label_width // 2 if self.align == "center" else label_width - 5, 
1063                                                          label_height // 2, text=self.text, fill=self.style_out['fg_color'], 
1064                                                          font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size), anchor=anchor_value, justify=tk.RIGHT)
1065            else:
1066                self.label_text = self.canvas.create_text(label_width // 2 if self.align == "center" else label_width - 5, 
1067                                                        label_height // 2, text=self.text, fill=self.style_out['fg_color'], 
1068                                                        font=self.font_style, anchor=anchor_value, justify=tk.RIGHT)
1069        
1070        _ = set_dark_style(ttk.Style(), containers=[self], widgets=[self.canvas])
1071
1072    def set_text(self, text):
1073        if self.style:
1074            self.label_text.config(text=text)
1075        else:
1076            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.label_text, text=text)
1077
1078class spacrButton(tk.Frame):
1079    def __init__(self, parent, text="", command=None, font=None, icon_name=None, size=50, show_text=True, outline=False, animation=True, *args, **kwargs):
1080        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
1081        
1082        self.text = text.capitalize()  # Capitalize only the first letter of the text
1083        self.command = command
1084        self.icon_name = icon_name if icon_name else text.lower()
1085        self.size = size
1086        self.show_text = show_text
1087        self.outline = outline
1088        self.animation = animation  # Add animation attribute
1089
1090        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
1091        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
1092        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
1093
1094        if self.show_text:
1095            self.button_width = int(size * 3)
1096        else:
1097            self.button_width = self.size  # Make the button width equal to the size if show_text is False
1098
1099        # Create the canvas first
1100        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=self.button_width + 4, height=self.size + 4, highlightthickness=0, bg=style_out['bg_color'])
1101        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=0)
1102
1103        # Apply dark style and get color settings
1104        color_settings = set_dark_style(ttk.Style(), containers=[self], widgets=[self.canvas])
1105
1106        self.inactive_color = color_settings['inactive_color']
1107
1108        if self.outline:
1109            self.button_bg = self.create_rounded_rectangle(2, 2, self.button_width + 2, self.size + 2, radius=20, fill=self.inactive_color, outline=color_settings['fg_color'])
1110        else:
1111            self.button_bg = self.create_rounded_rectangle(2, 2, self.button_width + 2, self.size + 2, radius=20, fill=self.inactive_color, outline=self.inactive_color)
1112        
1113        self.load_icon()
1114        if self.font_loader:
1115            self.font_style = self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size)
1116        else:
1117            self.font_style = font if font else ("Arial", 12)
1118        
1119        if self.show_text:
1120            self.button_text = self.canvas.create_text(self.size + 10, self.size // 2 + 2, text=self.text, fill=color_settings['fg_color'], font=self.font_style, anchor="w")  # Align text to the left of the specified point
1121
1122        self.bind("<Enter>", self.on_enter)
1123        self.bind("<Leave>", self.on_leave)
1124        self.bind("<Button-1>", self.on_click)
1125        self.canvas.bind("<Enter>", self.on_enter)
1126        self.canvas.bind("<Leave>", self.on_leave)
1127        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.on_click)
1128
1129        self.bg_color = self.inactive_color
1130        self.active_color = color_settings['active_color']
1131        self.fg_color = color_settings['fg_color']
1132        self.is_zoomed_in = False  # Track zoom state for smooth transitions
1133
1134    def load_icon(self):
1135        icon_path = self.get_icon_path(self.icon_name)
1136        try:
1137            icon_image = Image.open(icon_path)
1138        except (FileNotFoundError, Image.UnidentifiedImageError):
1139            try:
1140                icon_path = icon_path.replace(' ', '_')
1141                icon_image = Image.open(icon_path)
1142            except (FileNotFoundError, Image.UnidentifiedImageError):
1143                icon_image = Image.open(self.get_icon_path("default"))
1144                print(f'Icon not found: {icon_path}. Using default icon instead.')
1145
1146        initial_size = int(self.size * 0.65)  # 65% of button size initially
1147        self.original_icon_image = icon_image.resize((initial_size, initial_size), Image.Resampling.LANCZOS)
1148        self.icon_photo = ImageTk.PhotoImage(self.original_icon_image)
1149
1150        self.button_icon = self.canvas.create_image(self.size // 2 + 2, self.size // 2 + 2, image=self.icon_photo)
1151        self.canvas.image = self.icon_photo  # Keep a reference to avoid garbage collection
1152
1153    def get_icon_path(self, icon_name):
1154        icon_dir = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), 'resources', 'icons')
1155        return os.path.join(icon_dir, f"{icon_name}.png")
1156
1157    def on_enter(self, event=None):
1158        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.button_bg, fill=self.active_color)
1159        self.update_description(event)
1160        if self.animation and not self.is_zoomed_in:
1161            self.animate_zoom(0.85)  # Zoom in the icon to 85% of button size
1162
1163    def on_leave(self, event=None):
1164        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.button_bg, fill=self.inactive_color)
1165        self.clear_description(event)
1166        if self.animation and self.is_zoomed_in:
1167            self.animate_zoom(0.65)  # Reset the icon size to 65% of button size
1168
1169    def on_click(self, event=None):
1170        if self.command:
1171            self.command()
1172
1173    def create_rounded_rectangle(self, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=20, **kwargs):
1174        points = [
1175            x1 + radius, y1,
1176            x2 - radius, y1,
1177            x2 - radius, y1,
1178            x2, y1,
1179            x2, y1 + radius,
1180            x2, y2 - radius,
1181            x2, y2 - radius,
1182            x2, y2,
1183            x2 - radius, y2,
1184            x1 + radius, y2,
1185            x1 + radius, y2,
1186            x1, y2,
1187            x1, y2 - radius,
1188            x1, y2 - radius,
1189            x1, y1 + radius,
1190            x1, y1 + radius,
1191            x1, y1
1192        ]
1193        return self.canvas.create_polygon(points, **kwargs, smooth=True)
1194    
1195    def update_description(self, event):
1196        parent = self.master
1197        while parent:
1198            if hasattr(parent, 'show_description'):
1199                parent.show_description(parent.main_buttons.get(self, parent.additional_buttons.get(self, "No description available.")))
1200                return
1201            parent = parent.master
1202
1203    def clear_description(self, event):
1204        parent = self.master
1205        while parent:
1206            if hasattr(parent, 'clear_description'):
1207                parent.clear_description()
1208                return
1209            parent = parent.master
1210
1211    def animate_zoom(self, target_scale, steps=10, delay=10):
1212        current_scale = 0.85 if self.is_zoomed_in else 0.65
1213        step_scale = (target_scale - current_scale) / steps
1214        self._animate_step(current_scale, step_scale, steps, delay)
1215
1216    def _animate_step(self, current_scale, step_scale, steps, delay):
1217        if steps > 0:
1218            new_scale = current_scale + step_scale
1219            self.zoom_icon(new_scale)
1220            self.after(delay, self._animate_step, new_scale, step_scale, steps - 1, delay)
1221        else:
1222            self.is_zoomed_in = not self.is_zoomed_in
1223
1224    def zoom_icon(self, scale_factor):
1225        # Resize the original icon image
1226        new_size = int(self.size * scale_factor)
1227        resized_icon = self.original_icon_image.resize((new_size, new_size), Image.Resampling.LANCZOS)
1228        self.icon_photo = ImageTk.PhotoImage(resized_icon)
1229
1230        # Update the icon on the canvas
1231        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.button_icon, image=self.icon_photo)
1232        self.canvas.image = self.icon_photo
1233
1234class spacrSwitch(ttk.Frame):
1235    def __init__(self, parent, text="", variable=None, command=None, *args, **kwargs):
1236        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
1237        self.text = text
1238        self.variable = variable if variable else tk.BooleanVar()
1239        self.command = command
1240        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=40, height=20, highlightthickness=0, bd=0)
1241        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=1, padx=(10, 0))
1242        self.switch_bg = self.create_rounded_rectangle(2, 2, 38, 18, radius=9, outline="", fill="#fff")
1243        self.switch = self.canvas.create_oval(4, 4, 16, 16, outline="", fill="#800080")
1244        self.label = spacrLabel(self, text=self.text)
1245        self.label.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=(0, 10))
1246        self.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle)
1247        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle)
1248        self.label.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle)
1249        self.update_switch()
1250
1251        style = ttk.Style()
1252        _ = set_dark_style(style, containers=[self], widgets=[self.canvas, self.label])
1253
1254    def toggle(self, event=None):
1255        self.variable.set(not self.variable.get())
1256        self.animate_switch()
1257        if self.command:
1258            self.command()
1259
1260    def update_switch(self):
1261        if self.variable.get():
1262            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.switch, fill="#008080")
1263            self.canvas.coords(self.switch, 24, 4, 36, 16)
1264        else:
1265            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.switch, fill="#800080")
1266            self.canvas.coords(self.switch, 4, 4, 16, 16)
1267
1268    def animate_switch(self):
1269        if self.variable.get():
1270            start_x, end_x = 4, 24
1271            final_color = "#008080"
1272        else:
1273            start_x, end_x = 24, 4
1274            final_color = "#800080"
1275
1276        self.animate_movement(start_x, end_x, final_color)
1277
1278    def animate_movement(self, start_x, end_x, final_color):
1279        step = 1 if start_x < end_x else -1
1280        for i in range(start_x, end_x, step):
1281            self.canvas.coords(self.switch, i, 4, i + 12, 16)
1282            self.canvas.update()
1283            self.after(10)
1284        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.switch, fill=final_color)
1285
1286    def get(self):
1287        return self.variable.get()
1288
1289    def set(self, value):
1290        self.variable.set(value)
1291        self.update_switch()
1292
1293    def create_rounded_rectangle(self, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=9, **kwargs):
1294        points = [x1 + radius, y1,
1295                  x1 + radius, y1,
1296                  x2 - radius, y1,
1297                  x2 - radius, y1,
1298                  x2, y1,
1299                  x2, y1 + radius,
1300                  x2, y1 + radius,
1301                  x2, y2 - radius,
1302                  x2, y2 - radius,
1303                  x2, y2,
1304                  x2 - radius, y2,
1305                  x2 - radius, y2,
1306                  x1 + radius, y2,
1307                  x1 + radius, y2,
1308                  x1, y2,
1309                  x1, y2 - radius,
1310                  x1, y2 - radius,
1311                  x1, y1 + radius,
1312                  x1, y1 + radius,
1313                  x1, y1]
1314
1315        return self.canvas.create_polygon(points, **kwargs, smooth=True)
1316
1317class spacrToolTip:
1318    def __init__(self, widget, text):
1319        self.widget = widget
1320        self.text = text
1321        self.tooltip_window = None
1322        widget.bind("<Enter>", self.show_tooltip)
1323        widget.bind("<Leave>", self.hide_tooltip)
1324
1325    def show_tooltip(self, event):
1326        x = event.x_root + 20
1327        y = event.y_root + 10
1328        self.tooltip_window = tk.Toplevel(self.widget)
1329        self.tooltip_window.wm_overrideredirect(True)
1330        self.tooltip_window.wm_geometry(f"+{x}+{y}")
1331        label = tk.Label(self.tooltip_window, text=self.text, relief='flat', borderwidth=0)
1332        label.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=5, pady=5)
1333
1334        style = ttk.Style()
1335        _ = set_dark_style(style, containers=[self.tooltip_window], widgets=[label])
1336
1337    def hide_tooltip(self, event):
1338        if self.tooltip_window:
1339            self.tooltip_window.destroy()
1340        self.tooltip_window = None
1341
1342class ModifyMaskApp:
1343    def __init__(self, root, folder_path, scale_factor):
1344        self.root = root
1345        self.folder_path = folder_path
1346        self.scale_factor = scale_factor
1347        self.image_filenames = sorted([f for f in os.listdir(folder_path) if f.endswith(('.png', '.jpg', '.jpeg', '.tif', '.tiff'))])
1348        self.masks_folder = os.path.join(folder_path, 'masks')
1349        self.current_image_index = 0
1350        self.initialize_flags()
1351        self.canvas_width = self.root.winfo_screenheight() -100
1352        self.canvas_height = self.root.winfo_screenheight() -100
1353        self.root.configure(bg='black')
1354        self.setup_navigation_toolbar()
1355        self.setup_mode_toolbar()
1356        self.setup_function_toolbar()
1357        self.setup_zoom_toolbar()
1358        self.setup_canvas()
1359        self.load_first_image()
1360    
1361    ####################################################################################################
1362    # Helper functions#
1363    ####################################################################################################
1364    
1365    def update_display(self):
1366        if self.zoom_active:
1367            self.display_zoomed_image()
1368        else:
1369            self.display_image()
1370    
1371    def update_original_mask_from_zoom(self):
1372        y0, y1, x0, x1 = self.zoom_y0, self.zoom_y1, self.zoom_x0, self.zoom_x1
1373        zoomed_mask_resized = resize(self.zoom_mask, (y1 - y0, x1 - x0), order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
1374        self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = zoomed_mask_resized
1375        
1376    def update_original_mask(self, zoomed_mask, x0, x1, y0, y1):
1377        actual_mask_region = self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1]
1378        target_shape = actual_mask_region.shape
1379        resized_mask = resize(zoomed_mask, target_shape, order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
1380        if resized_mask.shape != actual_mask_region.shape:
1381            raise ValueError(f"Shape mismatch: resized_mask {resized_mask.shape}, actual_mask_region {actual_mask_region.shape}")
1382        self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = np.maximum(actual_mask_region, resized_mask)
1383        self.mask = self.mask.copy()
1384        self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = np.maximum(self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1], resized_mask)
1385        self.mask = self.mask.copy()
1386
1387    def get_scaling_factors(self, img_width, img_height, canvas_width, canvas_height):
1388        x_scale = img_width / canvas_width
1389        y_scale = img_height / canvas_height
1390        return x_scale, y_scale
1391    
1392    def canvas_to_image(self, x_canvas, y_canvas):
1393        x_scale, y_scale = self.get_scaling_factors(
1394            self.image.shape[1], self.image.shape[0],
1395            self.canvas_width, self.canvas_height
1396        )
1397        x_image = int(x_canvas * x_scale)
1398        y_image = int(y_canvas * y_scale)
1399        return x_image, y_image
1400
1401    def apply_zoom_on_enter(self, event):
1402        if self.zoom_active and self.zoom_rectangle_start is not None:
1403            self.set_zoom_rectangle_end(event)
1404        
1405    def normalize_image(self, image, lower_quantile, upper_quantile):
1406        lower_bound = np.percentile(image, lower_quantile)
1407        upper_bound = np.percentile(image, upper_quantile)
1408        normalized = np.clip(image, lower_bound, upper_bound)
1409        normalized = (normalized - lower_bound) / (upper_bound - lower_bound)
1410        max_value = np.iinfo(image.dtype).max
1411        normalized = (normalized * max_value).astype(image.dtype)
1412        return normalized
1413    
1414    def resize_arrays(self, img, mask):
1415        original_dtype = img.dtype
1416        scaled_height = int(img.shape[0] * self.scale_factor)
1417        scaled_width = int(img.shape[1] * self.scale_factor)
1418        scaled_img = resize(img, (scaled_height, scaled_width), anti_aliasing=True, preserve_range=True)
1419        scaled_mask = resize(mask, (scaled_height, scaled_width), order=0, anti_aliasing=False, preserve_range=True)
1420        stretched_img = resize(scaled_img, (self.canvas_height, self.canvas_width), anti_aliasing=True, preserve_range=True)
1421        stretched_mask = resize(scaled_mask, (self.canvas_height, self.canvas_width), order=0, anti_aliasing=False, preserve_range=True)
1422        return stretched_img.astype(original_dtype), stretched_mask.astype(original_dtype)
1423    
1424    ####################################################################################################
1425    #Initiate canvas elements#
1426    ####################################################################################################
1427    
1428    def load_first_image(self):
1429        self.image, self.mask = self.load_image_and_mask(self.current_image_index)
1430        self.original_size = self.image.shape
1431        self.image, self.mask = self.resize_arrays(self.image, self.mask)
1432        self.display_image()
1433
1434    def setup_canvas(self):
1435        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self.root, width=self.canvas_width, height=self.canvas_height, bg='black')
1436        self.canvas.pack()
1437        self.canvas.bind("<Motion>", self.update_mouse_info)
1438
1439    def initialize_flags(self):
1440        self.zoom_rectangle_start = None
1441        self.zoom_rectangle_end = None
1442        self.zoom_rectangle_id = None
1443        self.zoom_x0 = None
1444        self.zoom_y0 = None
1445        self.zoom_x1 = None
1446        self.zoom_y1 = None
1447        self.zoom_mask = None
1448        self.zoom_image = None
1449        self.zoom_image_orig = None
1450        self.zoom_scale = 1
1451        self.drawing = False
1452        self.zoom_active = False
1453        self.magic_wand_active = False
1454        self.brush_active = False
1455        self.dividing_line_active = False
1456        self.dividing_line_coords = []
1457        self.current_dividing_line = None
1458        self.lower_quantile = tk.StringVar(value="1.0")
1459        self.upper_quantile = tk.StringVar(value="99.9")
1460        self.magic_wand_tolerance = tk.StringVar(value="1000")
1461
1462    def update_mouse_info(self, event):
1463        x, y = event.x, event.y
1464        intensity = "N/A"
1465        mask_value = "N/A"
1466        pixel_count = "N/A"  
1467        if self.zoom_active:
1468            if 0 <= x < self.canvas_width and 0 <= y < self.canvas_height:
1469                intensity = self.zoom_image_orig[y, x] if self.zoom_image_orig is not None else "N/A"
1470                mask_value = self.zoom_mask[y, x] if self.zoom_mask is not None else "N/A"
1471        else:
1472            if 0 <= x < self.image.shape[1] and 0 <= y < self.image.shape[0]:
1473                intensity = self.image[y, x]
1474                mask_value = self.mask[y, x]
1475        if mask_value != "N/A" and mask_value != 0:
1476            pixel_count = np.sum(self.mask == mask_value)
1477        self.intensity_label.config(text=f"Intensity: {intensity}")
1478        self.mask_value_label.config(text=f"Mask: {mask_value}, Area: {pixel_count}")
1479        self.mask_value_label.config(text=f"Mask: {mask_value}")
1480        if mask_value != "N/A" and mask_value != 0:
1481            self.pixel_count_label.config(text=f"Area: {pixel_count}")
1482        else:
1483            self.pixel_count_label.config(text="Area: N/A")
1484    
1485    def setup_navigation_toolbar(self):
1486        navigation_toolbar = tk.Frame(self.root, bg='black')
1487        navigation_toolbar.pack(side='top', fill='x')
1488        prev_btn = tk.Button(navigation_toolbar, text="Previous", command=self.previous_image, bg='black', fg='white')
1489        prev_btn.pack(side='left')
1490        next_btn = tk.Button(navigation_toolbar, text="Next", command=self.next_image, bg='black', fg='white')
1491        next_btn.pack(side='left')
1492        save_btn = tk.Button(navigation_toolbar, text="Save", command=self.save_mask, bg='black', fg='white')
1493        save_btn.pack(side='left')
1494        self.intensity_label = tk.Label(navigation_toolbar, text="Image: N/A", bg='black', fg='white')
1495        self.intensity_label.pack(side='right')
1496        self.mask_value_label = tk.Label(navigation_toolbar, text="Mask: N/A", bg='black', fg='white')
1497        self.mask_value_label.pack(side='right')
1498        self.pixel_count_label = tk.Label(navigation_toolbar, text="Area: N/A", bg='black', fg='white')
1499        self.pixel_count_label.pack(side='right')
1500
1501    def setup_mode_toolbar(self):
1502        self.mode_toolbar = tk.Frame(self.root, bg='black')
1503        self.mode_toolbar.pack(side='top', fill='x')
1504        self.draw_btn = tk.Button(self.mode_toolbar, text="Draw", command=self.toggle_draw_mode, bg='black', fg='white')
1505        self.draw_btn.pack(side='left')
1506        self.magic_wand_btn = tk.Button(self.mode_toolbar, text="Magic Wand", command=self.toggle_magic_wand_mode, bg='black', fg='white')
1507        self.magic_wand_btn.pack(side='left')
1508        tk.Label(self.mode_toolbar, text="Tolerance:", bg='black', fg='white').pack(side='left')
1509        self.tolerance_entry = tk.Entry(self.mode_toolbar, textvariable=self.magic_wand_tolerance, bg='black', fg='white')
1510        self.tolerance_entry.pack(side='left')
1511        tk.Label(self.mode_toolbar, text="Max Pixels:", bg='black', fg='white').pack(side='left')
1512        self.max_pixels_entry = tk.Entry(self.mode_toolbar, bg='black', fg='white')
1513        self.max_pixels_entry.insert(0, "1000")
1514        self.max_pixels_entry.pack(side='left')
1515        self.erase_btn = tk.Button(self.mode_toolbar, text="Erase", command=self.toggle_erase_mode, bg='black', fg='white')
1516        self.erase_btn.pack(side='left')
1517        self.brush_btn = tk.Button(self.mode_toolbar, text="Brush", command=self.toggle_brush_mode, bg='black', fg='white')
1518        self.brush_btn.pack(side='left')
1519        self.brush_size_entry = tk.Entry(self.mode_toolbar, bg='black', fg='white')
1520        self.brush_size_entry.insert(0, "10")
1521        self.brush_size_entry.pack(side='left')
1522        tk.Label(self.mode_toolbar, text="Brush Size:", bg='black', fg='white').pack(side='left')
1523        self.dividing_line_btn = tk.Button(self.mode_toolbar, text="Dividing Line", command=self.toggle_dividing_line_mode, bg='black', fg='white')
1524        self.dividing_line_btn.pack(side='left')
1525
1526    def setup_function_toolbar(self):
1527        self.function_toolbar = tk.Frame(self.root, bg='black')
1528        self.function_toolbar.pack(side='top', fill='x')
1529        self.fill_btn = tk.Button(self.function_toolbar, text="Fill", command=self.fill_objects, bg='black', fg='white')
1530        self.fill_btn.pack(side='left')
1531        self.relabel_btn = tk.Button(self.function_toolbar, text="Relabel", command=self.relabel_objects, bg='black', fg='white')
1532        self.relabel_btn.pack(side='left')
1533        self.clear_btn = tk.Button(self.function_toolbar, text="Clear", command=self.clear_objects, bg='black', fg='white')
1534        self.clear_btn.pack(side='left')
1535        self.invert_btn = tk.Button(self.function_toolbar, text="Invert", command=self.invert_mask, bg='black', fg='white')
1536        self.invert_btn.pack(side='left')
1537        remove_small_btn = tk.Button(self.function_toolbar, text="Remove Small", command=self.remove_small_objects, bg='black', fg='white')
1538        remove_small_btn.pack(side='left')
1539        tk.Label(self.function_toolbar, text="Min Area:", bg='black', fg='white').pack(side='left')
1540        self.min_area_entry = tk.Entry(self.function_toolbar, bg='black', fg='white')
1541        self.min_area_entry.insert(0, "100")  # Default minimum area
1542        self.min_area_entry.pack(side='left')
1543
1544    def setup_zoom_toolbar(self):
1545        self.zoom_toolbar = tk.Frame(self.root, bg='black')
1546        self.zoom_toolbar.pack(side='top', fill='x')
1547        self.zoom_btn = tk.Button(self.zoom_toolbar, text="Zoom", command=self.toggle_zoom_mode, bg='black', fg='white')
1548        self.zoom_btn.pack(side='left')
1549        self.normalize_btn = tk.Button(self.zoom_toolbar, text="Apply Normalization", command=self.apply_normalization, bg='black', fg='white')
1550        self.normalize_btn.pack(side='left')
1551        tk.Label(self.zoom_toolbar, text="Lower Percentile:", bg='black', fg='white').pack(side='left')
1552        self.lower_entry = tk.Entry(self.zoom_toolbar, textvariable=self.lower_quantile, bg='black', fg='white')
1553        self.lower_entry.pack(side='left')
1554        
1555        tk.Label(self.zoom_toolbar, text="Upper Percentile:", bg='black', fg='white').pack(side='left')
1556        self.upper_entry = tk.Entry(self.zoom_toolbar, textvariable=self.upper_quantile, bg='black', fg='white')
1557        self.upper_entry.pack(side='left')
1558    
1559    def load_image_and_mask(self, index):
1560        # Load the image
1561        image_path = os.path.join(self.folder_path, self.image_filenames[index])
1562        image = imageio.imread(image_path)
1563        print(f"Original Image shape: {image.shape}, dtype: {image.dtype}")
1564
1565        # Handle multi-channel or transparency issues
1566        if image.ndim == 3:
1567            if image.shape[2] == 4:  # If the image has an alpha channel (RGBA)
1568                image = image[..., :3]  # Remove the alpha channel
1569
1570            # Convert RGB to grayscale using weighted average
1571            image = np.dot(image[..., :3], [0.2989, 0.5870, 0.1140]).astype(np.uint8)
1572            print(f"Converted to grayscale: {image.shape}")
1573
1574        # Ensure the shape is (height, width) without extra channel
1575        if image.ndim == 3 and image.shape[2] == 1:
1576            image = np.squeeze(image, axis=-1)
1577
1578        if image.dtype != np.uint16:
1579            # Scale the image to fit the 16-bit range (0–65535)
1580            image = (image / image.max() * 65535).astype(np.uint16)
1581            # eventually remove this images should not have to be 16 bit look into downstream function (non 16bit images are jsut black)
1582
1583        # Load the corresponding mask
1584        mask_path = os.path.join(self.masks_folder, self.image_filenames[index])
1585        if os.path.exists(mask_path):
1586            print(f'Loading mask: {mask_path} for image: {image_path}')
1587            mask = imageio.imread(mask_path)
1588
1589            # Ensure mask is uint8
1590            if mask.dtype != np.uint8:
1591                mask = (mask / mask.max() * 255).astype(np.uint8)
1592        else:
1593            # Create a new mask with the same size as the image
1594            mask = np.zeros(image.shape[:2], dtype=np.uint8)
1595            print(f'Loaded new mask for image: {image_path}')
1596
1597        return image, mask
1598    
1599    ####################################################################################################
1600    # Image Display functions#
1601    ####################################################################################################
1602    def display_image(self):
1603        if self.zoom_rectangle_id is not None:
1604            self.canvas.delete(self.zoom_rectangle_id)
1605            self.zoom_rectangle_id = None
1606        lower_quantile = float(self.lower_quantile.get()) if self.lower_quantile.get() else 1.0
1607        upper_quantile = float(self.upper_quantile.get()) if self.upper_quantile.get() else 99.9
1608        normalized = self.normalize_image(self.image, lower_quantile, upper_quantile)
1609        combined = self.overlay_mask_on_image(normalized, self.mask)
