1610        self.tk_image = ImageTk.PhotoImage(image=Image.fromarray(combined))
1611        self.canvas.create_image(0, 0, anchor='nw', image=self.tk_image)
1612
1613    def display_zoomed_image(self):
1614        if self.zoom_rectangle_start and self.zoom_rectangle_end:
1615            # Convert canvas coordinates to image coordinates
1616            x0, y0 = self.canvas_to_image(*self.zoom_rectangle_start)
1617            x1, y1 = self.canvas_to_image(*self.zoom_rectangle_end)
1618            x0, x1 = min(x0, x1), max(x0, x1)
1619            y0, y1 = min(y0, y1), max(y0, y1)
1620            self.zoom_x0 = x0
1621            self.zoom_y0 = y0
1622            self.zoom_x1 = x1
1623            self.zoom_y1 = y1
1624            # Normalize the entire image
1625            lower_quantile = float(self.lower_quantile.get()) if self.lower_quantile.get() else 1.0
1626            upper_quantile = float(self.upper_quantile.get()) if self.upper_quantile.get() else 99.9
1627            normalized_image = self.normalize_image(self.image, lower_quantile, upper_quantile)
1628            # Extract the zoomed portion of the normalized image and mask
1629            self.zoom_image = normalized_image[y0:y1, x0:x1]
1630            self.zoom_image_orig = self.image[y0:y1, x0:x1]
1631            self.zoom_mask = self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1]
1632            original_mask_area = self.mask.shape[0] * self.mask.shape[1]
1633            zoom_mask_area = self.zoom_mask.shape[0] * self.zoom_mask.shape[1]
1634            if original_mask_area > 0:
1635                self.zoom_scale = original_mask_area/zoom_mask_area
1636            # Resize the zoomed image and mask to fit the canvas
1637            canvas_height = self.canvas.winfo_height()
1638            canvas_width = self.canvas.winfo_width()
1639            
1640            if self.zoom_image.size > 0 and canvas_height > 0 and canvas_width > 0:
1641                self.zoom_image = resize(self.zoom_image, (canvas_height, canvas_width), preserve_range=True).astype(self.zoom_image.dtype)
1642                self.zoom_image_orig = resize(self.zoom_image_orig, (canvas_height, canvas_width), preserve_range=True).astype(self.zoom_image_orig.dtype)
1643                #self.zoom_mask = resize(self.zoom_mask, (canvas_height, canvas_width), preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
1644                self.zoom_mask = resize(self.zoom_mask, (canvas_height, canvas_width), order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
1645                combined = self.overlay_mask_on_image(self.zoom_image, self.zoom_mask)
1646                self.tk_image = ImageTk.PhotoImage(image=Image.fromarray(combined))
1647                self.canvas.create_image(0, 0, anchor='nw', image=self.tk_image)
1648
1649    def overlay_mask_on_image(self, image, mask, alpha=0.5):
1650        if len(image.shape) == 2:
1651            image = np.stack((image,) * 3, axis=-1)
1652        mask = mask.astype(np.int32)
1653        max_label = np.max(mask)
1654        np.random.seed(0)
1655        colors = np.random.randint(0, 255, size=(max_label + 1, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
1656        colors[0] = [0, 0, 0]  # background color
1657        colored_mask = colors[mask]
1658        image_8bit = (image / 256).astype(np.uint8)
1659        # Blend the mask and the image with transparency
1660        combined_image = np.where(mask[..., None] > 0, 
1661                                  np.clip(image_8bit * (1 - alpha) + colored_mask * alpha, 0, 255), 
1662                                  image_8bit)
1663        # Convert the final image back to uint8
1664        combined_image = combined_image.astype(np.uint8)
1665        return combined_image
1666    
1667    ####################################################################################################
1668    # Navigation functions#
1669    ####################################################################################################
1670    
1671    def previous_image(self):
1672        if self.current_image_index > 0:
1673            self.current_image_index -= 1
1674            self.initialize_flags()            
1675            self.image, self.mask = self.load_image_and_mask(self.current_image_index)
1676            self.original_size = self.image.shape
1677            self.image, self.mask = self.resize_arrays(self.image, self.mask)
1678            self.display_image()
1679
1680    def next_image(self):
1681        if self.current_image_index < len(self.image_filenames) - 1:
1682            self.current_image_index += 1
1683            self.initialize_flags()            
1684            self.image, self.mask = self.load_image_and_mask(self.current_image_index)
1685            self.original_size = self.image.shape
1686            self.image, self.mask = self.resize_arrays(self.image, self.mask)
1687            self.display_image()
1688            
1689    def save_mask(self):
1690        if self.current_image_index < len(self.image_filenames):
1691            original_size = self.original_size
1692            if self.mask.shape != original_size:
1693                resized_mask = resize(self.mask, original_size, order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint16)
1694            else:
1695                resized_mask = self.mask
1696            resized_mask, _ = label(resized_mask > 0)
1697            save_folder = os.path.join(self.folder_path, 'masks')
1698            if not os.path.exists(save_folder):
1699                os.makedirs(save_folder)
1700            image_filename = os.path.splitext(self.image_filenames[self.current_image_index])[0] + '.tif'
1701            save_path = os.path.join(save_folder, image_filename)
1702
1703            print(f"Saving mask to: {save_path}")  # Debug print
1704            imageio.imwrite(save_path, resized_mask)
1705
1706    ####################################################################################################
1707    # Zoom Functions #
1708    ####################################################################################################
1709    def set_zoom_rectangle_start(self, event):
1710        if self.zoom_active:
1711            self.zoom_rectangle_start = (event.x, event.y)
1712    
1713    def set_zoom_rectangle_end(self, event):
1714        if self.zoom_active:
1715            self.zoom_rectangle_end = (event.x, event.y)
1716            if self.zoom_rectangle_id is not None:
1717                self.canvas.delete(self.zoom_rectangle_id)
1718                self.zoom_rectangle_id = None
1719            self.display_zoomed_image()  
1720            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")  
1721            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1722            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")  
1723            self.canvas.bind("<Motion>", self.update_mouse_info)
1724            
1725    def update_zoom_box(self, event):
1726        if self.zoom_active and self.zoom_rectangle_start is not None:
1727            if self.zoom_rectangle_id is not None:
1728                self.canvas.delete(self.zoom_rectangle_id)
1729            # Assuming event.x and event.y are already in image coordinates
1730            self.zoom_rectangle_end = (event.x, event.y)
1731            x0, y0 = self.zoom_rectangle_start
1732            x1, y1 = self.zoom_rectangle_end
1733            self.zoom_rectangle_id = self.canvas.create_rectangle(x0, y0, x1, y1, outline="red", width=2)
1734    
1735    ####################################################################################################
1736    # Mode activation#
1737    ####################################################################################################
1738    
1739    def toggle_zoom_mode(self):
1740        if not self.zoom_active:
1741            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1742            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1743            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1744            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1745            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
1746            self.zoom_active = True
1747            self.drawing = False
1748            self.magic_wand_active = False
1749            self.erase_active = False
1750            self.brush_active = False
1751            self.dividing_line_active = False
1752            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1753            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1754            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1755            self.zoom_btn.config(text="Zoom ON")
1756            self.dividing_line_btn.config(text="Dividing Line")
1757            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1758            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")
1759            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1760            self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.set_zoom_rectangle_start)
1761            self.canvas.bind("<Button-3>", self.set_zoom_rectangle_end)
1762            self.canvas.bind("<Motion>", self.update_zoom_box)
1763        else:
1764            self.zoom_active = False
1765            self.zoom_btn.config(text="Zoom")
1766            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1767            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")
1768            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1769            self.zoom_rectangle_start = self.zoom_rectangle_end = None
1770            self.zoom_rectangle_id = None
1771            self.display_image()
1772            self.canvas.bind("<Motion>", self.update_mouse_info)
1773            self.zoom_rectangle_start = None
1774            self.zoom_rectangle_end = None
1775            self.zoom_rectangle_id = None
1776            self.zoom_x0 = None
1777            self.zoom_y0 = None
1778            self.zoom_x1 = None
1779            self.zoom_y1 = None
1780            self.zoom_mask = None
1781            self.zoom_image = None
1782            self.zoom_image_orig = None
1783
1784    def toggle_brush_mode(self):
1785        self.brush_active = not self.brush_active
1786        if self.brush_active:
1787            self.drawing = False
1788            self.magic_wand_active = False
1789            self.erase_active = False
1790            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush ON")
1791            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1792            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1793            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1794            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1795            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")
1796            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1797            self.canvas.bind("<B1-Motion>", self.apply_brush)  # Left click and drag to apply brush
1798            self.canvas.bind("<B3-Motion>", self.erase_brush)  # Right click and drag to erase with brush
1799            self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-1>", self.apply_brush_release)  # Left button release
1800            self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-3>", self.erase_brush_release)  # Right button release
1801        else:
1802            self.brush_active = False
1803            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1804            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1805            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1806            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1807            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
1808
1809    def image_to_canvas(self, x_image, y_image):
1810        x_scale, y_scale = self.get_scaling_factors(
1811            self.image.shape[1], self.image.shape[0],
1812            self.canvas_width, self.canvas_height
1813        )
1814        x_canvas = int(x_image / x_scale)
1815        y_canvas = int(y_image / y_scale)
1816        return x_canvas, y_canvas
1817
1818    def toggle_dividing_line_mode(self):
1819        self.dividing_line_active = not self.dividing_line_active
1820        if self.dividing_line_active:
1821            self.drawing = False
1822            self.magic_wand_active = False
1823            self.erase_active = False
1824            self.brush_active = False
1825            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1826            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1827            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1828            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1829            self.dividing_line_btn.config(text="Dividing Line ON")
1830            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1831            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1832            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1833            self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.start_dividing_line)
1834            self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-1>", self.finish_dividing_line)
1835            self.canvas.bind("<Motion>", self.update_dividing_line_preview)
1836        else:
1837            print("Dividing Line Mode: OFF")
1838            self.dividing_line_active = False
1839            self.dividing_line_btn.config(text="Dividing Line")
1840            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1841            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1842            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1843            self.display_image()
1844
1845    def start_dividing_line(self, event):
1846        if self.dividing_line_active:
1847            self.dividing_line_coords = [(event.x, event.y)]
1848            self.current_dividing_line = self.canvas.create_line(event.x, event.y, event.x, event.y, fill="red", width=2)
1849
1850    def finish_dividing_line(self, event):
1851        if self.dividing_line_active:
1852            self.dividing_line_coords.append((event.x, event.y))
1853            if self.zoom_active:
1854                self.dividing_line_coords = [self.canvas_to_image(x, y) for x, y in self.dividing_line_coords]
1855            self.apply_dividing_line()
1856            self.canvas.delete(self.current_dividing_line)
1857            self.current_dividing_line = None
1858
1859    def update_dividing_line_preview(self, event):
1860        if self.dividing_line_active and self.dividing_line_coords:
1861            x, y = event.x, event.y
1862            if self.zoom_active:
1863                x, y = self.canvas_to_image(x, y)
1864            self.dividing_line_coords.append((x, y))
1865            canvas_coords = [(self.image_to_canvas(*pt) if self.zoom_active else pt) for pt in self.dividing_line_coords]
1866            flat_canvas_coords = [coord for pt in canvas_coords for coord in pt]
1867            self.canvas.coords(self.current_dividing_line, *flat_canvas_coords)
1868
1869    def apply_dividing_line(self):
1870        if self.dividing_line_coords:
1871            coords = self.dividing_line_coords
1872            if self.zoom_active:
1873                coords = [self.canvas_to_image(x, y) for x, y in coords]
1874
1875            rr, cc = [], []
1876            for (x0, y0), (x1, y1) in zip(coords[:-1], coords[1:]):
1877                line_rr, line_cc = line(y0, x0, y1, x1)
1878                rr.extend(line_rr)
1879                cc.extend(line_cc)
1880            rr, cc = np.array(rr), np.array(cc)
1881
1882            mask_copy = self.mask.copy()
1883
1884            if self.zoom_active:
1885                # Update the zoomed mask
1886                self.zoom_mask[rr, cc] = 0
1887                # Reflect changes to the original mask
1888                y0, y1, x0, x1 = self.zoom_y0, self.zoom_y1, self.zoom_x0, self.zoom_x1
1889                zoomed_mask_resized_back = resize(self.zoom_mask, (y1 - y0, x1 - x0), order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
1890                self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = zoomed_mask_resized_back
1891            else:
1892                # Directly update the original mask
1893                mask_copy[rr, cc] = 0
1894                self.mask = mask_copy
1895
1896            labeled_mask, num_labels = label(self.mask > 0)
1897            self.mask = labeled_mask
1898            self.update_display()
1899
1900            self.dividing_line_coords = []
1901            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1902            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1903            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1904            self.dividing_line_active = False
1905            self.dividing_line_btn.config(text="Dividing Line")
1906
1907    def toggle_draw_mode(self):
1908        self.drawing = not self.drawing
1909        if self.drawing:
1910            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1911            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1912            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1913            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1914            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
1915            self.magic_wand_active = False
1916            self.erase_active = False
1917            self.brush_active = False
1918            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw ON")
1919            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1920            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1921            self.draw_coordinates = []
1922            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1923            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1924            self.canvas.bind("<B1-Motion>", self.draw)
1925            self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-1>", self.finish_drawing)
1926        else:
1927            self.drawing = False
1928            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1929            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1930            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1931            
1932    def toggle_magic_wand_mode(self):
1933        self.magic_wand_active = not self.magic_wand_active
1934        if self.magic_wand_active:
1935            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1936            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1937            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1938            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1939            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
1940            self.drawing = False
1941            self.erase_active = False
1942            self.brush_active = False
1943            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1944            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1945            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand ON")
1946            self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.use_magic_wand)
1947            self.canvas.bind("<Button-3>", self.use_magic_wand)
1948        else:
1949            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1950            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1951            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")
1952            
1953    def toggle_erase_mode(self):
1954        self.erase_active = not self.erase_active
1955        if self.erase_active:
1956            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1957            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1958            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1959            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1960            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
1961            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase ON")
1962            self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.erase_object)
1963            self.drawing = False
1964            self.magic_wand_active = False
1965            self.brush_active = False
1966            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1967            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1968        else:
1969            self.erase_active = False
1970            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1971            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1972    
1973    ####################################################################################################
1974    # Mode functions#
1975    ####################################################################################################
1976    
1977    def apply_brush_release(self, event):
1978        if hasattr(self, 'brush_path'):
1979            for x, y, brush_size in self.brush_path:
1980                img_x, img_y = (x, y) if self.zoom_active else self.canvas_to_image(x, y)
1981                x0 = max(img_x - brush_size // 2, 0)
1982                y0 = max(img_y - brush_size // 2, 0)
1983                x1 = min(img_x + brush_size // 2, self.zoom_mask.shape[1] if self.zoom_active else self.mask.shape[1])
1984                y1 = min(img_y + brush_size // 2, self.zoom_mask.shape[0] if self.zoom_active else self.mask.shape[0])
1985                if self.zoom_active:
1986                    self.zoom_mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = 255
1987                    self.update_original_mask_from_zoom()
1988                else:
1989                    self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = 255
1990            del self.brush_path
1991            self.canvas.delete("temp_line")
1992            self.update_display()
1993
1994    def erase_brush_release(self, event):
1995        if hasattr(self, 'erase_path'):
1996            for x, y, brush_size in self.erase_path:
1997                img_x, img_y = (x, y) if self.zoom_active else self.canvas_to_image(x, y)
1998                x0 = max(img_x - brush_size // 2, 0)
1999                y0 = max(img_y - brush_size // 2, 0)
2000                x1 = min(img_x + brush_size // 2, self.zoom_mask.shape[1] if self.zoom_active else self.mask.shape[1])
2001                y1 = min(img_y + brush_size // 2, self.zoom_mask.shape[0] if self.zoom_active else self.mask.shape[0])
2002                if self.zoom_active:
2003                    self.zoom_mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = 0                    
2004                    self.update_original_mask_from_zoom()
2005                else:
2006                    self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = 0
2007            del self.erase_path
2008            self.canvas.delete("temp_line")
2009            self.update_display()
2010        
2011    def apply_brush(self, event):
2012        brush_size = int(self.brush_size_entry.get())
2013        x, y = event.x, event.y
2014        if not hasattr(self, 'brush_path'):
2015            self.brush_path = []
2016            self.last_brush_coord = (x, y)
2017        if self.last_brush_coord:
2018            last_x, last_y = self.last_brush_coord
2019            rr, cc = line(last_y, last_x, y, x)
2020            for ry, rx in zip(rr, cc):
2021                self.brush_path.append((rx, ry, brush_size))
2022
2023        self.canvas.create_line(self.last_brush_coord[0], self.last_brush_coord[1], x, y, width=brush_size, fill="blue", tag="temp_line")
2024        self.last_brush_coord = (x, y)
2025
2026    def erase_brush(self, event):
2027        brush_size = int(self.brush_size_entry.get())
2028        x, y = event.x, event.y
2029        if not hasattr(self, 'erase_path'):
2030            self.erase_path = []
2031            self.last_erase_coord = (x, y)
2032        if self.last_erase_coord:
2033            last_x, last_y = self.last_erase_coord
2034            rr, cc = line(last_y, last_x, y, x)
2035            for ry, rx in zip(rr, cc):
2036                self.erase_path.append((rx, ry, brush_size))
2037
2038        self.canvas.create_line(self.last_erase_coord[0], self.last_erase_coord[1], x, y, width=brush_size, fill="white", tag="temp_line")
2039        self.last_erase_coord = (x, y)
2040
2041    def erase_object(self, event):
2042        x, y = event.x, event.y
2043        if self.zoom_active:
2044            canvas_x, canvas_y = x, y
2045            zoomed_x = int(canvas_x * (self.zoom_image.shape[1] / self.canvas_width))
2046            zoomed_y = int(canvas_y * (self.zoom_image.shape[0] / self.canvas_height))
2047            orig_x = int(zoomed_x * ((self.zoom_x1 - self.zoom_x0) / self.canvas_width) + self.zoom_x0)
2048            orig_y = int(zoomed_y * ((self.zoom_y1 - self.zoom_y0) / self.canvas_height) + self.zoom_y0)
2049            if orig_x < 0 or orig_y < 0 or orig_x >= self.image.shape[1] or orig_y >= self.image.shape[0]:
2050                print("Point is out of bounds in the original image.")
2051                return
2052        else:
2053            orig_x, orig_y = x, y
2054        label_to_remove = self.mask[orig_y, orig_x]
2055        if label_to_remove > 0:
2056            self.mask[self.mask == label_to_remove] = 0
2057        self.update_display()
2058            
2059    def use_magic_wand(self, event):
2060        x, y = event.x, event.y
2061        tolerance = int(self.magic_wand_tolerance.get())
2062        maximum = int(self.max_pixels_entry.get())
2063        action = 'add' if event.num == 1 else 'erase'
2064        if self.zoom_active:
2065            self.magic_wand_zoomed((x, y), tolerance, action)
2066        else:
2067            self.magic_wand_normal((x, y), tolerance, action)
2068    
2069    def apply_magic_wand(self, image, mask, seed_point, tolerance, maximum, action='add'):
2070        x, y = seed_point
2071        initial_value = image[y, x].astype(np.float32)
2072        visited = np.zeros_like(image, dtype=bool)
2073        queue = deque([(x, y)])
2074        added_pixels = 0
2075
2076        while queue and added_pixels < maximum:
2077            cx, cy = queue.popleft()
2078            if visited[cy, cx]:
2079                continue
2080            visited[cy, cx] = True
2081            current_value = image[cy, cx].astype(np.float32)
2082
2083            if np.linalg.norm(abs(current_value - initial_value)) <= tolerance:
2084                if mask[cy, cx] == 0:
2085                    added_pixels += 1
2086                mask[cy, cx] = 255 if action == 'add' else 0
2087
2088                if added_pixels >= maximum:
2089                    break
2090
2091                for dx, dy in [(-1, 0), (1, 0), (0, -1), (0, 1)]:
2092                    nx, ny = cx + dx, cy + dy
2093                    if 0 <= nx < image.shape[1] and 0 <= ny < image.shape[0] and not visited[ny, nx]:
2094                        queue.append((nx, ny))
2095        return mask
2096
2097    def magic_wand_normal(self, seed_point, tolerance, action):
2098        try:
2099            maximum = int(self.max_pixels_entry.get())
2100        except ValueError:
2101            print("Invalid maximum value; using default of 1000")
2102            maximum = 1000 
2103        self.mask = self.apply_magic_wand(self.image, self.mask, seed_point, tolerance, maximum, action)
2104        self.display_image()
2105        
2106    def magic_wand_zoomed(self, seed_point, tolerance, action):
2107        if self.zoom_image_orig is None or self.zoom_mask is None:
2108            print("Zoomed image or mask not initialized")
2109            return
2110        try:
2111            maximum = int(self.max_pixels_entry.get())
2112            maximum = maximum * self.zoom_scale
2113        except ValueError:
2114            print("Invalid maximum value; using default of 1000")
2115            maximum = 1000
2116            
2117        canvas_x, canvas_y = seed_point
2118        if canvas_x < 0 or canvas_y < 0 or canvas_x >= self.zoom_image_orig.shape[1] or canvas_y >= self.zoom_image_orig.shape[0]:
2119            print("Selected point is out of bounds in the zoomed image.")
2120            return
2121        
2122        self.zoom_mask = self.apply_magic_wand(self.zoom_image_orig, self.zoom_mask, (canvas_x, canvas_y), tolerance, maximum, action)
2123        y0, y1, x0, x1 = self.zoom_y0, self.zoom_y1, self.zoom_x0, self.zoom_x1
2124        zoomed_mask_resized_back = resize(self.zoom_mask, (y1 - y0, x1 - x0), order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
2125        if action == 'erase':
2126            self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = np.where(zoomed_mask_resized_back == 0, 0, self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1])
2127        else:
2128            self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = np.where(zoomed_mask_resized_back > 0, zoomed_mask_resized_back, self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1])
2129        self.update_display()
2130                
2131    def draw(self, event):
2132        if self.drawing:
2133            x, y = event.x, event.y
2134            if self.draw_coordinates:
2135                last_x, last_y = self.draw_coordinates[-1]
2136                self.current_line = self.canvas.create_line(last_x, last_y, x, y, fill="yellow", width=3)
2137            self.draw_coordinates.append((x, y))
2138            
2139    def draw_on_zoomed_mask(self, draw_coordinates):
2140        canvas_height = self.canvas.winfo_height()
2141        canvas_width = self.canvas.winfo_width()
2142        zoomed_mask = np.zeros((canvas_height, canvas_width), dtype=np.uint8)
2143        rr, cc = polygon(np.array(draw_coordinates)[:, 1], np.array(draw_coordinates)[:, 0], shape=zoomed_mask.shape)
2144        zoomed_mask[rr, cc] = 255
2145        return zoomed_mask
2146            
2147    def finish_drawing(self, event):
2148        if len(self.draw_coordinates) > 2:
2149            self.draw_coordinates.append(self.draw_coordinates[0])
2150            if self.zoom_active:
2151                x0, x1, y0, y1 = self.zoom_x0, self.zoom_x1, self.zoom_y0, self.zoom_y1
2152                zoomed_mask = self.draw_on_zoomed_mask(self.draw_coordinates)
2153                self.update_original_mask(zoomed_mask, x0, x1, y0, y1)
2154            else:
2155                rr, cc = polygon(np.array(self.draw_coordinates)[:, 1], np.array(self.draw_coordinates)[:, 0], shape=self.mask.shape)
2156                self.mask[rr, cc] = np.maximum(self.mask[rr, cc], 255)
2157                self.mask = self.mask.copy()
2158            self.canvas.delete(self.current_line)
2159            self.draw_coordinates.clear()
2160        self.update_display()
2161            
2162    def finish_drawing_if_active(self, event):
2163        if self.drawing and len(self.draw_coordinates) > 2:
2164            self.finish_drawing(event)
2165
2166    ####################################################################################################
2167    # Single function butons#
2168    ####################################################################################################
2169            
2170    def apply_normalization(self):
2171        self.lower_quantile.set(self.lower_entry.get())
2172        self.upper_quantile.set(self.upper_entry.get())
2173        self.update_display()
2174
2175    def fill_objects(self):
2176        binary_mask = self.mask > 0
2177        filled_mask = binary_fill_holes(binary_mask)
2178        self.mask = filled_mask.astype(np.uint8) * 255
2179        labeled_mask, _ = label(filled_mask)
2180        self.mask = labeled_mask
2181        self.update_display()
2182
2183    def relabel_objects(self):
2184        mask = self.mask
2185        labeled_mask, num_labels = label(mask > 0)
2186        self.mask = labeled_mask
2187        self.update_display()
2188        
2189    def clear_objects(self):
2190        self.mask = np.zeros_like(self.mask)
2191        self.update_display()
2192
2193    def invert_mask(self):
2194        self.mask = np.where(self.mask > 0, 0, 1)
2195        self.relabel_objects()
2196        self.update_display()
2197        
2198    def remove_small_objects(self):
2199        try:
2200            min_area = int(self.min_area_entry.get())
2201        except ValueError:
2202            print("Invalid minimum area value; using default of 100")
2203            min_area = 100
2204
2205        labeled_mask, num_labels = label(self.mask > 0)
2206        for i in range(1, num_labels + 1):  # Skip background
2207            if np.sum(labeled_mask == i) < min_area:
2208                self.mask[labeled_mask == i] = 0  # Remove small objects
2209        self.update_display()
2210
2211class AnnotateApp:
2212    def __init__(self, root, db_path, src, image_type=None, channels=None, image_size=200, annotation_column='annotate', normalize=False, percentiles=(1, 99), measurement=None, threshold=None, normalize_channels=None):
2213        self.root = root
2214        self.db_path = db_path
2215        self.src = src
2216        self.index = 0
2217
2218        if isinstance(image_size, list):
2219            self.image_size = (int(image_size[0]), int(image_size[0]))
2220        elif isinstance(image_size, int):
2221            self.image_size = (image_size, image_size)
2222        else:
2223            raise ValueError("Invalid image size")
2224        
2225        self.orig_annotation_columns = annotation_column
2226        self.annotation_column = annotation_column
2227        self.image_type = image_type
2228        self.channels = channels
2229        self.normalize = normalize
2230        self.percentiles = percentiles
2231        self.images = {}
2232        self.pending_updates = {}
2233        self.labels = []
2234        self.adjusted_to_original_paths = {}
2235        self.terminate = False
2236        self.update_queue = Queue()
2237        self.measurement = measurement
2238        self.threshold = threshold
2239        self.normalize_channels = normalize_channels
2240        print('self.normalize_channels',self.normalize_channels)
2241        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
2242        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
2243        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
2244        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
2245        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
2246        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
2247        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
2248
2249        if self.font_loader:
2250            self.font_style = self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size)
2251        else:
2252            self.font_style = ("Arial", 12)
2253        
2254        self.root.configure(bg=style_out['inactive_color'])
2255
2256        self.filtered_paths_annotations = []
2257        self.prefilter_paths_annotations()
2258
2259        self.db_update_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.update_database_worker)
2260        self.db_update_thread.start()
2261
2262        # Set the initial window size and make it fit the screen size
2263        self.root.geometry(f"{self.root.winfo_screenwidth()}x{self.root.winfo_screenheight()}")
2264        self.root.update_idletasks()
2265
2266        # Create the status label
2267        self.status_label = Label(root, text="", font=self.font_style, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2268        self.status_label.grid(row=2, column=0, padx=10, pady=10, sticky="w")
2269
2270        # Place the buttons at the bottom right
2271        self.button_frame = Frame(root, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2272        self.button_frame.grid(row=2, column=1, padx=10, pady=10, sticky="se")
2273
2274        self.next_button = Button(self.button_frame, text="Next", command=self.next_page, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, highlightbackground=self.fg_color, highlightcolor=self.fg_color, highlightthickness=1)
2275        self.next_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2276
2277        self.previous_button = Button(self.button_frame, text="Back", command=self.previous_page, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, highlightbackground=self.fg_color, highlightcolor=self.fg_color, highlightthickness=1)
2278        self.previous_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2279
2280        self.exit_button = Button(self.button_frame, text="Exit", command=self.shutdown, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, highlightbackground=self.fg_color, highlightcolor=self.fg_color, highlightthickness=1)
2281        self.exit_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2282        
2283        self.train_button = Button(self.button_frame,text="Train & Classify (beta)",command=self.train_and_classify,bg=self.bg_color,fg=self.fg_color,highlightbackground=self.fg_color,highlightcolor=self.fg_color,highlightthickness=1)
2284        self.train_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2285        
2286        self.train_button = Button(self.button_frame,text="orig.",command=self.swich_back_annotation_column,bg=self.bg_color,fg=self.fg_color,highlightbackground=self.fg_color,highlightcolor=self.fg_color,highlightthickness=1)
2287        self.train_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2288        
2289        self.settings_button = Button(self.button_frame, text="Settings", command=self.open_settings_window, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, highlightbackground=self.fg_color,highlightcolor=self.fg_color,highlightthickness=1)
2290        self.settings_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2291
2292        # Calculate grid rows and columns based on the root window size and image size
2293        self.calculate_grid_dimensions()
2294
2295        # Create a frame to hold the image grid
2296        self.grid_frame = Frame(root, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2297        self.grid_frame.grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, padx=0, pady=0, sticky="nsew")
2298
2299        for i in range(self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols):
2300            label = Label(self.grid_frame, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2301            label.grid(row=i // self.grid_cols, column=i % self.grid_cols, padx=2, pady=2, sticky="nsew")
2302            self.labels.append(label)
2303
2304        # Make the grid frame resize with the window
2305        self.root.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
2306        self.root.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
2307        self.root.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
2308
2309        for row in range(self.grid_rows):
2310            self.grid_frame.grid_rowconfigure(row, weight=1)
2311        for col in range(self.grid_cols):
2312            self.grid_frame.grid_columnconfigure(col, weight=1)
2313            
2314    def open_settings_window(self):
2315        from .gui_utils import generate_annotate_fields, convert_to_number
2316
2317        # Create settings window
2318        settings_window = tk.Toplevel(self.root)
2319        settings_window.title("Modify Annotation Settings")
2320
2321        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
2322        settings_window.configure(bg=style_out['bg_color'])
2323        
2324        settings_frame = tk.Frame(settings_window, bg=style_out['bg_color'])
2325        settings_frame.pack(fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)
2326
2327        # Generate fields with current settings pre-filled
2328        vars_dict = generate_annotate_fields(settings_frame)
2329
2330        # Pre-fill the current settings into vars_dict
2331        current_settings = {
2332            'image_type': self.image_type or '',
2333            'channels': ','.join(self.channels) if self.channels else '',
2334            'img_size': f"{self.image_size[0]},{self.image_size[1]}",
2335            'annotation_column': self.annotation_column or '',
2336            'normalize': str(self.normalize),
2337            'percentiles': ','.join(map(str, self.percentiles)),
2338            'measurement': ','.join(self.measurement) if self.measurement else '',
2339            'threshold': str(self.threshold) if self.threshold is not None else '',
2340            'normalize_channels': ','.join(self.normalize_channels) if self.normalize_channels else ''
2341        }
2342
2343        for key, data in vars_dict.items():
2344            if key in current_settings:
2345                data['entry'].delete(0, tk.END)
2346                data['entry'].insert(0, current_settings[key])
2347
2348        def apply_new_settings():
2349            settings = {key: data['entry'].get() for key, data in vars_dict.items()}
2350            
2351            # Process settings exactly as your original initiation function does
2352            settings['channels'] = settings['channels'].split(',') if settings['channels'] else None
2353            settings['img_size'] = list(map(int, settings['img_size'].split(',')))
2354            settings['percentiles'] = list(map(convert_to_number, settings['percentiles'].split(','))) if settings['percentiles'] else [1, 99]
2355            settings['normalize'] = settings['normalize'].lower() == 'true'
2356            settings['normalize_channels'] = settings['normalize_channels'].split(',') if settings['normalize_channels'] else None
2357
2358            try:
2359                settings['measurement'] = settings['measurement'].split(',') if settings['measurement'] else None
2360                settings['threshold'] = None if settings['threshold'].lower() == 'none' else int(settings['threshold'])
2361            except:
2362                settings['measurement'] = None
2363                settings['threshold'] = None
2364
2365            # Convert empty strings to None
2366            for key, value in settings.items():
2367                if isinstance(value, list):
2368                    settings[key] = [v if v != '' else None for v in value]
2369                elif value == '':
2370                    settings[key] = None
2371
2372            # Apply these settings dynamically using update_settings method
2373            self.update_settings(**{
2374                'image_type': settings.get('image_type'),
2375                'channels': settings.get('channels'),
2376                'image_size': settings.get('img_size'),
2377                'annotation_column': settings.get('annotation_column'),
2378                'normalize': settings.get('normalize'),
2379                'percentiles': settings.get('percentiles'),
2380                'measurement': settings.get('measurement'),
2381                'threshold': settings.get('threshold'),
2382                'normalize_channels': settings.get('normalize_channels')
2383            })
2384
2385            settings_window.destroy()
2386
2387        apply_button = spacrButton(settings_window, text="Apply Settings", command=apply_new_settings,show_text=False)
2388        apply_button.pack(pady=10)
2389        
2390    def update_settings(self, **kwargs):
2391        allowed_attributes = {
2392            'image_type', 'channels', 'image_size', 'annotation_column',
2393            'normalize', 'percentiles', 'measurement', 'threshold', 'normalize_channels'
2394        }
2395
2396        updated = False
2397
2398        for attr, value in kwargs.items():
2399            if attr in allowed_attributes and value is not None:
2400                setattr(self, attr, value)
2401                updated = True
2402
2403        if 'image_size' in kwargs:
2404            if isinstance(self.image_size, list):
2405                self.image_size = (int(self.image_size[0]), int(self.image_size[0]))
2406            elif isinstance(self.image_size, int):
2407                self.image_size = (self.image_size, self.image_size)
2408            else:
2409                raise ValueError("Invalid image size")
2410
2411            self.calculate_grid_dimensions()
2412            self.recreate_image_grid()
2413
2414        if updated:
2415            current_index = self.index  # Retain current index
2416            self.prefilter_paths_annotations()
2417
2418            # Ensure the retained index is still valid (not out of bounds)
2419            max_index = len(self.filtered_paths_annotations) - 1
2420            self.index = min(current_index, max_index := max(0, max(0, max(len(self.filtered_paths_annotations) - self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols, 0))))
2421            self.load_images()
2422
2423    def recreate_image_grid(self):
2424        # Remove current labels
2425        for label in self.labels:
2426            label.destroy()
2427        self.labels.clear()
2428
2429        # Recreate the labels grid with updated dimensions
2430        for i in range(self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols):
2431            label = Label(self.grid_frame, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2432            label.grid(row=i // self.grid_cols, column=i % self.grid_cols, padx=2, pady=2, sticky="nsew")
2433            self.labels.append(label)
2434
2435        # Reconfigure grid weights
2436        for row in range(self.grid_rows):
2437            self.grid_frame.grid_rowconfigure(row, weight=1)
2438        for col in range(self.grid_cols):
2439            self.grid_frame.grid_columnconfigure(col, weight=1)
2440
2441            
2442    def swich_back_annotation_column(self):
2443        self.annotation_column = self.orig_annotation_columns
2444        self.prefilter_paths_annotations()
2445        self.update_display()
2446            
2447    def calculate_grid_dimensions(self):
2448        window_width = self.root.winfo_width()
2449        window_height = self.root.winfo_height()
2450
2451        self.grid_cols = window_width // (self.image_size[0] + 4)
2452        self.grid_rows = (window_height - self.button_frame.winfo_height() - 4) // (self.image_size[1] + 4)
2453
2454        # Update to make sure grid_rows and grid_cols are at least 1
2455        self.grid_cols = max(1, self.grid_cols)
2456        self.grid_rows = max(1, self.grid_rows)
2457
2458    def prefilter_paths_annotations(self):
2459        from .io import _read_and_join_tables, _read_db
2460        from .utils import is_list_of_lists
2461
2462        if self.measurement and self.threshold is not None:
2463            df = _read_and_join_tables(self.db_path)
2464            png_list_df = _read_db(self.db_path, tables=['png_list'])[0]
2465            png_list_df = png_list_df.set_index('prcfo')
2466            df = df.merge(png_list_df, left_index=True, right_index=True)
2467            df[self.annotation_column] = None
2468            before = len(df)
2469
2470            if isinstance(self.threshold, int):
2471                if isinstance(self.measurement, list):
2472                    mes = self.measurement[0]
2473                if isinstance(self.measurement, str):
2474                    mes = self.measurement
2475                df = df[df[f'{mes}'] == self.threshold]
2476
2477            if is_list_of_lists(self.measurement):
2478                if isinstance(self.threshold, list) or is_list_of_lists(self.threshold):
2479                    if len(self.measurement) == len(self.threshold):
2480                        for idx, var in enumerate(self.measurement):
2481                            df = df[df[var[idx]] > self.threshold[idx]]
2482                        after = len(df)
2483                    elif len(self.measurement) == len(self.threshold)*2:
2484                        th_idx = 0
2485                        for idx, var in enumerate(self.measurement):
2486                            if idx % 2 != 0:
2487                                th_idx += 1
2488                                thd = self.threshold
2489                                if isinstance(thd, list):
2490                                    thd = thd[0]
2491                                df[f'threshold_measurement_{idx}'] = df[self.measurement[idx]]/df[self.measurement[idx+1]]
2492                                print(f"mean threshold_measurement_{idx}: {np.mean(df['threshold_measurement'])}")
2493                                print(f"median threshold measurement: {np.median(df[self.measurement])}")
2494                                df = df[df[f'threshold_measurement_{idx}'] > thd]
2495                        after = len(df)
2496            
2497            elif isinstance(self.measurement, list):
2498                df['threshold_measurement'] = df[self.measurement[0]]/df[self.measurement[1]]
2499                print(f"mean threshold measurement: {np.mean(df['threshold_measurement'])}")
2500                print(f"median threshold measurement: {np.median(df[self.measurement])}")
2501                df = df[df['threshold_measurement'] > self.threshold]
2502                after = len(df)
2503                self.measurement = 'threshold_measurement'
2504                print(f'Removed: {before-after} rows, retained {after}')
2505            
2506            else:
2507                print(f"mean threshold measurement: {np.mean(df[self.measurement])}")
2508                print(f"median threshold measurement: {np.median(df[self.measurement])}")
2509                before = len(df)
2510                if isinstance(self.threshold, str):
2511                    if self.threshold == 'q1':
2512                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.1)
2513                    if self.threshold == 'q2':
2514                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.2)
2515                    if self.threshold == 'q3':
2516                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.3)
2517                    if self.threshold == 'q4':
2518                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.4)
2519                    if self.threshold == 'q5':
2520                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.5)
2521                    if self.threshold == 'q6':
2522                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.6)
2523                    if self.threshold == 'q7':
2524                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.7)
2525                    if self.threshold == 'q8':
2526                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.8)
2527                    if self.threshold == 'q9':
2528                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.9)
2529                print(f"threshold: {self.threshold}")
2530
2531                df = df[df[self.measurement] > self.threshold]
2532                after = len(df)
2533                print(f'Removed: {before-after} rows, retained {after}')
2534
2535            df = df.dropna(subset=['png_path'])
2536            if self.image_type:
2537                before = len(df)
2538                if isinstance(self.image_type, list):
2539                    for tpe in self.image_type:
2540                        df = df[df['png_path'].str.contains(tpe)]
2541                else:
2542                    df = df[df['png_path'].str.contains(self.image_type)]
2543                after = len(df)
2544                print(f'image_type: Removed: {before-after} rows, retained {after}')
2545
2546            self.filtered_paths_annotations = df[['png_path', self.annotation_column]].values.tolist()
2547        else:
2548            conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path)
2549            c = conn.cursor()
2550            if self.image_type:
2551                c.execute(f"SELECT png_path, {self.annotation_column} FROM png_list WHERE png_path LIKE ?", (f"%{self.image_type}%",))
2552            else:
2553                c.execute(f"SELECT png_path, {self.annotation_column} FROM png_list")
2554            self.filtered_paths_annotations = c.fetchall()
2555            conn.close()
2556
2557    def load_images(self):
2558        for label in self.labels:
2559            label.config(image='')
2560
2561        self.images = {}
2562        paths_annotations = self.filtered_paths_annotations[self.index:self.index + self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols]
2563
2564        adjusted_paths = []
2565        for path, annotation in paths_annotations:
2566            if not path.startswith(self.src):
2567                parts = path.split('/data/')
2568                if len(parts) > 1:
2569                    new_path = os.path.join(self.src, 'data', parts[1])
2570                    self.adjusted_to_original_paths[new_path] = path
2571                    adjusted_paths.append((new_path, annotation))
2572                else:
2573                    adjusted_paths.append((path, annotation))
2574            else:
2575                adjusted_paths.append((path, annotation))
2576
2577        with ThreadPoolExecutor() as executor:
2578            loaded_images = list(executor.map(self.load_single_image, adjusted_paths))
2579
2580        for i, (img, annotation) in enumerate(loaded_images):
2581            if annotation:
2582                border_color = self.active_color if annotation == 1 else 'red'
2583                img = self.add_colored_border(img, border_width=5, border_color=border_color)
2584
2585            photo = ImageTk.PhotoImage(img)
2586            label = self.labels[i]
2587            self.images[label] = photo
2588            label.config(image=photo)
2589
2590            path = adjusted_paths[i][0]
2591            label.bind('<Button-1>', self.get_on_image_click(path, label, img))
2592            label.bind('<Button-3>', self.get_on_image_click(path, label, img))
2593
2594        self.root.update()
2595
2596    def load_single_image(self, path_annotation_tuple):
2597        path, annotation = path_annotation_tuple
2598        img = Image.open(path)
2599        img = self.normalize_image(img, self.normalize, self.percentiles, self.normalize_channels)
2600        img = img.convert('RGB')
2601        img = self.filter_channels(img)
2602        img = img.resize(self.image_size)
2603        return img, annotation
2604    
2605    @staticmethod
2606    def normalize_image(img, normalize=False, percentiles=(1, 99), normalize_channels=None):
2607        """
2608        Normalize an image based on specific channels (R, G, B).
2609
2610        Args:
2611            img (PIL.Image or np.array): Input image.
2612            normalize (bool): Whether to normalize the image or not.
2613            percentiles (tuple): Percentiles to use for intensity rescaling.
2614            normalize_channels (list): List of channels to normalize. E.g., ['r', 'g', 'b'], ['r'], ['g'], etc.
2615
2616        Returns:
2617            PIL.Image: Normalized image.
2618        """
2619        img_array = np.array(img)
2620
2621        if normalize:
2622            if img_array.ndim == 2:  # Grayscale image
2623                p2, p98 = np.percentile(img_array, percentiles)
2624                img_array = rescale_intensity(img_array, in_range=(p2, p98), out_range=(0, 255))
2625            else:  # Color image or multi-channel image
2626                # Create a map for the color channels
2627                channel_map = {'r': 0, 'g': 1, 'b': 2}
2628                
2629                # If normalize_channels is not specified, normalize all channels
2630                if normalize_channels is None:
2631                    normalize_channels = ['r', 'g', 'b']
2632                
2633                for channel_name in normalize_channels:
2634                    if channel_name in channel_map:
2635                        channel_idx = channel_map[channel_name]
2636                        p2, p98 = np.percentile(img_array[:, :, channel_idx], percentiles)
2637                        img_array[:, :, channel_idx] = rescale_intensity(img_array[:, :, channel_idx], in_range=(p2, p98), out_range=(0, 255))
2638
2639        img_array = np.clip(img_array, 0, 255).astype('uint8')
2640
2641        return Image.fromarray(img_array)
2642
2643    
2644    def add_colored_border(self, img, border_width, border_color):
2645        top_border = Image.new('RGB', (img.width, border_width), color=border_color)
2646        bottom_border = Image.new('RGB', (img.width, border_width), color=border_color)
2647        left_border = Image.new('RGB', (border_width, img.height), color=border_color)
2648        right_border = Image.new('RGB', (border_width, img.height), color=border_color)
2649
2650        bordered_img = Image.new('RGB', (img.width + 2 * border_width, img.height + 2 * border_width), color=self.fg_color)
2651        bordered_img.paste(top_border, (border_width, 0))
2652        bordered_img.paste(bottom_border, (border_width, img.height + border_width))
2653        bordered_img.paste(left_border, (0, border_width))
2654        bordered_img.paste(right_border, (img.width + border_width, border_width))
2655        bordered_img.paste(img, (border_width, border_width))
2656
2657        return bordered_img
2658    
2659    def filter_channels(self, img):
2660        r, g, b = img.split()
2661        if self.channels:
2662            if 'r' not in self.channels:
2663                r = r.point(lambda _: 0)
2664            if 'g' not in self.channels:
2665                g = g.point(lambda _: 0)
2666            if 'b' not in self.channels:
2667                b = b.point(lambda _: 0)
2668
2669            if len(self.channels) == 1:
2670                channel_img = r if 'r' in self.channels else (g if 'g' in self.channels else b)
2671                return ImageOps.grayscale(channel_img)
2672
2673        return Image.merge("RGB", (r, g, b))
2674
2675    def get_on_image_click(self, path, label, img):
2676        def on_image_click(event):
2677            new_annotation = 1 if event.num == 1 else (2 if event.num == 3 else None)
2678            
2679            original_path = self.adjusted_to_original_paths.get(path, path)
2680            
2681            if original_path in self.pending_updates and self.pending_updates[original_path] == new_annotation:
2682                self.pending_updates[original_path] = None
2683                new_annotation = None
2684            else:
2685                self.pending_updates[original_path] = new_annotation
2686            
2687            print(f"Image {os.path.split(path)[1]} annotated: {new_annotation}")
2688            
2689            img_ = img.crop((5, 5, img.width-5, img.height-5))
2690            border_fill = self.active_color if new_annotation == 1 else ('red' if new_annotation == 2 else None)
2691            img_ = ImageOps.expand(img_, border=5, fill=border_fill) if border_fill else img_
2692
2693            photo = ImageTk.PhotoImage(img_)
2694            self.images[label] = photo
2695            label.config(image=photo)
2696            self.root.update()
2697
2698        return on_image_click
2699
2700    @staticmethod
2701    def update_html(text):
2702        display(HTML(f"""
2703        <script>
2704        document.getElementById('unique_id').innerHTML = '{text}';
2705        </script>
2706        """))
2707
2708    def update_database_worker(self):
2709        conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path)
2710        c = conn.cursor()
2711
2712        display(HTML("<div id='unique_id'>Initial Text</div>"))
2713
2714        while True:
2715            if self.terminate:
2716                conn.close()
2717                break
2718
2719            if not self.update_queue.empty():
2720                AnnotateApp.update_html("Do not exit, Updating database...")
2721                self.status_label.config(text='Do not exit, Updating database...')
2722
2723                pending_updates = self.update_queue.get()
2724                for path, new_annotation in pending_updates.items():
2725                    if new_annotation is None:
2726                        c.execute(f'UPDATE png_list SET {self.annotation_column} = NULL WHERE png_path = ?', (path,))
2727                    else:
2728                        c.execute(f'UPDATE png_list SET {self.annotation_column} = ? WHERE png_path = ?', (new_annotation, path))
2729                conn.commit()
2730
2731                AnnotateApp.update_html('')
2732                self.status_label.config(text='')
2733                self.root.update()
2734            time.sleep(0.1)
2735
2736    def update_gui_text(self, text):
2737        self.status_label.config(text=text)
2738        self.root.update()
2739
2740    def next_page(self):
2741        if self.pending_updates:
2742            self.update_queue.put(self.pending_updates.copy())
2743        self.pending_updates.clear()
2744        self.index += self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols
2745        self.prefilter_paths_annotations()  # Re-fetch annotations from the database
2746        self.load_images()
2747
2748    def previous_page(self):
2749        if self.pending_updates:
2750            self.update_queue.put(self.pending_updates.copy())
2751        self.pending_updates.clear()
2752        self.index -= self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols
2753        if self.index < 0:
2754            self.index = 0
2755        self.prefilter_paths_annotations()  # Re-fetch annotations from the database
2756        self.load_images()
2757
2758    def shutdown(self):
2759        self.terminate = True
2760        self.update_queue.put(self.pending_updates.copy())
2761        if not self.pending_updates:
2762            self.pending_updates.clear()
2763            self.db_update_thread.join()
2764            self.root.quit()
2765            self.root.destroy()
2766            print(f'Quit application')
2767        else:
2768            print('Waiting for pending updates to finish before quitting')
2769            
2770    def train_and_classify(self):
2771        """
2772        1) Merge data from the relevant DB tables (including png_list).
2773        2) Collect manual annotations from png_list.<annotation_column> => 'manual_annotation'.
2774           - 1 => class=1, 2 => class=0 (for training).
2775        3) If only one class is present, randomly sample unannotated images as the other class.
2776        4) Train an XGBoost model.
2777        5) Classify *all* rows -> fill XGboost_score (prob of class=1) & XGboost_annotation (1 or 2 if high confidence).
2778        6) Write those columns back to sqlite, so every row in png_list has a score (and possibly an annotation).
2779        7) Refresh the UI (prefilter_paths_annotations + load_images).
2780        """
2781
2782        # Optionally, update your GUI status label
2783        self.update_gui_text("Merging data...")
2784
2785        from spacr.io import _read_and_merge_data  # Adapt to your actual import
2786
2787        # (1) Merge data
2788        merged_df, obj_df_ls = _read_and_merge_data(
2789            locs=[self.db_path],
2790            tables=['cell', 'cytoplasm', 'nucleus', 'pathogen', 'png_list'],
2791            verbose=False
2792        )
2793
2794        # (2) Load manual annotations from the DB
2795        conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path)
2796        c = conn.cursor()
2797        c.execute(f"SELECT png_path, {self.annotation_column} FROM png_list WHERE {self.annotation_column} IS NOT NULL")
2798        annotated_rows = c.fetchall()  # e.g. [(png_path, 1 or 2), ...]
2799        conn.close()
2800
2801        # dict {png_path -> 1 or 2}
2802        annot_dict = dict(annotated_rows)
2803
2804        # Add 'manual_annotation' to merged_df
2805        merged_df['manual_annotation'] = merged_df['png_path'].map(annot_dict)
2806
2807        # Subset with manual labels
2808        annotated_df = merged_df.dropna(subset=['manual_annotation']).copy()
2809        # Convert "2" => "0" for binary classification
2810        annotated_df['manual_annotation'] = annotated_df['manual_annotation'].replace({2: 0}).astype(int)
2811
2812        # (3) Handle single-class scenario
2813        class_counts = annotated_df['manual_annotation'].value_counts()
2814        if len(class_counts) == 1:
2815            single_class = class_counts.index[0]  # 0 or 1
2816            needed = class_counts.iloc[0]
2817            other_class = 1 if single_class == 0 else 0
2818
2819            unannotated_df_all = merged_df[merged_df['manual_annotation'].isna()].copy()
2820            if len(unannotated_df_all) == 0:
2821                print("No unannotated rows to sample for the other class. Cannot proceed.")
2822                self.update_gui_text("Not enough data to train (no second class).")
2823                return
2824
2825            sample_size = min(needed, len(unannotated_df_all))
2826            artificially_labeled = unannotated_df_all.sample(n=sample_size, replace=False).copy()
2827            artificially_labeled['manual_annotation'] = other_class
2828
2829            annotated_df = pd.concat([annotated_df, artificially_labeled], ignore_index=True)
2830            print(f"Only one class was present => randomly labeled {sample_size} unannotated rows as {other_class}.")
2831
2832        if len(annotated_df) < 2:
2833            print("Not enough annotated data to train (need at least 2).")
2834            self.update_gui_text("Not enough data to train.")
2835            return
2836
2837        # (4) Train XGBoost
2838        self.update_gui_text("Training XGBoost model...")
2839
2840        # Identify numeric columns
2841        ignore_cols = {'png_path', 'manual_annotation'}
2842        feature_cols = [
2843            col for col in annotated_df.columns
2844            if col not in ignore_cols
2845            and (annotated_df[col].dtype == float or annotated_df[col].dtype == int)
2846        ]
2847
2848        X_data = annotated_df[feature_cols].fillna(0).values
2849        y_data = annotated_df['manual_annotation'].values
2850
2851        # standard train/test
2852        X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(
2853            X_data, y_data, test_size=0.1, random_state=42
2854        )
2855        model = XGBClassifier(use_label_encoder=False, eval_metric='logloss')
2856        model.fit(X_train, y_train)
2857
2858        # Evaluate
2859        preds = model.predict(X_test)
2860        print("=== Classification Report ===")
2861        print(classification_report(y_test, preds))
2862        print("=== Confusion Matrix ===")
2863        print(confusion_matrix(y_test, preds))
2864
2865        # (5) Classify ALL rows
2866        all_df = merged_df.copy()
2867        X_all = all_df[feature_cols].fillna(0).values
2868        probs_all = model.predict_proba(X_all)[:, 1]
2869        # Probability => XGboost_score
2870        all_df['XGboost_score'] = probs_all
2871
2872        # Decide XGboost_annotation
2873        def get_annotation_from_prob(prob):
2874            if prob > 0.9:
2875                return 1  # class=1
2876            elif prob < 0.1:
2877                return 0  # class=0
2878            return None  # uncertain
2879
2880        xgb_anno_col = [get_annotation_from_prob(p) for p in probs_all]
2881        # Convert 0 => 2 if your DB uses "2" for the negative class
2882        xgb_anno_col = [2 if x == 0 else x for x in xgb_anno_col]
2883
2884        all_df['XGboost_annotation'] = xgb_anno_col
2885
2886        # (6) Write results back to png_list
2887        self.update_gui_text("Updating the database with XGBoost predictions...")
2888        conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path)
2889        c = conn.cursor()
2890        # Ensure columns exist
2891        try:
2892            c.execute("ALTER TABLE png_list ADD COLUMN XGboost_annotation INTEGER")
2893        except sqlite3.OperationalError:
2894            pass
2895        try:
2896            c.execute("ALTER TABLE png_list ADD COLUMN XGboost_score FLOAT")
2897        except sqlite3.OperationalError:
2898            pass
2899
2900        # Update each row
2901        for idx, row in all_df.iterrows():
2902            score_val = float(row['XGboost_score'])
2903            anno_val  = row['XGboost_annotation']
2904            the_path  = row['png_path']
2905            if pd.isna(the_path):
2906                continue  # skip if no path
2907
2908            if pd.isna(anno_val):
2909                # We set annotation=NULL but do set the score
2910                c.execute("""
2911                    UPDATE png_list
2912                       SET XGboost_annotation = NULL,
2913                           XGboost_score       = ?
2914                     WHERE png_path = ?
2915                """, (score_val, the_path))
2916            else:
2917                # numeric annotation + numeric score
2918                c.execute("""
2919                    UPDATE png_list
2920                       SET XGboost_annotation = ?,
2921                           XGboost_score       = ?
2922                     WHERE png_path = ?
2923                """, (int(anno_val), score_val, the_path))
2924                
2925        self.annotation_column = 'XGboost_annotation'
2926
2927def standardize_figure(fig):
2928    from .gui_elements import set_dark_style
2929    from matplotlib.font_manager import FontProperties
2930
2931    style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
2932    bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
2933    fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
2934    font_size = style_out['font_size']
2935    font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
2936
2937    # Get the custom font path from the font loader
2938    font_path = font_loader.font_path
2939    font_prop = FontProperties(fname=font_path, size=font_size)
2940
2941    """
2942    Standardizes the appearance of the figure:
2943    - Font size: from style
2944    - Font color: from style
2945    - Font family: custom OpenSans from font_loader
2946    - Removes top and right spines
2947    - Figure and subplot background: from style
2948    - Line width: 1
2949    - Line color: from style
2950    """
2951    
2952
2953    for ax in fig.get_axes():
2954        # Set font properties for title and labels
2955        ax.title.set_fontsize(font_size)
2956        ax.title.set_color(fg_color)
2957        ax.title.set_fontproperties(font_prop)
2958
2959        ax.xaxis.label.set_fontsize(font_size)
2960        ax.xaxis.label.set_color(fg_color)
2961        ax.xaxis.label.set_fontproperties(font_prop)
2962
2963        ax.yaxis.label.set_fontsize(font_size)
2964        ax.yaxis.label.set_color(fg_color)
2965        ax.yaxis.label.set_fontproperties(font_prop)
2966
2967        # Set font properties for tick labels
2968        for label in ax.get_xticklabels() + ax.get_yticklabels():
2969            label.set_fontsize(font_size)
2970            label.set_color(fg_color)
2971            label.set_fontproperties(font_prop)
2972
2973        # Remove top and right spines
2974        ax.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
2975        ax.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
2976        ax.spines['left'].set_visible(True)
2977        ax.spines['bottom'].set_visible(True)
2978
2979        # Set spine line width and color
2980        for spine in ax.spines.values():
2981            spine.set_linewidth(1)
2982            spine.set_edgecolor(fg_color)
2983
2984        # Set line width and color
2985        for line in ax.get_lines():
2986            line.set_linewidth(1)
2987            line.set_color(fg_color)
2988
2989        # Set subplot background color
2990        ax.set_facecolor(bg_color)
2991
2992        # Adjust the grid if needed
2993        ax.grid(True, color='gray', linestyle='--', linewidth=0.5)
2994
2995    # Set figure background color
2996    fig.patch.set_facecolor(bg_color)
2997
2998    fig.canvas.draw_idle()
2999
3000    return fig
3001
3002def modify_figure_properties(fig, scale_x=None, scale_y=None, line_width=None, font_size=None, x_lim=None, y_lim=None, grid=False, legend=None, title=None, x_label_rotation=None, remove_axes=False, bg_color=None, text_color=None, line_color=None):
3003    """
3004    Modifies the properties of the figure, including scaling, line widths, font sizes, axis limits, x-axis label rotation, background color, text color, line color, and other common options.
3005
3006    Parameters:
3007    - fig: The Matplotlib figure object to modify.
3008    - scale_x: Scaling factor for the width of subplots (optional).
3009    - scale_y: Scaling factor for the height of subplots (optional).
3010    - line_width: Desired line width for all lines (optional).
3011    - font_size: Desired font size for all text (optional).
3012    - x_lim: Tuple specifying the x-axis limits (min, max) (optional).
3013    - y_lim: Tuple specifying the y-axis limits (min, max) (optional).
3014    - grid: Boolean to add grid lines to the plot (optional).
3015    - legend: Boolean to show/hide the legend (optional).
3016    - title: String to set as the title of the plot (optional).
3017    - x_label_rotation: Angle to rotate the x-axis labels (optional).
3018    - remove_axes: Boolean to remove or show the axes labels (optional).
3019    - bg_color: Color for the figure and subplot background (optional).
3020    - text_color: Color for all text in the figure (optional).
3021    - line_color: Color for all lines in the figure (optional).
3022    """
3023    if fig is None:
3024        print("Error: The figure provided is None.")
3025        return
3026
3027    for ax in fig.get_axes():
3028        # Rescale subplots if scaling factors are provided
3029        if scale_x is not None or scale_y is not None:
3030            bbox = ax.get_position()
3031            width = bbox.width * (scale_x if scale_x else 1)
3032            height = bbox.height * (scale_y if scale_y else 1)
3033            new_bbox = [bbox.x0, bbox.y0, width, height]
3034            ax.set_position(new_bbox)
3035
3036        # Set axis limits if provided
3037        if x_lim is not None:
3038            ax.set_xlim(x_lim)
3039        if y_lim is not None:
3040            ax.set_ylim(y_lim)
3041
3042        # Set grid visibility only
3043        ax.grid(grid)
3044
3045        # Adjust line width and color if specified
3046        if line_width is not None or line_color is not None:
3047            for line in ax.get_lines():
3048                if line_width is not None:
3049                    line.set_linewidth(line_width)
3050                if line_color is not None:
3051                    line.set_color(line_color)
3052            for spine in ax.spines.values():  # Modify width and color of spines (e.g., scale bars)
3053                if line_width is not None:
3054                    spine.set_linewidth(line_width)
3055                if line_color is not None:
3056                    spine.set_edgecolor(line_color)
3057            ax.tick_params(width=line_width, colors=text_color if text_color else 'black')
3058
3059        # Adjust font size if specified
3060        if font_size is not None:
3061            for label in ax.get_xticklabels() + ax.get_yticklabels():
3062                label.set_fontsize(font_size)
3063            ax.title.set_fontsize(font_size)
3064            ax.xaxis.label.set_fontsize(font_size)
3065            ax.yaxis.label.set_fontsize(font_size)
3066            if ax.legend_:
3067                for text in ax.legend_.get_texts():
3068                    text.set_fontsize(font_size)
3069
3070        # Rotate x-axis labels if rotation is specified
3071        if x_label_rotation is not None:
3072            for label in ax.get_xticklabels():
3073                label.set_rotation(x_label_rotation)
3074                if 0 <= x_label_rotation <= 90:
3075                    label.set_ha('center')
3076
3077        # Toggle axes labels visibility without affecting the grid or spines
3078        if remove_axes:
3079            ax.xaxis.set_visible(False)
3080            ax.yaxis.set_visible(False)
3081        else:
3082            ax.xaxis.set_visible(True)
3083            ax.yaxis.set_visible(True)
3084
3085        # Set text color if specified
3086        if text_color:
3087            ax.title.set_color(text_color)
3088            ax.xaxis.label.set_color(text_color)
3089            ax.yaxis.label.set_color(text_color)
3090            ax.tick_params(colors=text_color)
3091            for label in ax.get_xticklabels() + ax.get_yticklabels():
3092                label.set_color(text_color)
3093
3094        # Set background color for subplots if specified
3095        if bg_color:
3096            ax.set_facecolor(bg_color)
3097
3098    # Set figure background color if specified
3099    if bg_color:
3100        fig.patch.set_facecolor(bg_color)
3101
3102    fig.canvas.draw_idle()
3103
3104def save_figure_as_format(fig, file_format):
3105    file_path = filedialog.asksaveasfilename(defaultextension=f".{file_format}", filetypes=[(f"{file_format.upper()} files", f"*.{file_format}"), ("All files", "*.*")])
3106    if file_path:
3107        try:
3108            fig.savefig(file_path, format=file_format)
3109            print(f"Figure saved as {file_format.upper()} at {file_path}")
3110        except Exception as e:
3111            print(f"Error saving figure: {e}")
3112
3113def modify_figure(fig):
3114    from .gui_core import display_figure
3115    def apply_modifications():
3116        try:
3117            # Only apply changes if the fields are filled
3118            scale_x = float(scale_x_var.get()) if scale_x_var.get() else None
3119            scale_y = float(scale_y_var.get()) if scale_y_var.get() else None
3120            line_width = float(line_width_var.get()) if line_width_var.get() else None
3121            font_size = int(font_size_var.get()) if font_size_var.get() else None
3122            x_lim = eval(x_lim_var.get()) if x_lim_var.get() else None
3123            y_lim = eval(y_lim_var.get()) if y_lim_var.get() else None
3124            title = title_var.get() if title_var.get() else None
3125            bg_color = bg_color_var.get() if bg_color_var.get() else None
3126            text_color = text_color_var.get() if text_color_var.get() else None
3127            line_color = line_color_var.get() if line_color_var.get() else None
3128            x_label_rotation = int(x_label_rotation_var.get()) if x_label_rotation_var.get() else None
3129
3130            modify_figure_properties(
3131                fig,
3132                scale_x=scale_x,
3133                scale_y=scale_y,
3134                line_width=line_width,
3135                font_size=font_size,
3136                x_lim=x_lim,
3137                y_lim=y_lim,
3138                grid=grid_var.get(),
3139                legend=legend_var.get(),
3140                title=title,
3141                x_label_rotation=x_label_rotation,
3142                remove_axes=remove_axes_var.get(),
3143                bg_color=bg_color,
3144                text_color=text_color,
3145                line_color=line_color
3146            )
3147            display_figure(fig)
3148        except ValueError:
3149            print("Invalid input; please enter numeric values.")
3150
3151    def toggle_spleens():
3152        for ax in fig.get_axes():
3153            if spleens_var.get():
3154                ax.spines['top'].set_visible(False)
3155                ax.spines['right'].set_visible(False)
3156                ax.spines['left'].set_visible(True)
3157                ax.spines['bottom'].set_visible(True)
3158                ax.spines['top'].set_linewidth(2)
3159                ax.spines['right'].set_linewidth(2)
3160            else:
3161                ax.spines['top'].set_visible(True)
3162                ax.spines['right'].set_visible(True)
3163            display_figure(fig)
3164
3165    # Create a new window for user input
3166    modify_window = tk.Toplevel()
3167    modify_window.title("Modify Figure Properties")
3168
3169    # Apply dark style to the popup window
3170    style = ttk.Style()
3171    style.configure("TCheckbutton", background="#2E2E2E", foreground="white", selectcolor="blue")
3172
3173    modify_window.configure(bg="#2E2E2E")
3174
3175    # Create and style the input fields
3176    scale_x_var = tk.StringVar()
3177    scale_y_var = tk.StringVar()
3178    line_width_var = tk.StringVar()
3179    font_size_var = tk.StringVar()
3180    x_lim_var = tk.StringVar()
3181    y_lim_var = tk.StringVar()
3182    title_var = tk.StringVar()
3183    bg_color_var = tk.StringVar()
3184    text_color_var = tk.StringVar()
3185    line_color_var = tk.StringVar()
3186    x_label_rotation_var = tk.StringVar()
3187    remove_axes_var = tk.BooleanVar()
3188    grid_var = tk.BooleanVar()
3189    legend_var = tk.BooleanVar()
3190    spleens_var = tk.BooleanVar()
3191
3192    options = [
3193        ("Rescale X:", scale_x_var),
3194        ("Rescale Y:", scale_y_var),
3195        ("Line Width:", line_width_var),
3196        ("Font Size:", font_size_var),
3197        ("X Axis Limits (tuple):", x_lim_var),
3198        ("Y Axis Limits (tuple):", y_lim_var),
3199        ("Title:", title_var),
3200        ("X Label Rotation (degrees):", x_label_rotation_var),
3201        ("Background Color:", bg_color_var),
3202        ("Text Color:", text_color_var),
3203        ("Line Color:", line_color_var)
3204    ]
3205
3206    for i, (label_text, var) in enumerate(options):
3207        tk.Label(modify_window, text=label_text, bg="#2E2E2E", fg="white").grid(row=i, column=0, padx=10, pady=5)
3208        tk.Entry(modify_window, textvariable=var, bg="#2E2E2E", fg="white").grid(row=i, column=1, padx=10, pady=5)
3209
3210    checkboxes = [
3211        ("Grid", grid_var),
3212        ("Legend", legend_var),
3213        ("Spleens", spleens_var),
3214        ("Remove Axes", remove_axes_var)
3215    ]
3216
3217    for i, (label_text, var) in enumerate(checkboxes, start=len(options)):
3218        ttk.Checkbutton(modify_window, text=label_text, variable=var, style="TCheckbutton").grid(row=i, column=0, padx=10, pady=5, columnspan=2, sticky='w')
3219
3220    spleens_var.trace_add("write", lambda *args: toggle_spleens())
3221
3222    # Apply button
3223    apply_button = tk.Button(modify_window, text="Apply", command=apply_modifications, bg="#2E2E2E", fg="white")
3224    apply_button.grid(row=len(options) + len(checkboxes), column=0, columnspan=2, pady=10)
3225
