class spacrProgressBar(tkinter.ttk.Progressbar): 
671class spacrProgressBar(ttk.Progressbar):
672    def __init__(self, parent, label=True, *args, **kwargs):
673        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
674
675        # Get the style colors
676        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
677
678        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
679        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
680        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
681        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
682        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
683        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
684
685        # Configure the style for the progress bar
686        self.style = ttk.Style()
687        
688        # Remove any borders and ensure the active color fills the entire space
689        self.style.configure(
690            "spacr.Horizontal.TProgressbar",
691            troughcolor=self.inactive_color, # Set the trough to bg color
692            background=self.active_color,    # Active part is the active color
693            borderwidth=0,                   # Remove border width
694            pbarrelief="flat",               # Flat relief for the progress bar
695            troughrelief="flat",             # Flat relief for the trough
696            thickness=20,                    # Set the thickness of the progress bar
697            darkcolor=self.active_color,     # Ensure darkcolor matches the active color
698            lightcolor=self.active_color,    # Ensure lightcolor matches the active color
699            bordercolor=self.bg_color        # Set the border color to the background color to hide it
700        )
701
702        self.configure(style="spacr.Horizontal.TProgressbar")
703
704        # Set initial value to 0
705        self['value'] = 0
706
707        # Track whether to show the progress label
708        self.label = label
709
710        # Create the progress label with text wrapping
711        if self.label:
712            self.progress_label = tk.Label(
713                parent,
714                text="Processing: 0/0",
715                anchor='w',
716                justify='left',
717                bg=self.inactive_color,
718                fg=self.fg_color,
719                wraplength=300,
720                font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size)
721            )
722            self.progress_label.grid_forget()
723
724        # Initialize attributes for time and operation
725        self.operation_type = None
726        self.additional_info = None
727
728    def set_label_position(self):
729        if self.label and self.progress_label:
730            row_info = self.grid_info().get('rowID', 0)
731            col_info = self.grid_info().get('columnID', 0)
732            col_span = self.grid_info().get('columnspan', 1)
733            self.progress_label.grid(row=row_info + 1, column=col_info, columnspan=col_span, pady=5, padx=5, sticky='ew')
734
735    def update_label(self):
736        if self.label and self.progress_label:
737            # Start with the base progress information
738            label_text = f"Processing: {self['value']}/{self['maximum']}"
739            
740            # Include the operation type if it exists
741            if self.operation_type:
742                label_text += f", {self.operation_type}"
743            
744            # Handle additional info without adding newlines
745            if hasattr(self, 'additional_info') and self.additional_info:
746                # Join all additional info items with a space and ensure they're on the same line
747                items = self.additional_info.split(", ")
748                formatted_additional_info = " ".join(items)
749
750                # Append the additional info to the label_text, ensuring it's all in one line
751                label_text += f" {formatted_additional_info.strip()}"
752
753            # Update the progress label
754            self.progress_label.config(text=label_text)

Ttk Progressbar widget shows the status of a long-running operation. They can operate in two modes: determinate mode shows the amount completed relative to the total amount of work to be done, and indeterminate mode provides an animated display to let the user know that something is happening.

spacrProgressBar(parent, label=True, *args, **kwargs) 
672    def __init__(self, parent, label=True, *args, **kwargs):
673        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
674
675        # Get the style colors
676        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
677
678        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
679        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
680        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
681        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
682        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
683        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
684
685        # Configure the style for the progress bar
686        self.style = ttk.Style()
687        
688        # Remove any borders and ensure the active color fills the entire space
689        self.style.configure(
690            "spacr.Horizontal.TProgressbar",
691            troughcolor=self.inactive_color, # Set the trough to bg color
692            background=self.active_color,    # Active part is the active color
693            borderwidth=0,                   # Remove border width
694            pbarrelief="flat",               # Flat relief for the progress bar
695            troughrelief="flat",             # Flat relief for the trough
696            thickness=20,                    # Set the thickness of the progress bar
697            darkcolor=self.active_color,     # Ensure darkcolor matches the active color
698            lightcolor=self.active_color,    # Ensure lightcolor matches the active color
699            bordercolor=self.bg_color        # Set the border color to the background color to hide it
700        )
701
702        self.configure(style="spacr.Horizontal.TProgressbar")
703
704        # Set initial value to 0
705        self['value'] = 0
706
707        # Track whether to show the progress label
708        self.label = label
709
710        # Create the progress label with text wrapping
711        if self.label:
712            self.progress_label = tk.Label(
713                parent,
714                text="Processing: 0/0",
715                anchor='w',
716                justify='left',
717                bg=self.inactive_color,
718                fg=self.fg_color,
719                wraplength=300,
720                font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size)
721            )
722            self.progress_label.grid_forget()
723
724        # Initialize attributes for time and operation
725        self.operation_type = None
726        self.additional_info = None

Construct a Ttk Progressbar with parent master.

STANDARD OPTIONS

class, cursor, style, takefocus

WIDGET-SPECIFIC OPTIONS

orient, length, mode, maximum, value, variable, phase
fg_color
bg_color
active_color
inactive_color
font_size
font_loader
style
label
operation_type
additional_info
def set_label_position(self): 
728    def set_label_position(self):
729        if self.label and self.progress_label:
730            row_info = self.grid_info().get('rowID', 0)
731            col_info = self.grid_info().get('columnID', 0)
732            col_span = self.grid_info().get('columnspan', 1)
733            self.progress_label.grid(row=row_info + 1, column=col_info, columnspan=col_span, pady=5, padx=5, sticky='ew')
def update_label(self): 
735    def update_label(self):
736        if self.label and self.progress_label:
737            # Start with the base progress information
738            label_text = f"Processing: {self['value']}/{self['maximum']}"
739            
740            # Include the operation type if it exists
741            if self.operation_type:
742                label_text += f", {self.operation_type}"
743            
744            # Handle additional info without adding newlines
745            if hasattr(self, 'additional_info') and self.additional_info:
746                # Join all additional info items with a space and ensure they're on the same line
747                items = self.additional_info.split(", ")
748                formatted_additional_info = " ".join(items)
749
750                # Append the additional info to the label_text, ensuring it's all in one line
751                label_text += f" {formatted_additional_info.strip()}"
752
753            # Update the progress label
754            self.progress_label.config(text=label_text)
class spacrSlider(tkinter.Frame): 
756class spacrSlider(tk.Frame):
757    def __init__(self, master=None, length=None, thickness=2, knob_radius=10, position="center", from_=0, to=100, value=None, show_index=False, command=None, **kwargs):
758        super().__init__(master, **kwargs)
759
760        self.specified_length = length  # Store the specified length, if any
761        self.knob_radius = knob_radius
762        self.thickness = thickness
763        self.knob_position = knob_radius  # Start at the beginning of the slider
764        self.slider_line = None
765        self.knob = None
766        self.position = position.lower()  # Store the position option
767        self.offset = 0  # Initialize offset
768        self.from_ = from_  # Minimum value of the slider
769        self.to = to  # Maximum value of the slider
770        self.value = value if value is not None else from_  # Initial value of the slider
771        self.show_index = show_index  # Whether to show the index Entry widget
772        self.command = command  # Callback function to handle value changes
773
774        # Initialize the style and colors
775        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
776        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
777        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
778        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
779        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
780
781        # Configure the frame's background color
782        self.configure(bg=self.bg_color)
783
784        # Create a frame for the slider and entry if needed
785        self.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
786
787        # Entry widget for showing and editing index, if enabled
788        if self.show_index:
789            self.index_var = tk.StringVar(value=str(int(self.value)))
790            self.index_entry = tk.Entry(self, textvariable=self.index_var, width=5, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, insertbackground=self.fg_color)
791            self.index_entry.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=5)
792            # Bind the entry to update the slider on change
793            self.index_entry.bind("<Return>", self.update_slider_from_entry)
794
795        # Create the slider canvas
796        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, height=knob_radius * 2, bg=self.bg_color, highlightthickness=0)
797        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="ew")
798
799        # Set initial length to specified length or default value
800        self.length = self.specified_length if self.specified_length is not None else self.canvas.winfo_reqwidth()
801
802        # Calculate initial knob position based on the initial value
803        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
804
805        # Bind resize event to dynamically adjust the slider length if no length is specified
806        self.canvas.bind("<Configure>", self.resize_slider)
807
808        # Draw the slider components
809        self.draw_slider(inactive=True)
810
811        # Bind mouse events to the knob and slider
812        self.canvas.bind("<B1-Motion>", self.move_knob)
813        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.activate_knob)  # Activate knob on click
814        self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-1>", self.release_knob)  # Trigger command on release
815
816    def resize_slider(self, event):
817        if self.specified_length is not None:
818            self.length = self.specified_length
819        else:
820            self.length = int(event.width * 0.9)  # 90% of the container width
821        
822        # Calculate the horizontal offset based on the position
823        if self.position == "center":
824            self.offset = (event.width - self.length) // 2
825        elif self.position == "right":
826            self.offset = event.width - self.length
827        else:  # position is "left"
828            self.offset = 0
829
830        # Update the knob position after resizing
831        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
832        self.draw_slider(inactive=True)
833
834    def value_to_position(self, value):
835        if self.to == self.from_:
836            return self.knob_radius
837        relative_value = (value - self.from_) / (self.to - self.from_)
838        return self.knob_radius + relative_value * (self.length - 2 * self.knob_radius)
839
840    def position_to_value(self, position):
841        if self.to == self.from_:
842            return self.from_
843        relative_position = (position - self.knob_radius) / (self.length - 2 * self.knob_radius)
844        return self.from_ + relative_position * (self.to - self.from_)
845
846    def draw_slider(self, inactive=False):
847        self.canvas.delete("all")
848
849        self.slider_line = self.canvas.create_line(
850            self.offset + self.knob_radius, 
851            self.knob_radius, 
852            self.offset + self.length - self.knob_radius, 
853            self.knob_radius, 
854            fill=self.fg_color, 
855            width=self.thickness
856        )
857
858        knob_color = self.inactive_color if inactive else self.active_color
859        self.knob = self.canvas.create_oval(
860            self.offset + self.knob_position - self.knob_radius, 
861            self.knob_radius - self.knob_radius, 
862            self.offset + self.knob_position + self.knob_radius, 
863            self.knob_radius + self.knob_radius, 
864            fill=knob_color, 
865            outline=""
866        )
867
868    def move_knob(self, event):
869        new_position = min(max(event.x - self.offset, self.knob_radius), self.length - self.knob_radius)
870        self.knob_position = new_position
871        self.value = self.position_to_value(self.knob_position)
872        self.canvas.coords(
873            self.knob, 
874            self.offset + self.knob_position - self.knob_radius, 
875            self.knob_radius - self.knob_radius, 
876            self.offset + self.knob_position + self.knob_radius, 
877            self.knob_radius + self.knob_radius
878        )
879        if self.show_index:
880            self.index_var.set(str(int(self.value)))
881
882    def activate_knob(self, event):
883        self.draw_slider(inactive=False)
884        self.move_knob(event)
885
886    def release_knob(self, event):
887        self.draw_slider(inactive=True)
888        if self.command:
889            self.command(self.value)  # Call the command with the final value when the knob is released
890
891    def set_to(self, new_to):
892        self.to = new_to
893        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
894        self.draw_slider(inactive=False)
895
896    def get(self):
897        return self.value
898
899    def set(self, value):
900        """Set the slider's value and update the knob position."""
901        self.value = max(self.from_, min(value, self.to))  # Ensure the value is within bounds
902        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
903        self.draw_slider(inactive=False)
904        if self.show_index:
905            self.index_var.set(str(int(self.value)))
906
907    def jump_to_click(self, event):
908        self.activate_knob(event)
909
910    def update_slider_from_entry(self, event):
911        """Update the slider's value from the entry."""
912        try:
913            index = int(self.index_var.get())
914            self.set(index)
915            if self.command:
916                self.command(self.value)
917        except ValueError:
918            pass

Frame widget which may contain other widgets and can have a 3D border.

spacrSlider( master=None, length=None, thickness=2, knob_radius=10, position='center', from_=0, to=100, value=None, show_index=False, command=None, **kwargs) 
757    def __init__(self, master=None, length=None, thickness=2, knob_radius=10, position="center", from_=0, to=100, value=None, show_index=False, command=None, **kwargs):
758        super().__init__(master, **kwargs)
759
760        self.specified_length = length  # Store the specified length, if any
761        self.knob_radius = knob_radius
762        self.thickness = thickness
763        self.knob_position = knob_radius  # Start at the beginning of the slider
764        self.slider_line = None
765        self.knob = None
766        self.position = position.lower()  # Store the position option
767        self.offset = 0  # Initialize offset
768        self.from_ = from_  # Minimum value of the slider
769        self.to = to  # Maximum value of the slider
770        self.value = value if value is not None else from_  # Initial value of the slider
771        self.show_index = show_index  # Whether to show the index Entry widget
772        self.command = command  # Callback function to handle value changes
773
774        # Initialize the style and colors
775        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
776        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
777        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
778        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
779        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
780
781        # Configure the frame's background color
782        self.configure(bg=self.bg_color)
783
784        # Create a frame for the slider and entry if needed
785        self.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
786
787        # Entry widget for showing and editing index, if enabled
788        if self.show_index:
789            self.index_var = tk.StringVar(value=str(int(self.value)))
790            self.index_entry = tk.Entry(self, textvariable=self.index_var, width=5, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, insertbackground=self.fg_color)
791            self.index_entry.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=5)
792            # Bind the entry to update the slider on change
793            self.index_entry.bind("<Return>", self.update_slider_from_entry)
794
795        # Create the slider canvas
796        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, height=knob_radius * 2, bg=self.bg_color, highlightthickness=0)
797        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="ew")
798
799        # Set initial length to specified length or default value
800        self.length = self.specified_length if self.specified_length is not None else self.canvas.winfo_reqwidth()
801
802        # Calculate initial knob position based on the initial value
803        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
804
805        # Bind resize event to dynamically adjust the slider length if no length is specified
806        self.canvas.bind("<Configure>", self.resize_slider)
807
808        # Draw the slider components
809        self.draw_slider(inactive=True)
810
811        # Bind mouse events to the knob and slider
812        self.canvas.bind("<B1-Motion>", self.move_knob)
813        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.activate_knob)  # Activate knob on click
814        self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-1>", self.release_knob)  # Trigger command on release

Construct a frame widget with the parent MASTER.

Valid resource names: background, bd, bg, borderwidth, class, colormap, container, cursor, height, highlightbackground, highlightcolor, highlightthickness, relief, takefocus, visual, width.

def resize_slider(self, event): 
816    def resize_slider(self, event):
817        if self.specified_length is not None:
818            self.length = self.specified_length
819        else:
820            self.length = int(event.width * 0.9)  # 90% of the container width
821        
822        # Calculate the horizontal offset based on the position
823        if self.position == "center":
824            self.offset = (event.width - self.length) // 2
825        elif self.position == "right":
826            self.offset = event.width - self.length
827        else:  # position is "left"
828            self.offset = 0
829
830        # Update the knob position after resizing
831        self.knob_position = self.value_to_position(self.value)
832        self.draw_slider(inactive=True)
def value_to_position(self, value): 
834    def value_to_position(self, value):
835        if self.to == self.from_:
836            return self.knob_radius
837        relative_value = (value - self.from_) / (self.to - self.from_)
838        return self.knob_radius + relative_value * (self.length - 2 * self.knob_radius)
def position_to_value(self, position): 
840    def position_to_value(self, position):
841        if self.to == self.from_:
842            return self.from_
843        relative_position = (position - self.knob_radius) / (self.length - 2 * self.knob_radius)
844        return self.from_ + relative_position * (self.to - self.from_)
def draw_slider(self, inactive=False): 
846    def draw_slider(self, inactive=False):

848

850            self.offset + self.knob_radius, 
851            self.knob_radius, 
852            self.offset + self.length - self.knob_radius, 
853            self.knob_radius, 
854            fill=self.fg_color, 
855            width=self.thickness
856        )
857
858        knob_color = self.inactive_color if inactive else self.active_color
859        self.knob = self.canvas.create_oval(
860            self.offset + self.knob_position - self.knob_radius, 
861            self.knob_radius - self.knob_radius, 
862            self.offset + self.knob_position + self.knob_radius, 
863            self.knob_radius + self.knob_radius, 
864            fill=knob_color, 
865            outline=""
866        )
def move_knob(self, event): 
868    def move_knob(self, event):
869        new_position = min(max(event.x - self.offset, self.knob_radius), self.length - self.knob_radius)
870        self.knob_position = new_position
871        self.value = self.position_to_value(self.knob_position)
872        self.canvas.coords(

876            self.offset + self.knob_position + self.knob_radius, 
877            self.knob_radius + self.knob_radius
878        )

def activate_knob(self, event):

def release_knob(self, event): 
886    def release_knob(self, event):

def update_slider_from_entry(self, event):

Update the slider's value from the entry.

def spacrScrollbarStyle(style, inactive_color, active_color): 
920def spacrScrollbarStyle(style, inactive_color, active_color):
921    # Check if custom elements already exist to avoid duplication
922    if not style.element_names().count('custom.Vertical.Scrollbar.trough'):
923        style.element_create('custom.Vertical.Scrollbar.trough', 'from', 'clam')
924    if not style.element_names().count('custom.Vertical.Scrollbar.thumb'):
925        style.element_create('custom.Vertical.Scrollbar.thumb', 'from', 'clam')
926
927    style.layout('Custom.Vertical.TScrollbar',
928                 [('Vertical.Scrollbar.trough', {'children': [('Vertical.Scrollbar.thumb', {'expand': '1', 'sticky': 'nswe'})], 'sticky': 'ns'})])
929
930    style.configure('Custom.Vertical.TScrollbar',
931                    background=inactive_color,
932                    troughcolor=inactive_color,
933                    bordercolor=inactive_color,
934                    lightcolor=inactive_color,
935                    darkcolor=inactive_color)
936
937    style.map('Custom.Vertical.TScrollbar',
938              background=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', active_color)],
939              troughcolor=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', inactive_color)],
940              bordercolor=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', inactive_color)],
941              lightcolor=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', active_color)],
942              darkcolor=[('!active', inactive_color), ('active', active_color)])
class spacrFrame(tkinter.ttk.Frame): 
 944class spacrFrame(ttk.Frame):
 945    def __init__(self, container, width=None, *args, bg='black', radius=20, scrollbar=True, textbox=False, **kwargs):
 946        super().__init__(container, *args, **kwargs)
 947        self.configure(style='TFrame')
 948        if width is None:
 949            screen_width = self.winfo_screenwidth()
 950            width = screen_width // 4
 951
 952        # Create the canvas
 953        canvas = tk.Canvas(self, bg=bg, width=width, highlightthickness=0)
 954        self.rounded_rectangle(canvas, 0, 0, width, self.winfo_screenheight(), radius, fill=bg)
 955
 956        # Define scrollbar styles
 957        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
 958        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
 959        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
 960        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']  # Foreground color for text
 961
 962        # Set custom scrollbar style
 963        style = ttk.Style()
 964        spacrScrollbarStyle(style, self.inactive_color, self.active_color)
 965
 966        # Create scrollbar with custom style if scrollbar option is True
 967        if scrollbar:
 968            scrollbar_widget = ttk.Scrollbar(self, orient="vertical", command=canvas.yview, style='Custom.Vertical.TScrollbar')
 969        
 970        if textbox:
 971            self.scrollable_frame = tk.Text(canvas, bg=bg, fg=self.fg_color, wrap=tk.WORD)
 972        else:
 973            self.scrollable_frame = ttk.Frame(canvas, style='TFrame')
 974        
 975        self.scrollable_frame.bind(
 976            "<Configure>",
 977            lambda e: canvas.configure(scrollregion=canvas.bbox("all"))
 978        )
 979        canvas.create_window((0, 0), window=self.scrollable_frame, anchor="nw")
 980        if scrollbar:
 981            canvas.configure(yscrollcommand=scrollbar_widget.set)
 982        
 983        canvas.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
 984        if scrollbar:
 985            scrollbar_widget.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="ns")
 986
 987        self.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
 988        self.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
 989        if scrollbar:
 990            self.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=0)
 991        
 992        _ = set_dark_style(style, containers=[self], widgets=[canvas, self.scrollable_frame])
 993        if scrollbar:
 994            _ = set_dark_style(style, widgets=[scrollbar_widget])
 995
 996    def rounded_rectangle(self, canvas, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=20, **kwargs):
 997        points = [
 998            x1 + radius, y1,
 999            x2 - radius, y1,
1000            x2 - radius, y1,
1001            x2, y1,
1002            x2, y1 + radius,
1003            x2, y2 - radius,
1004            x2, y2 - radius,
1005            x2, y2,
1006            x2 - radius, y2,
1007            x1 + radius, y2,
1008            x1 + radius, y2,
1009            x1, y2,
1010            x1, y2 - radius,
1011            x1, y2 - radius,
1012            x1, y1 + radius,
1013            x1, y1 + radius,
1014            x1, y1
1015        ]
1016        return canvas.create_polygon(points, **kwargs, smooth=True)

Ttk Frame widget is a container, used to group other widgets together.

spacrFrame( container, width=None, *args, bg='black', radius=20, scrollbar=True, textbox=False, **kwargs) 
945    def __init__(self, container, width=None, *args, bg='black', radius=20, scrollbar=True, textbox=False, **kwargs):
946        super().__init__(container, *args, **kwargs)
947        self.configure(style='TFrame')
948        if width is None:
949            screen_width = self.winfo_screenwidth()
950            width = screen_width // 4
951
952        # Create the canvas
953        canvas = tk.Canvas(self, bg=bg, width=width, highlightthickness=0)
954        self.rounded_rectangle(canvas, 0, 0, width, self.winfo_screenheight(), radius, fill=bg)
955
956        # Define scrollbar styles
957        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
958        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
959        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
960        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']  # Foreground color for text
961
962        # Set custom scrollbar style
963        style = ttk.Style()
964        spacrScrollbarStyle(style, self.inactive_color, self.active_color)
965
966        # Create scrollbar with custom style if scrollbar option is True
967        if scrollbar:
968            scrollbar_widget = ttk.Scrollbar(self, orient="vertical", command=canvas.yview, style='Custom.Vertical.TScrollbar')
969        
970        if textbox:
971            self.scrollable_frame = tk.Text(canvas, bg=bg, fg=self.fg_color, wrap=tk.WORD)
972        else:
973            self.scrollable_frame = ttk.Frame(canvas, style='TFrame')
974        
975        self.scrollable_frame.bind(
976            "<Configure>",
977            lambda e: canvas.configure(scrollregion=canvas.bbox("all"))
978        )
979        canvas.create_window((0, 0), window=self.scrollable_frame, anchor="nw")
980        if scrollbar:
981            canvas.configure(yscrollcommand=scrollbar_widget.set)
982        
983        canvas.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")
984        if scrollbar:
985            scrollbar_widget.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="ns")
986
987        self.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
988        self.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
989        if scrollbar:
990            self.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=0)
991        
992        _ = set_dark_style(style, containers=[self], widgets=[canvas, self.scrollable_frame])
993        if scrollbar:
994            _ = set_dark_style(style, widgets=[scrollbar_widget])

Construct a Ttk Frame with parent master.

STANDARD OPTIONS

class, cursor, style, takefocus

WIDGET-SPECIFIC OPTIONS

borderwidth, relief, padding, width, height
inactive_color
active_color
fg_color
def rounded_rectangle(self, canvas, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=20, **kwargs): 
 996    def rounded_rectangle(self, canvas, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=20, **kwargs):
 997        points = [
 998            x1 + radius, y1,
 999            x2 - radius, y1,
1000            x2 - radius, y1,
1001            x2, y1,
1002            x2, y1 + radius,
1003            x2, y2 - radius,
1004            x2, y2 - radius,
1005            x2, y2,
1006            x2 - radius, y2,
1007            x1 + radius, y2,
1008            x1 + radius, y2,
1009            x1, y2,
1010            x1, y2 - radius,
1011            x1, y2 - radius,
1012            x1, y1 + radius,
1013            x1, y1 + radius,
1014            x1, y1
1015        ]
1016        return canvas.create_polygon(points, **kwargs, smooth=True)
class spacrLabel(tkinter.Frame): 
1018class spacrLabel(tk.Frame):
1019    def __init__(self, parent, text="", font=None, style=None, align="right", height=None, **kwargs):
1020        valid_kwargs = {k: v for k, v in kwargs.items() if k not in ['foreground', 'background', 'font', 'anchor', 'justify', 'wraplength']}
1021        super().__init__(parent, **valid_kwargs)
1022        
1023        self.text = text
1024        self.align = align
1025
1026        if height is None:
1027            screen_height = self.winfo_screenheight()
1028            label_height = screen_height // 50
1029            label_width = label_height * 10
1030        else:
1031            label_height = height
1032            label_width = label_height * 10
1033
1034        self.style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
1035        self.font_style = self.style_out['font_family']
1036        self.font_size = self.style_out['font_size']
1037        self.font_family = self.style_out['font_family']
1038        self.font_loader = self.style_out['font_loader']
1039
1040        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=label_width, height=label_height, highlightthickness=0, bg=self.style_out['bg_color'])
1041        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="ew")
1042        if self.style_out['font_family'] != 'OpenSans':
1043            self.font_style = font if font else tkFont.Font(family=self.style_out['font_family'], size=self.style_out['font_size'], weight=tkFont.NORMAL)
1044        self.style = style
1045
1046        if self.align == "center":
1047            anchor_value = tk.CENTER
1048            text_anchor = 'center'
1049        else:  # default to right alignment
1050            anchor_value = tk.E
1051            text_anchor = 'e'
1052
1053        if self.style:
1054            ttk_style = ttk.Style()
1055            if self.font_loader:
1056                ttk_style.configure(self.style, font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size), background=self.style_out['bg_color'], foreground=self.style_out['fg_color'])
1057            else:
1058                ttk_style.configure(self.style, font=self.font_style, background=self.style_out['bg_color'], foreground=self.style_out['fg_color'])
1059            self.label_text = ttk.Label(self.canvas, text=self.text, style=self.style, anchor=text_anchor)
1060            self.label_text.pack(fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)
1061        else:
1062            if self.font_loader:
1063                self.label_text = self.canvas.create_text(label_width // 2 if self.align == "center" else label_width - 5, 
1064                                                          label_height // 2, text=self.text, fill=self.style_out['fg_color'], 
1065                                                          font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size), anchor=anchor_value, justify=tk.RIGHT)
1066            else:
1067                self.label_text = self.canvas.create_text(label_width // 2 if self.align == "center" else label_width - 5, 
1068                                                        label_height // 2, text=self.text, fill=self.style_out['fg_color'], 
1069                                                        font=self.font_style, anchor=anchor_value, justify=tk.RIGHT)
1070        
1071        _ = set_dark_style(ttk.Style(), containers=[self], widgets=[self.canvas])
1072
1073    def set_text(self, text):
1074        if self.style:
1075            self.label_text.config(text=text)
1076        else:
1077            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.label_text, text=text)

Frame widget which may contain other widgets and can have a 3D border.

spacrLabel( parent, text='', font=None, style=None, align='right', height=None, **kwargs) 
1019    def __init__(self, parent, text="", font=None, style=None, align="right", height=None, **kwargs):
1020        valid_kwargs = {k: v for k, v in kwargs.items() if k not in ['foreground', 'background', 'font', 'anchor', 'justify', 'wraplength']}
1021        super().__init__(parent, **valid_kwargs)
1022        
1023        self.text = text
1024        self.align = align
1025
1026        if height is None:
1027            screen_height = self.winfo_screenheight()
1028            label_height = screen_height // 50
1029            label_width = label_height * 10
1030        else:
1031            label_height = height
1032            label_width = label_height * 10
1033
1034        self.style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
1035        self.font_style = self.style_out['font_family']
1036        self.font_size = self.style_out['font_size']
1037        self.font_family = self.style_out['font_family']
1038        self.font_loader = self.style_out['font_loader']
1039
1040        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=label_width, height=label_height, highlightthickness=0, bg=self.style_out['bg_color'])
1041        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="ew")
1042        if self.style_out['font_family'] != 'OpenSans':
1043            self.font_style = font if font else tkFont.Font(family=self.style_out['font_family'], size=self.style_out['font_size'], weight=tkFont.NORMAL)
1044        self.style = style
1045
1046        if self.align == "center":
1047            anchor_value = tk.CENTER
1048            text_anchor = 'center'
1049        else:  # default to right alignment
1050            anchor_value = tk.E
1051            text_anchor = 'e'
1052
1053        if self.style:
1054            ttk_style = ttk.Style()
1055            if self.font_loader:
1056                ttk_style.configure(self.style, font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size), background=self.style_out['bg_color'], foreground=self.style_out['fg_color'])
1057            else:
1058                ttk_style.configure(self.style, font=self.font_style, background=self.style_out['bg_color'], foreground=self.style_out['fg_color'])
1059            self.label_text = ttk.Label(self.canvas, text=self.text, style=self.style, anchor=text_anchor)
1060            self.label_text.pack(fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)
1061        else:
1062            if self.font_loader:
1063                self.label_text = self.canvas.create_text(label_width // 2 if self.align == "center" else label_width - 5, 
1064                                                          label_height // 2, text=self.text, fill=self.style_out['fg_color'], 
1065                                                          font=self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size), anchor=anchor_value, justify=tk.RIGHT)
1066            else:
1067                self.label_text = self.canvas.create_text(label_width // 2 if self.align == "center" else label_width - 5, 
1068                                                        label_height // 2, text=self.text, fill=self.style_out['fg_color'], 
1069                                                        font=self.font_style, anchor=anchor_value, justify=tk.RIGHT)
1070        
1071        _ = set_dark_style(ttk.Style(), containers=[self], widgets=[self.canvas])

Construct a frame widget with the parent MASTER.

Valid resource names: background, bd, bg, borderwidth, class, colormap, container, cursor, height, highlightbackground, highlightcolor, highlightthickness, relief, takefocus, visual, width.

def set_text(self, text): 
1073    def set_text(self, text):
1074        if self.style:
1075            self.label_text.config(text=text)
1076        else:
1077            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.label_text, text=text)
class spacrButton(tkinter.Frame): 
1079class spacrButton(tk.Frame):
1080    def __init__(self, parent, text="", command=None, font=None, icon_name=None, size=50, show_text=True, outline=False, animation=True, *args, **kwargs):
1081        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
1082        
1083        self.text = text.capitalize()  # Capitalize only the first letter of the text
1084        self.command = command
1085        self.icon_name = icon_name if icon_name else text.lower()
1086        self.size = size
1087        self.show_text = show_text
1088        self.outline = outline
1089        self.animation = animation  # Add animation attribute
1090
1091        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
1092        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
1093        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
1094
1095        if self.show_text:
1096            self.button_width = int(size * 3)
1097        else:
1098            self.button_width = self.size  # Make the button width equal to the size if show_text is False
1099
1100        # Create the canvas first
1101        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=self.button_width + 4, height=self.size + 4, highlightthickness=0, bg=style_out['bg_color'])
1102        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=0)
1103
1104        # Apply dark style and get color settings
1105        color_settings = set_dark_style(ttk.Style(), containers=[self], widgets=[self.canvas])
1106
1107        self.inactive_color = color_settings['inactive_color']
1108
1109        if self.outline:
1110            self.button_bg = self.create_rounded_rectangle(2, 2, self.button_width + 2, self.size + 2, radius=20, fill=self.inactive_color, outline=color_settings['fg_color'])
1111        else:
1112            self.button_bg = self.create_rounded_rectangle(2, 2, self.button_width + 2, self.size + 2, radius=20, fill=self.inactive_color, outline=self.inactive_color)
1113        
1114        self.load_icon()
1115        if self.font_loader:
1116            self.font_style = self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size)
1117        else:
1118            self.font_style = font if font else ("Arial", 12)
1119        
1120        if self.show_text:
1121            self.button_text = self.canvas.create_text(self.size + 10, self.size // 2 + 2, text=self.text, fill=color_settings['fg_color'], font=self.font_style, anchor="w")  # Align text to the left of the specified point
1122
1123        self.bind("<Enter>", self.on_enter)
1124        self.bind("<Leave>", self.on_leave)
1125        self.bind("<Button-1>", self.on_click)
1126        self.canvas.bind("<Enter>", self.on_enter)
1127        self.canvas.bind("<Leave>", self.on_leave)
1128        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.on_click)
1129
1130        self.bg_color = self.inactive_color
1131        self.active_color = color_settings['active_color']
1132        self.fg_color = color_settings['fg_color']
1133        self.is_zoomed_in = False  # Track zoom state for smooth transitions
1134
1135    def load_icon(self):
1136        icon_path = self.get_icon_path(self.icon_name)
1137        try:
1138            icon_image = Image.open(icon_path)
1139        except (FileNotFoundError, Image.UnidentifiedImageError):
1140            try:
1141                icon_path = icon_path.replace(' ', '_')
1142                icon_image = Image.open(icon_path)
1143            except (FileNotFoundError, Image.UnidentifiedImageError):
1144                icon_image = Image.open(self.get_icon_path("default"))
1145                print(f'Icon not found: {icon_path}. Using default icon instead.')
1146
1147        initial_size = int(self.size * 0.65)  # 65% of button size initially
1148        self.original_icon_image = icon_image.resize((initial_size, initial_size), Image.Resampling.LANCZOS)
1149        self.icon_photo = ImageTk.PhotoImage(self.original_icon_image)
1150
1151        self.button_icon = self.canvas.create_image(self.size // 2 + 2, self.size // 2 + 2, image=self.icon_photo)
1152        self.canvas.image = self.icon_photo  # Keep a reference to avoid garbage collection
1153
1154    def get_icon_path(self, icon_name):
1155        icon_dir = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), 'resources', 'icons')
1156        return os.path.join(icon_dir, f"{icon_name}.png")
1157
1158    def on_enter(self, event=None):
1159        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.button_bg, fill=self.active_color)
1160        self.update_description(event)
1161        if self.animation and not self.is_zoomed_in:
1162            self.animate_zoom(0.85)  # Zoom in the icon to 85% of button size
1163
1164    def on_leave(self, event=None):
1165        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.button_bg, fill=self.inactive_color)
1166        self.clear_description(event)
1167        if self.animation and self.is_zoomed_in:
1168            self.animate_zoom(0.65)  # Reset the icon size to 65% of button size
1169
1170    def on_click(self, event=None):
1171        if self.command:
1172            self.command()
1173
1174    def create_rounded_rectangle(self, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=20, **kwargs):
1175        points = [
1176            x1 + radius, y1,
1177            x2 - radius, y1,
1178            x2 - radius, y1,
1179            x2, y1,
1180            x2, y1 + radius,
1181            x2, y2 - radius,
1182            x2, y2 - radius,
1183            x2, y2,
1184            x2 - radius, y2,
1185            x1 + radius, y2,
1186            x1 + radius, y2,
1187            x1, y2,
1188            x1, y2 - radius,
1189            x1, y2 - radius,
1190            x1, y1 + radius,
1191            x1, y1 + radius,
1192            x1, y1
1193        ]
1194        return self.canvas.create_polygon(points, **kwargs, smooth=True)
1195    
1196    def update_description(self, event):
1197        parent = self.master
1198        while parent:
1199            if hasattr(parent, 'show_description'):
1200                parent.show_description(parent.main_buttons.get(self, parent.additional_buttons.get(self, "No description available.")))
1201                return
1202            parent = parent.master
1203
1204    def clear_description(self, event):
1205        parent = self.master
1206        while parent:
1207            if hasattr(parent, 'clear_description'):
1208                parent.clear_description()
1209                return
1210            parent = parent.master
1211
1212    def animate_zoom(self, target_scale, steps=10, delay=10):
1213        current_scale = 0.85 if self.is_zoomed_in else 0.65
1214        step_scale = (target_scale - current_scale) / steps
1215        self._animate_step(current_scale, step_scale, steps, delay)
1216
1217    def _animate_step(self, current_scale, step_scale, steps, delay):
1218        if steps > 0:
1219            new_scale = current_scale + step_scale
1220            self.zoom_icon(new_scale)
1221            self.after(delay, self._animate_step, new_scale, step_scale, steps - 1, delay)
1222        else:
1223            self.is_zoomed_in = not self.is_zoomed_in
1224
1225    def zoom_icon(self, scale_factor):
1226        # Resize the original icon image
1227        new_size = int(self.size * scale_factor)
1228        resized_icon = self.original_icon_image.resize((new_size, new_size), Image.Resampling.LANCZOS)
1229        self.icon_photo = ImageTk.PhotoImage(resized_icon)
1230
1231        # Update the icon on the canvas
1232        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.button_icon, image=self.icon_photo)
1233        self.canvas.image = self.icon_photo

Frame widget which may contain other widgets and can have a 3D border.

1131        self.active_color = color_settings['active_color']

1133        self.is_zoomed_in = False  # Track zoom state for smooth transitions

def size(self): 
1818    def grid_size(self):
1819        """Return a tuple of the number of column and rows in the grid."""
1820        return self._getints(
1821            self.tk.call('grid', 'size', self._w)) or None

class spacrSwitch(tkinter.ttk.Frame): 
1235class spacrSwitch(ttk.Frame):
1236    def __init__(self, parent, text="", variable=None, command=None, *args, **kwargs):
1237        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
1238        self.text = text
1239        self.variable = variable if variable else tk.BooleanVar()
1240        self.command = command
1241        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=40, height=20, highlightthickness=0, bd=0)
1242        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=1, padx=(10, 0))
1243        self.switch_bg = self.create_rounded_rectangle(2, 2, 38, 18, radius=9, outline="", fill="#fff")
1244        self.switch = self.canvas.create_oval(4, 4, 16, 16, outline="", fill="#800080")
1245        self.label = spacrLabel(self, text=self.text)
1246        self.label.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=(0, 10))
1247        self.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle)
1248        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle)
1249        self.label.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle)
1250        self.update_switch()
1251
1252        style = ttk.Style()
1253        _ = set_dark_style(style, containers=[self], widgets=[self.canvas, self.label])
1254
1255    def toggle(self, event=None):
1256        self.variable.set(not self.variable.get())
1257        self.animate_switch()
1258        if self.command:
1259            self.command()
1260
1261    def update_switch(self):
1262        if self.variable.get():
1263            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.switch, fill="#008080")
1264            self.canvas.coords(self.switch, 24, 4, 36, 16)
1265        else:
1266            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.switch, fill="#800080")
1267            self.canvas.coords(self.switch, 4, 4, 16, 16)
1268
1269    def animate_switch(self):
1270        if self.variable.get():
1271            start_x, end_x = 4, 24
1272            final_color = "#008080"
1273        else:
1274            start_x, end_x = 24, 4
1275            final_color = "#800080"
1276
1277        self.animate_movement(start_x, end_x, final_color)
1278
1279    def animate_movement(self, start_x, end_x, final_color):
1280        step = 1 if start_x < end_x else -1
1281        for i in range(start_x, end_x, step):
1282            self.canvas.coords(self.switch, i, 4, i + 12, 16)
1283            self.canvas.update()
1284            self.after(10)
1285        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.switch, fill=final_color)
1286
1287    def get(self):
1288        return self.variable.get()
1289
1290    def set(self, value):
1291        self.variable.set(value)
1292        self.update_switch()
1293
1294    def create_rounded_rectangle(self, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=9, **kwargs):
1295        points = [x1 + radius, y1,
1296                  x1 + radius, y1,
1297                  x2 - radius, y1,
1298                  x2 - radius, y1,
1299                  x2, y1,
1300                  x2, y1 + radius,
1301                  x2, y1 + radius,
1302                  x2, y2 - radius,
1303                  x2, y2 - radius,
1304                  x2, y2,
1305                  x2 - radius, y2,
1306                  x2 - radius, y2,
1307                  x1 + radius, y2,
1308                  x1 + radius, y2,
1309                  x1, y2,
1310                  x1, y2 - radius,
1311                  x1, y2 - radius,
1312                  x1, y1 + radius,
1313                  x1, y1 + radius,
1314                  x1, y1]
1315
1316        return self.canvas.create_polygon(points, **kwargs, smooth=True)

Ttk Frame widget is a container, used to group other widgets together.

spacrSwitch(parent, text='', variable=None, command=None, *args, **kwargs) 
1236    def __init__(self, parent, text="", variable=None, command=None, *args, **kwargs):
1237        super().__init__(parent, *args, **kwargs)
1238        self.text = text
1239        self.variable = variable if variable else tk.BooleanVar()
1240        self.command = command
1241        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self, width=40, height=20, highlightthickness=0, bd=0)
1242        self.canvas.grid(row=0, column=1, padx=(10, 0))
1243        self.switch_bg = self.create_rounded_rectangle(2, 2, 38, 18, radius=9, outline="", fill="#fff")
1244        self.switch = self.canvas.create_oval(4, 4, 16, 16, outline="", fill="#800080")
1245        self.label = spacrLabel(self, text=self.text)
1246        self.label.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=(0, 10))
1247        self.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle)
1248        self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle)
1249        self.label.bind("<Button-1>", self.toggle)
1250        self.update_switch()
1251
1252        style = ttk.Style()
1253        _ = set_dark_style(style, containers=[self], widgets=[self.canvas, self.label])

Construct a Ttk Frame with parent master.

STANDARD OPTIONS

class, cursor, style, takefocus

WIDGET-SPECIFIC OPTIONS

borderwidth, relief, padding, width, height
text
variable
command
canvas
switch_bg
switch
label
def toggle(self, event=None): 
1255    def toggle(self, event=None):
1256        self.variable.set(not self.variable.get())
1257        self.animate_switch()
1258        if self.command:
1259            self.command()
def update_switch(self): 
1261    def update_switch(self):
1262        if self.variable.get():
1263            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.switch, fill="#008080")
1264            self.canvas.coords(self.switch, 24, 4, 36, 16)
1265        else:
1266            self.canvas.itemconfig(self.switch, fill="#800080")
1267            self.canvas.coords(self.switch, 4, 4, 16, 16)
def animate_switch(self): 
1269    def animate_switch(self):
1270        if self.variable.get():
1271            start_x, end_x = 4, 24
1272            final_color = "#008080"
1273        else:
1274            start_x, end_x = 24, 4
1275            final_color = "#800080"
1276
1277        self.animate_movement(start_x, end_x, final_color)
def animate_movement(self, start_x, end_x, final_color): 
1279    def animate_movement(self, start_x, end_x, final_color):
1280        step = 1 if start_x < end_x else -1
1281        for i in range(start_x, end_x, step):
1282            self.canvas.coords(self.switch, i, 4, i + 12, 16)
1283            self.canvas.update()
1284            self.after(10)
1285        self.canvas.itemconfig(self.switch, fill=final_color)
def get(self): 
1287    def get(self):
1288        return self.variable.get()
def set(self, value): 
1290    def set(self, value):
1291        self.variable.set(value)
1292        self.update_switch()
def create_rounded_rectangle(self, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=9, **kwargs): 
1294    def create_rounded_rectangle(self, x1, y1, x2, y2, radius=9, **kwargs):
1295        points = [x1 + radius, y1,
1296                  x1 + radius, y1,
1297                  x2 - radius, y1,
1298                  x2 - radius, y1,
1299                  x2, y1,
1300                  x2, y1 + radius,
1301                  x2, y1 + radius,
1302                  x2, y2 - radius,
1303                  x2, y2 - radius,
1304                  x2, y2,
1305                  x2 - radius, y2,
1306                  x2 - radius, y2,
1307                  x1 + radius, y2,
1308                  x1 + radius, y2,
1309                  x1, y2,
1310                  x1, y2 - radius,
1311                  x1, y2 - radius,
1312                  x1, y1 + radius,
1313                  x1, y1 + radius,
1314                  x1, y1]
1315
1316        return self.canvas.create_polygon(points, **kwargs, smooth=True)
class spacrToolTip: 
1318class spacrToolTip:
1319    def __init__(self, widget, text):
1320        self.widget = widget
1321        self.text = text
1322        self.tooltip_window = None
1323        widget.bind("<Enter>", self.show_tooltip)
1324        widget.bind("<Leave>", self.hide_tooltip)
1325
1326    def show_tooltip(self, event):
1327        x = event.x_root + 20
1328        y = event.y_root + 10
1329        self.tooltip_window = tk.Toplevel(self.widget)
1330        self.tooltip_window.wm_overrideredirect(True)
1331        self.tooltip_window.wm_geometry(f"+{x}+{y}")
1332        label = tk.Label(self.tooltip_window, text=self.text, relief='flat', borderwidth=0)
1333        label.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=5, pady=5)
1334
1335        style = ttk.Style()
1336        _ = set_dark_style(style, containers=[self.tooltip_window], widgets=[label])
1337
1338    def hide_tooltip(self, event):
1339        if self.tooltip_window:
1340            self.tooltip_window.destroy()
1341        self.tooltip_window = None

1321        self.text = text
1322        self.tooltip_window = None
1323        widget.bind("<Enter>", self.show_tooltip)
1324        widget.bind("<Leave>", self.hide_tooltip)

1330        self.tooltip_window.wm_overrideredirect(True)

1333        label.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=5, pady=5)

def hide_tooltip(self, event):
