1554        self.lower_entry.pack(side='left')
1555        
1556        tk.Label(self.zoom_toolbar, text="Upper Percentile:", bg='black', fg='white').pack(side='left')
1557        self.upper_entry = tk.Entry(self.zoom_toolbar, textvariable=self.upper_quantile, bg='black', fg='white')
1558        self.upper_entry.pack(side='left')
def load_image_and_mask(self, index): 
1560    def load_image_and_mask(self, index):
1561        # Load the image
1562        image_path = os.path.join(self.folder_path, self.image_filenames[index])
1563        image = imageio.imread(image_path)
1564        print(f"Original Image shape: {image.shape}, dtype: {image.dtype}")
1565
1566        # Handle multi-channel or transparency issues
1567        if image.ndim == 3:
1568            if image.shape[2] == 4:  # If the image has an alpha channel (RGBA)
1569                image = image[..., :3]  # Remove the alpha channel
1570
1571            # Convert RGB to grayscale using weighted average
1572            image = np.dot(image[..., :3], [0.2989, 0.5870, 0.1140]).astype(np.uint8)
1573            print(f"Converted to grayscale: {image.shape}")
1574
1575        # Ensure the shape is (height, width) without extra channel
1576        if image.ndim == 3 and image.shape[2] == 1:
1577            image = np.squeeze(image, axis=-1)
1578
1579        if image.dtype != np.uint16:
1580            # Scale the image to fit the 16-bit range (0–65535)
1581            image = (image / image.max() * 65535).astype(np.uint16)
1582            # eventually remove this images should not have to be 16 bit look into downstream function (non 16bit images are jsut black)
1583
1584        # Load the corresponding mask
1585        mask_path = os.path.join(self.masks_folder, self.image_filenames[index])
1586        if os.path.exists(mask_path):
1587            print(f'Loading mask: {mask_path} for image: {image_path}')
1588            mask = imageio.imread(mask_path)
1589
1590            # Ensure mask is uint8
1591            if mask.dtype != np.uint8:
1592                mask = (mask / mask.max() * 255).astype(np.uint8)
1593        else:
1594            # Create a new mask with the same size as the image
1595            mask = np.zeros(image.shape[:2], dtype=np.uint8)
1596            print(f'Loaded new mask for image: {image_path}')
1597
1598        return image, mask
def display_image(self): 
1603    def display_image(self):
1604        if self.zoom_rectangle_id is not None:
1605            self.canvas.delete(self.zoom_rectangle_id)
1606            self.zoom_rectangle_id = None
1607        lower_quantile = float(self.lower_quantile.get()) if self.lower_quantile.get() else 1.0
1608        upper_quantile = float(self.upper_quantile.get()) if self.upper_quantile.get() else 99.9
1609        normalized = self.normalize_image(self.image, lower_quantile, upper_quantile)
1610        combined = self.overlay_mask_on_image(normalized, self.mask)
1611        self.tk_image = ImageTk.PhotoImage(image=Image.fromarray(combined))
1612        self.canvas.create_image(0, 0, anchor='nw', image=self.tk_image)
def display_zoomed_image(self): 
1614    def display_zoomed_image(self):
1615        if self.zoom_rectangle_start and self.zoom_rectangle_end:
1616            # Convert canvas coordinates to image coordinates
1617            x0, y0 = self.canvas_to_image(*self.zoom_rectangle_start)
1618            x1, y1 = self.canvas_to_image(*self.zoom_rectangle_end)
1619            x0, x1 = min(x0, x1), max(x0, x1)
1620            y0, y1 = min(y0, y1), max(y0, y1)
1621            self.zoom_x0 = x0
1622            self.zoom_y0 = y0
1623            self.zoom_x1 = x1
1624            self.zoom_y1 = y1
1625            # Normalize the entire image
1626            lower_quantile = float(self.lower_quantile.get()) if self.lower_quantile.get() else 1.0
1627            upper_quantile = float(self.upper_quantile.get()) if self.upper_quantile.get() else 99.9
1628            normalized_image = self.normalize_image(self.image, lower_quantile, upper_quantile)
1629            # Extract the zoomed portion of the normalized image and mask
1630            self.zoom_image = normalized_image[y0:y1, x0:x1]
1631            self.zoom_image_orig = self.image[y0:y1, x0:x1]
1632            self.zoom_mask = self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1]
1633            original_mask_area = self.mask.shape[0] * self.mask.shape[1]
1634            zoom_mask_area = self.zoom_mask.shape[0] * self.zoom_mask.shape[1]
1635            if original_mask_area > 0:
1636                self.zoom_scale = original_mask_area/zoom_mask_area
1637            # Resize the zoomed image and mask to fit the canvas
1638            canvas_height = self.canvas.winfo_height()
1639            canvas_width = self.canvas.winfo_width()
1640            
1641            if self.zoom_image.size > 0 and canvas_height > 0 and canvas_width > 0:
1642                self.zoom_image = resize(self.zoom_image, (canvas_height, canvas_width), preserve_range=True).astype(self.zoom_image.dtype)
1643                self.zoom_image_orig = resize(self.zoom_image_orig, (canvas_height, canvas_width), preserve_range=True).astype(self.zoom_image_orig.dtype)
1644                #self.zoom_mask = resize(self.zoom_mask, (canvas_height, canvas_width), preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
1645                self.zoom_mask = resize(self.zoom_mask, (canvas_height, canvas_width), order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
1646                combined = self.overlay_mask_on_image(self.zoom_image, self.zoom_mask)
1647                self.tk_image = ImageTk.PhotoImage(image=Image.fromarray(combined))
1648                self.canvas.create_image(0, 0, anchor='nw', image=self.tk_image)
def overlay_mask_on_image(self, image, mask, alpha=0.5): 
1650    def overlay_mask_on_image(self, image, mask, alpha=0.5):
1651        if len(image.shape) == 2:
1652            image = np.stack((image,) * 3, axis=-1)
1653        mask = mask.astype(np.int32)
1654        max_label = np.max(mask)
1655        np.random.seed(0)
1656        colors = np.random.randint(0, 255, size=(max_label + 1, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
1657        colors[0] = [0, 0, 0]  # background color
1658        colored_mask = colors[mask]
1659        image_8bit = (image / 256).astype(np.uint8)
1660        # Blend the mask and the image with transparency
1661        combined_image = np.where(mask[..., None] > 0, 
1662                                  np.clip(image_8bit * (1 - alpha) + colored_mask * alpha, 0, 255), 
1663                                  image_8bit)
1664        # Convert the final image back to uint8
1665        combined_image = combined_image.astype(np.uint8)
1666        return combined_image
def previous_image(self): 
1672    def previous_image(self):
1673        if self.current_image_index > 0:
1674            self.current_image_index -= 1
1675            self.initialize_flags()            
1676            self.image, self.mask = self.load_image_and_mask(self.current_image_index)
1677            self.original_size = self.image.shape
1678            self.image, self.mask = self.resize_arrays(self.image, self.mask)
1679            self.display_image()
def next_image(self): 
1681    def next_image(self):
1682        if self.current_image_index < len(self.image_filenames) - 1:
1683            self.current_image_index += 1
1684            self.initialize_flags()            
1685            self.image, self.mask = self.load_image_and_mask(self.current_image_index)
1686            self.original_size = self.image.shape
1687            self.image, self.mask = self.resize_arrays(self.image, self.mask)
1688            self.display_image()
def save_mask(self): 
1690    def save_mask(self):
1691        if self.current_image_index < len(self.image_filenames):
1692            original_size = self.original_size
1693            if self.mask.shape != original_size:
1694                resized_mask = resize(self.mask, original_size, order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint16)
1695            else:
1696                resized_mask = self.mask
1697            resized_mask, _ = label(resized_mask > 0)
1698            save_folder = os.path.join(self.folder_path, 'masks')
1699            if not os.path.exists(save_folder):
1700                os.makedirs(save_folder)
1701            image_filename = os.path.splitext(self.image_filenames[self.current_image_index])[0] + '.tif'
1702            save_path = os.path.join(save_folder, image_filename)
1703
1704            print(f"Saving mask to: {save_path}")  # Debug print
1705            imageio.imwrite(save_path, resized_mask)
def set_zoom_rectangle_start(self, event): 
1710    def set_zoom_rectangle_start(self, event):
1711        if self.zoom_active:
1712            self.zoom_rectangle_start = (event.x, event.y)
def set_zoom_rectangle_end(self, event): 
1714    def set_zoom_rectangle_end(self, event):
1715        if self.zoom_active:
1716            self.zoom_rectangle_end = (event.x, event.y)
1717            if self.zoom_rectangle_id is not None:
1718                self.canvas.delete(self.zoom_rectangle_id)
1719                self.zoom_rectangle_id = None
1720            self.display_zoomed_image()  
1721            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")  
1722            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1723            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")  
1724            self.canvas.bind("<Motion>", self.update_mouse_info)
def update_zoom_box(self, event): 
1726    def update_zoom_box(self, event):
1727        if self.zoom_active and self.zoom_rectangle_start is not None:
1728            if self.zoom_rectangle_id is not None:
1729                self.canvas.delete(self.zoom_rectangle_id)
1730            # Assuming event.x and event.y are already in image coordinates
1731            self.zoom_rectangle_end = (event.x, event.y)
1732            x0, y0 = self.zoom_rectangle_start
1733            x1, y1 = self.zoom_rectangle_end
1734            self.zoom_rectangle_id = self.canvas.create_rectangle(x0, y0, x1, y1, outline="red", width=2)
def toggle_zoom_mode(self): 
1740    def toggle_zoom_mode(self):
1741        if not self.zoom_active:
1742            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1743            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1744            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1745            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1746            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
1747            self.zoom_active = True
1748            self.drawing = False
1749            self.magic_wand_active = False
1750            self.erase_active = False
1751            self.brush_active = False
1752            self.dividing_line_active = False
1753            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1754            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1755            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1756            self.zoom_btn.config(text="Zoom ON")
1757            self.dividing_line_btn.config(text="Dividing Line")
1758            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1759            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")
1760            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1761            self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.set_zoom_rectangle_start)
1762            self.canvas.bind("<Button-3>", self.set_zoom_rectangle_end)
1763            self.canvas.bind("<Motion>", self.update_zoom_box)
1764        else:
1765            self.zoom_active = False
1766            self.zoom_btn.config(text="Zoom")
1767            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1768            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")
1769            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1770            self.zoom_rectangle_start = self.zoom_rectangle_end = None
1771            self.zoom_rectangle_id = None
1772            self.display_image()
1773            self.canvas.bind("<Motion>", self.update_mouse_info)
1774            self.zoom_rectangle_start = None
1775            self.zoom_rectangle_end = None
1776            self.zoom_rectangle_id = None
1777            self.zoom_x0 = None
1778            self.zoom_y0 = None
1779            self.zoom_x1 = None
1780            self.zoom_y1 = None
1781            self.zoom_mask = None
1782            self.zoom_image = None
1783            self.zoom_image_orig = None
def toggle_brush_mode(self): 
1785    def toggle_brush_mode(self):
1786        self.brush_active = not self.brush_active
1787        if self.brush_active:
1788            self.drawing = False
1789            self.magic_wand_active = False
1790            self.erase_active = False
1791            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush ON")
1792            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1793            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1794            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1795            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1796            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")
1797            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1798            self.canvas.bind("<B1-Motion>", self.apply_brush)  # Left click and drag to apply brush
1799            self.canvas.bind("<B3-Motion>", self.erase_brush)  # Right click and drag to erase with brush
1800            self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-1>", self.apply_brush_release)  # Left button release
1801            self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-3>", self.erase_brush_release)  # Right button release
1802        else:
1803            self.brush_active = False
1804            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1805            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1806            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1807            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1808            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
def image_to_canvas(self, x_image, y_image): 
1810    def image_to_canvas(self, x_image, y_image):
1811        x_scale, y_scale = self.get_scaling_factors(
1812            self.image.shape[1], self.image.shape[0],
1813            self.canvas_width, self.canvas_height
1814        )
1815        x_canvas = int(x_image / x_scale)
1816        y_canvas = int(y_image / y_scale)
1817        return x_canvas, y_canvas
def toggle_dividing_line_mode(self): 
1819    def toggle_dividing_line_mode(self):
1820        self.dividing_line_active = not self.dividing_line_active
1821        if self.dividing_line_active:
1822            self.drawing = False
1823            self.magic_wand_active = False
1824            self.erase_active = False
1825            self.brush_active = False
1826            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1827            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1828            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1829            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1830            self.dividing_line_btn.config(text="Dividing Line ON")
1831            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1832            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1833            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1834            self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.start_dividing_line)
1835            self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-1>", self.finish_dividing_line)
1836            self.canvas.bind("<Motion>", self.update_dividing_line_preview)
1837        else:
1838            print("Dividing Line Mode: OFF")
1839            self.dividing_line_active = False
1840            self.dividing_line_btn.config(text="Dividing Line")
1841            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1842            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1843            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1844            self.display_image()
def start_dividing_line(self, event): 
1846    def start_dividing_line(self, event):
1847        if self.dividing_line_active:
1848            self.dividing_line_coords = [(event.x, event.y)]
1849            self.current_dividing_line = self.canvas.create_line(event.x, event.y, event.x, event.y, fill="red", width=2)
def finish_dividing_line(self, event): 
1851    def finish_dividing_line(self, event):
1852        if self.dividing_line_active:
1853            self.dividing_line_coords.append((event.x, event.y))
1854            if self.zoom_active:
1855                self.dividing_line_coords = [self.canvas_to_image(x, y) for x, y in self.dividing_line_coords]
1856            self.apply_dividing_line()
1857            self.canvas.delete(self.current_dividing_line)
1858            self.current_dividing_line = None
def update_dividing_line_preview(self, event): 
1860    def update_dividing_line_preview(self, event):
1861        if self.dividing_line_active and self.dividing_line_coords:
1862            x, y = event.x, event.y
1863            if self.zoom_active:
1864                x, y = self.canvas_to_image(x, y)
1865            self.dividing_line_coords.append((x, y))
1866            canvas_coords = [(self.image_to_canvas(*pt) if self.zoom_active else pt) for pt in self.dividing_line_coords]
1867            flat_canvas_coords = [coord for pt in canvas_coords for coord in pt]
1868            self.canvas.coords(self.current_dividing_line, *flat_canvas_coords)
def apply_dividing_line(self): 
1870    def apply_dividing_line(self):
1871        if self.dividing_line_coords:
1872            coords = self.dividing_line_coords
1873            if self.zoom_active:
1874                coords = [self.canvas_to_image(x, y) for x, y in coords]
1875
1876            rr, cc = [], []
1877            for (x0, y0), (x1, y1) in zip(coords[:-1], coords[1:]):
1878                line_rr, line_cc = line(y0, x0, y1, x1)
1879                rr.extend(line_rr)
1880                cc.extend(line_cc)
1881            rr, cc = np.array(rr), np.array(cc)
1882
1883            mask_copy = self.mask.copy()
1884
1885            if self.zoom_active:
1886                # Update the zoomed mask
1887                self.zoom_mask[rr, cc] = 0
1888                # Reflect changes to the original mask
1889                y0, y1, x0, x1 = self.zoom_y0, self.zoom_y1, self.zoom_x0, self.zoom_x1
1890                zoomed_mask_resized_back = resize(self.zoom_mask, (y1 - y0, x1 - x0), order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
1891                self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = zoomed_mask_resized_back
1892            else:
1893                # Directly update the original mask
1894                mask_copy[rr, cc] = 0
1895                self.mask = mask_copy
1896
1897            labeled_mask, num_labels = label(self.mask > 0)
1898            self.mask = labeled_mask
1899            self.update_display()
1900
1901            self.dividing_line_coords = []
1902            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1903            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1904            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1905            self.dividing_line_active = False
1906            self.dividing_line_btn.config(text="Dividing Line")
def toggle_draw_mode(self): 
1908    def toggle_draw_mode(self):
1909        self.drawing = not self.drawing
1910        if self.drawing:
1911            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1912            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1913            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1914            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1915            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
1916            self.magic_wand_active = False
1917            self.erase_active = False
1918            self.brush_active = False
1919            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw ON")
1920            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1921            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1922            self.draw_coordinates = []
1923            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1924            self.canvas.unbind("<Motion>")
1925            self.canvas.bind("<B1-Motion>", self.draw)
1926            self.canvas.bind("<ButtonRelease-1>", self.finish_drawing)
1927        else:
1928            self.drawing = False
1929            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1930            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1931            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
def toggle_magic_wand_mode(self): 
1933    def toggle_magic_wand_mode(self):
1934        self.magic_wand_active = not self.magic_wand_active
1935        if self.magic_wand_active:
1936            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1937            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1938            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1939            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1940            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
1941            self.drawing = False
1942            self.erase_active = False
1943            self.brush_active = False
1944            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1945            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1946            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand ON")
1947            self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.use_magic_wand)
1948            self.canvas.bind("<Button-3>", self.use_magic_wand)
1949        else:
1950            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1951            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
1952            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-3>")
def toggle_erase_mode(self): 
1954    def toggle_erase_mode(self):
1955        self.erase_active = not self.erase_active
1956        if self.erase_active:
1957            self.brush_btn.config(text="Brush")
1958            self.canvas.unbind("<B1-Motion>")
1959            self.canvas.unbind("<B3-Motion>")
1960            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-1>")
1961            self.canvas.unbind("<ButtonRelease-3>")
1962            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase ON")
1963            self.canvas.bind("<Button-1>", self.erase_object)
1964            self.drawing = False
1965            self.magic_wand_active = False
1966            self.brush_active = False
1967            self.draw_btn.config(text="Draw")
1968            self.magic_wand_btn.config(text="Magic Wand")
1969        else:
1970            self.erase_active = False
1971            self.erase_btn.config(text="Erase")
1972            self.canvas.unbind("<Button-1>")
def apply_brush_release(self, event): 
1978    def apply_brush_release(self, event):
1979        if hasattr(self, 'brush_path'):
1980            for x, y, brush_size in self.brush_path:
1981                img_x, img_y = (x, y) if self.zoom_active else self.canvas_to_image(x, y)
1982                x0 = max(img_x - brush_size // 2, 0)
1983                y0 = max(img_y - brush_size // 2, 0)
1984                x1 = min(img_x + brush_size // 2, self.zoom_mask.shape[1] if self.zoom_active else self.mask.shape[1])
1985                y1 = min(img_y + brush_size // 2, self.zoom_mask.shape[0] if self.zoom_active else self.mask.shape[0])
1986                if self.zoom_active:
1987                    self.zoom_mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = 255
1988                    self.update_original_mask_from_zoom()
1989                else:
1990                    self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = 255
1991            del self.brush_path
1992            self.canvas.delete("temp_line")
1993            self.update_display()
def erase_brush_release(self, event): 
1995    def erase_brush_release(self, event):
1996        if hasattr(self, 'erase_path'):
1997            for x, y, brush_size in self.erase_path:
1998                img_x, img_y = (x, y) if self.zoom_active else self.canvas_to_image(x, y)
1999                x0 = max(img_x - brush_size // 2, 0)
2000                y0 = max(img_y - brush_size // 2, 0)
2001                x1 = min(img_x + brush_size // 2, self.zoom_mask.shape[1] if self.zoom_active else self.mask.shape[1])
2002                y1 = min(img_y + brush_size // 2, self.zoom_mask.shape[0] if self.zoom_active else self.mask.shape[0])
2003                if self.zoom_active:
2004                    self.zoom_mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = 0                    
2005                    self.update_original_mask_from_zoom()
2006                else:
2007                    self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = 0
2008            del self.erase_path
2009            self.canvas.delete("temp_line")
2010            self.update_display()
def apply_brush(self, event): 
2012    def apply_brush(self, event):
2013        brush_size = int(self.brush_size_entry.get())
2014        x, y = event.x, event.y
2015        if not hasattr(self, 'brush_path'):
2016            self.brush_path = []
2017            self.last_brush_coord = (x, y)
2018        if self.last_brush_coord:
2019            last_x, last_y = self.last_brush_coord
2020            rr, cc = line(last_y, last_x, y, x)
2021            for ry, rx in zip(rr, cc):
2022                self.brush_path.append((rx, ry, brush_size))
2023
2024        self.canvas.create_line(self.last_brush_coord[0], self.last_brush_coord[1], x, y, width=brush_size, fill="blue", tag="temp_line")
2025        self.last_brush_coord = (x, y)
def erase_brush(self, event): 
2027    def erase_brush(self, event):
2028        brush_size = int(self.brush_size_entry.get())
2029        x, y = event.x, event.y
2030        if not hasattr(self, 'erase_path'):
2031            self.erase_path = []
2032            self.last_erase_coord = (x, y)
2033        if self.last_erase_coord:
2034            last_x, last_y = self.last_erase_coord
2035            rr, cc = line(last_y, last_x, y, x)
2036            for ry, rx in zip(rr, cc):
2037                self.erase_path.append((rx, ry, brush_size))
2038
2039        self.canvas.create_line(self.last_erase_coord[0], self.last_erase_coord[1], x, y, width=brush_size, fill="white", tag="temp_line")
2040        self.last_erase_coord = (x, y)
def erase_object(self, event): 
2042    def erase_object(self, event):
2043        x, y = event.x, event.y
2044        if self.zoom_active:
2045            canvas_x, canvas_y = x, y
2046            zoomed_x = int(canvas_x * (self.zoom_image.shape[1] / self.canvas_width))
2047            zoomed_y = int(canvas_y * (self.zoom_image.shape[0] / self.canvas_height))
2048            orig_x = int(zoomed_x * ((self.zoom_x1 - self.zoom_x0) / self.canvas_width) + self.zoom_x0)
2049            orig_y = int(zoomed_y * ((self.zoom_y1 - self.zoom_y0) / self.canvas_height) + self.zoom_y0)
2050            if orig_x < 0 or orig_y < 0 or orig_x >= self.image.shape[1] or orig_y >= self.image.shape[0]:
2051                print("Point is out of bounds in the original image.")
2052                return
2053        else:
2054            orig_x, orig_y = x, y
2055        label_to_remove = self.mask[orig_y, orig_x]
2056        if label_to_remove > 0:
2057            self.mask[self.mask == label_to_remove] = 0
2058        self.update_display()
def use_magic_wand(self, event): 
2060    def use_magic_wand(self, event):
2061        x, y = event.x, event.y
2062        tolerance = int(self.magic_wand_tolerance.get())
2063        maximum = int(self.max_pixels_entry.get())
2064        action = 'add' if event.num == 1 else 'erase'
2065        if self.zoom_active:
2066            self.magic_wand_zoomed((x, y), tolerance, action)
2067        else:
2068            self.magic_wand_normal((x, y), tolerance, action)
def apply_magic_wand(self, image, mask, seed_point, tolerance, maximum, action='add'): 
2070    def apply_magic_wand(self, image, mask, seed_point, tolerance, maximum, action='add'):
2071        x, y = seed_point
2072        initial_value = image[y, x].astype(np.float32)
2073        visited = np.zeros_like(image, dtype=bool)
2074        queue = deque([(x, y)])
2075        added_pixels = 0
2076
2077        while queue and added_pixels < maximum:
2078            cx, cy = queue.popleft()
2079            if visited[cy, cx]:
2080                continue
2081            visited[cy, cx] = True
2082            current_value = image[cy, cx].astype(np.float32)
2083
2084            if np.linalg.norm(abs(current_value - initial_value)) <= tolerance:
2085                if mask[cy, cx] == 0:
2086                    added_pixels += 1
2087                mask[cy, cx] = 255 if action == 'add' else 0
2088
2089                if added_pixels >= maximum:
2090                    break
2091
2092                for dx, dy in [(-1, 0), (1, 0), (0, -1), (0, 1)]:
2093                    nx, ny = cx + dx, cy + dy
2094                    if 0 <= nx < image.shape[1] and 0 <= ny < image.shape[0] and not visited[ny, nx]:
2095                        queue.append((nx, ny))
2096        return mask
def magic_wand_normal(self, seed_point, tolerance, action): 
2098    def magic_wand_normal(self, seed_point, tolerance, action):
2099        try:
2100            maximum = int(self.max_pixels_entry.get())
2101        except ValueError:
2102            print("Invalid maximum value; using default of 1000")
2103            maximum = 1000 
2104        self.mask = self.apply_magic_wand(self.image, self.mask, seed_point, tolerance, maximum, action)
2105        self.display_image()
def magic_wand_zoomed(self, seed_point, tolerance, action): 
2107    def magic_wand_zoomed(self, seed_point, tolerance, action):
2108        if self.zoom_image_orig is None or self.zoom_mask is None:
2109            print("Zoomed image or mask not initialized")
2110            return
2111        try:
2112            maximum = int(self.max_pixels_entry.get())
2113            maximum = maximum * self.zoom_scale
2114        except ValueError:
2115            print("Invalid maximum value; using default of 1000")
2116            maximum = 1000
2117            
2118        canvas_x, canvas_y = seed_point
2119        if canvas_x < 0 or canvas_y < 0 or canvas_x >= self.zoom_image_orig.shape[1] or canvas_y >= self.zoom_image_orig.shape[0]:
2120            print("Selected point is out of bounds in the zoomed image.")
2121            return
2122        
2123        self.zoom_mask = self.apply_magic_wand(self.zoom_image_orig, self.zoom_mask, (canvas_x, canvas_y), tolerance, maximum, action)
2124        y0, y1, x0, x1 = self.zoom_y0, self.zoom_y1, self.zoom_x0, self.zoom_x1
2125        zoomed_mask_resized_back = resize(self.zoom_mask, (y1 - y0, x1 - x0), order=0, preserve_range=True).astype(np.uint8)
2126        if action == 'erase':
2127            self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = np.where(zoomed_mask_resized_back == 0, 0, self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1])
2128        else:
2129            self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1] = np.where(zoomed_mask_resized_back > 0, zoomed_mask_resized_back, self.mask[y0:y1, x0:x1])
2130        self.update_display()
def draw(self, event): 
2132    def draw(self, event):
2133        if self.drawing:
2134            x, y = event.x, event.y
2135            if self.draw_coordinates:
2136                last_x, last_y = self.draw_coordinates[-1]
2137                self.current_line = self.canvas.create_line(last_x, last_y, x, y, fill="yellow", width=3)
2138            self.draw_coordinates.append((x, y))
def draw_on_zoomed_mask(self, draw_coordinates): 
2140    def draw_on_zoomed_mask(self, draw_coordinates):
2141        canvas_height = self.canvas.winfo_height()
2142        canvas_width = self.canvas.winfo_width()
2143        zoomed_mask = np.zeros((canvas_height, canvas_width), dtype=np.uint8)
2144        rr, cc = polygon(np.array(draw_coordinates)[:, 1], np.array(draw_coordinates)[:, 0], shape=zoomed_mask.shape)
2145        zoomed_mask[rr, cc] = 255
2146        return zoomed_mask
def finish_drawing(self, event): 
2148    def finish_drawing(self, event):
2149        if len(self.draw_coordinates) > 2:
2150            self.draw_coordinates.append(self.draw_coordinates[0])
2151            if self.zoom_active:
2152                x0, x1, y0, y1 = self.zoom_x0, self.zoom_x1, self.zoom_y0, self.zoom_y1
2153                zoomed_mask = self.draw_on_zoomed_mask(self.draw_coordinates)
2154                self.update_original_mask(zoomed_mask, x0, x1, y0, y1)
2155            else:
2156                rr, cc = polygon(np.array(self.draw_coordinates)[:, 1], np.array(self.draw_coordinates)[:, 0], shape=self.mask.shape)
2157                self.mask[rr, cc] = np.maximum(self.mask[rr, cc], 255)
2158                self.mask = self.mask.copy()
2159            self.canvas.delete(self.current_line)
2160            self.draw_coordinates.clear()
2161        self.update_display()
def finish_drawing_if_active(self, event): 
2163    def finish_drawing_if_active(self, event):
2164        if self.drawing and len(self.draw_coordinates) > 2:
2165            self.finish_drawing(event)
def apply_normalization(self): 
2171    def apply_normalization(self):
2172        self.lower_quantile.set(self.lower_entry.get())
2173        self.upper_quantile.set(self.upper_entry.get())
2174        self.update_display()
def fill_objects(self): 
2176    def fill_objects(self):
2177        binary_mask = self.mask > 0
2178        filled_mask = binary_fill_holes(binary_mask)
2179        self.mask = filled_mask.astype(np.uint8) * 255
2180        labeled_mask, _ = label(filled_mask)
2181        self.mask = labeled_mask
2182        self.update_display()
def relabel_objects(self): 
2184    def relabel_objects(self):
2185        mask = self.mask
2186        labeled_mask, num_labels = label(mask > 0)
2187        self.mask = labeled_mask
2188        self.update_display()
def clear_objects(self): 
2190    def clear_objects(self):
2191        self.mask = np.zeros_like(self.mask)
2192        self.update_display()
def invert_mask(self): 
2194    def invert_mask(self):
2195        self.mask = np.where(self.mask > 0, 0, 1)
2196        self.relabel_objects()
2197        self.update_display()
def remove_small_objects(self): 
2199    def remove_small_objects(self):
2200        try:
2201            min_area = int(self.min_area_entry.get())
2202        except ValueError:
2203            print("Invalid minimum area value; using default of 100")
2204            min_area = 100
2205
2206        labeled_mask, num_labels = label(self.mask > 0)
2207        for i in range(1, num_labels + 1):  # Skip background
2208            if np.sum(labeled_mask == i) < min_area:
2209                self.mask[labeled_mask == i] = 0  # Remove small objects
2210        self.update_display()
class AnnotateApp: 
2212class AnnotateApp:
2213    def __init__(self, root, db_path, src, image_type=None, channels=None, image_size=200, annotation_column='annotate', normalize=False, percentiles=(1, 99), measurement=None, threshold=None, normalize_channels=None):
2214        self.root = root
2215        self.db_path = db_path
2216        self.src = src
2217        self.index = 0
2218
2219        if isinstance(image_size, list):
2220            self.image_size = (int(image_size[0]), int(image_size[0]))
2221        elif isinstance(image_size, int):
2222            self.image_size = (image_size, image_size)
2223        else:
2224            raise ValueError("Invalid image size")
2225        
2226        self.orig_annotation_columns = annotation_column
2227        self.annotation_column = annotation_column
2228        self.image_type = image_type
2229        self.channels = channels
2230        self.normalize = normalize
2231        self.percentiles = percentiles
2232        self.images = {}
2233        self.pending_updates = {}
2234        self.labels = []
2235        self.adjusted_to_original_paths = {}
2236        self.terminate = False
2237        self.update_queue = Queue()
2238        self.measurement = measurement
2239        self.threshold = threshold
2240        self.normalize_channels = normalize_channels
2241        print('self.normalize_channels',self.normalize_channels)
2242        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
2243        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
2244        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
2245        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
2246        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
2247        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
2248        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
2249
2250        if self.font_loader:

2252        else:
2253            self.font_style = ("Arial", 12)
2254        
2255        self.root.configure(bg=style_out['inactive_color'])
2256
2257        self.filtered_paths_annotations = []
2258        self.prefilter_paths_annotations()
2259
2260        self.db_update_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.update_database_worker)
2261        self.db_update_thread.start()
2262

2279        self.previous_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)

2282        self.exit_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2283

2285        self.train_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2286

2288        self.train_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2289

2291        self.settings_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2292

2294        self.calculate_grid_dimensions()
2295
2296        # Create a frame to hold the image grid
2297        self.grid_frame = Frame(root, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2298        self.grid_frame.grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, padx=0, pady=0, sticky="nsew")
2299
2300        for i in range(self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols):
2301            label = Label(self.grid_frame, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2302            label.grid(row=i // self.grid_cols, column=i % self.grid_cols, padx=2, pady=2, sticky="nsew")
2303            self.labels.append(label)
2304
2305        # Make the grid frame resize with the window
2306        self.root.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
2307        self.root.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
2308        self.root.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
2309
2310        for row in range(self.grid_rows):
2311            self.grid_frame.grid_rowconfigure(row, weight=1)
2312        for col in range(self.grid_cols):
2313            self.grid_frame.grid_columnconfigure(col, weight=1)
2314            
2315    def open_settings_window(self):
2316        from .gui_utils import generate_annotate_fields, convert_to_number
2317
2318        # Create settings window
2319        settings_window = tk.Toplevel(self.root)
2320        settings_window.title("Modify Annotation Settings")
2321
2322        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
2323        settings_window.configure(bg=style_out['bg_color'])
2324        
2325        settings_frame = tk.Frame(settings_window, bg=style_out['bg_color'])
2326        settings_frame.pack(fill=tk.BOTH, expand=True)
2327
2328        # Generate fields with current settings pre-filled
2329        vars_dict = generate_annotate_fields(settings_frame)
2330
2331        # Pre-fill the current settings into vars_dict
2332        current_settings = {
2333            'image_type': self.image_type or '',
2334            'channels': ','.join(self.channels) if self.channels else '',
2335            'img_size': f"{self.image_size[0]},{self.image_size[1]}",
2336            'annotation_column': self.annotation_column or '',
2337            'normalize': str(self.normalize),
2338            'percentiles': ','.join(map(str, self.percentiles)),
2339            'measurement': ','.join(self.measurement) if self.measurement else '',
2340            'threshold': str(self.threshold) if self.threshold is not None else '',
2341            'normalize_channels': ','.join(self.normalize_channels) if self.normalize_channels else ''
2342        }
2343
2344        for key, data in vars_dict.items():
2345            if key in current_settings:
2346                data['entry'].delete(0, tk.END)
2347                data['entry'].insert(0, current_settings[key])
2348
2349        def apply_new_settings():
2350            settings = {key: data['entry'].get() for key, data in vars_dict.items()}
2351            
2352            # Process settings exactly as your original initiation function does
2353            settings['channels'] = settings['channels'].split(',') if settings['channels'] else None
2354            settings['img_size'] = list(map(int, settings['img_size'].split(',')))
2355            settings['percentiles'] = list(map(convert_to_number, settings['percentiles'].split(','))) if settings['percentiles'] else [1, 99]
2356            settings['normalize'] = settings['normalize'].lower() == 'true'
2357            settings['normalize_channels'] = settings['normalize_channels'].split(',') if settings['normalize_channels'] else None
2358
2359            try:
2360                settings['measurement'] = settings['measurement'].split(',') if settings['measurement'] else None
2361                settings['threshold'] = None if settings['threshold'].lower() == 'none' else int(settings['threshold'])
2362            except:
2363                settings['measurement'] = None
2364                settings['threshold'] = None
2365
2366            # Convert empty strings to None
2367            for key, value in settings.items():
2368                if isinstance(value, list):
2369                    settings[key] = [v if v != '' else None for v in value]
2370                elif value == '':
2371                    settings[key] = None
2372
2373            # Apply these settings dynamically using update_settings method
2374            self.update_settings(**{
2375                'image_type': settings.get('image_type'),
2376                'channels': settings.get('channels'),
2377                'image_size': settings.get('img_size'),
2378                'annotation_column': settings.get('annotation_column'),
2379                'normalize': settings.get('normalize'),
2380                'percentiles': settings.get('percentiles'),
2381                'measurement': settings.get('measurement'),
2382                'threshold': settings.get('threshold'),
2383                'normalize_channels': settings.get('normalize_channels')
2384            })
2385
2386            settings_window.destroy()
2387
2388        apply_button = spacrButton(settings_window, text="Apply Settings", command=apply_new_settings,show_text=False)
2389        apply_button.pack(pady=10)
2390        
2391    def update_settings(self, **kwargs):
2392        allowed_attributes = {
2393            'image_type', 'channels', 'image_size', 'annotation_column',
2394            'normalize', 'percentiles', 'measurement', 'threshold', 'normalize_channels'
2395        }
2396
2397        updated = False
2398
2399        for attr, value in kwargs.items():
2400            if attr in allowed_attributes and value is not None:
2401                setattr(self, attr, value)
2402                updated = True
2403
2404        if 'image_size' in kwargs:
2405            if isinstance(self.image_size, list):
2406                self.image_size = (int(self.image_size[0]), int(self.image_size[0]))
2407            elif isinstance(self.image_size, int):
2408                self.image_size = (self.image_size, self.image_size)
2409            else:
2410                raise ValueError("Invalid image size")
2411
2412            self.calculate_grid_dimensions()
2413            self.recreate_image_grid()
2414
2415        if updated:
2416            current_index = self.index  # Retain current index
2417            self.prefilter_paths_annotations()
2418
2419            # Ensure the retained index is still valid (not out of bounds)
2420            max_index = len(self.filtered_paths_annotations) - 1
2421            self.index = min(current_index, max_index := max(0, max(0, max(len(self.filtered_paths_annotations) - self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols, 0))))
2422            self.load_images()
2423
2424    def recreate_image_grid(self):
2425        # Remove current labels
2426        for label in self.labels:
2427            label.destroy()
2428        self.labels.clear()
2429
2430        # Recreate the labels grid with updated dimensions
2431        for i in range(self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols):
2432            label = Label(self.grid_frame, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2433            label.grid(row=i // self.grid_cols, column=i % self.grid_cols, padx=2, pady=2, sticky="nsew")
2434            self.labels.append(label)
2435
2436        # Reconfigure grid weights
2437        for row in range(self.grid_rows):
2438            self.grid_frame.grid_rowconfigure(row, weight=1)
2439        for col in range(self.grid_cols):
2440            self.grid_frame.grid_columnconfigure(col, weight=1)
2441
2442            
2443    def swich_back_annotation_column(self):
2444        self.annotation_column = self.orig_annotation_columns
2445        self.prefilter_paths_annotations()
2446        self.update_display()
2447            
2448    def calculate_grid_dimensions(self):
2449        window_width = self.root.winfo_width()
2450        window_height = self.root.winfo_height()
2451
2452        self.grid_cols = window_width // (self.image_size[0] + 4)
2453        self.grid_rows = (window_height - self.button_frame.winfo_height() - 4) // (self.image_size[1] + 4)
2454
2455        # Update to make sure grid_rows and grid_cols are at least 1
2456        self.grid_cols = max(1, self.grid_cols)
2457        self.grid_rows = max(1, self.grid_rows)
2458
2459    def prefilter_paths_annotations(self):
2460        from .io import _read_and_join_tables, _read_db
2461        from .utils import is_list_of_lists
2462
2463        if self.measurement and self.threshold is not None:
2464            df = _read_and_join_tables(self.db_path)
2465            png_list_df = _read_db(self.db_path, tables=['png_list'])[0]
2466            png_list_df = png_list_df.set_index('prcfo')
2467            df = df.merge(png_list_df, left_index=True, right_index=True)
2468            df[self.annotation_column] = None
2469            before = len(df)
2470
2471            if isinstance(self.threshold, int):
2472                if isinstance(self.measurement, list):
2473                    mes = self.measurement[0]
2474                if isinstance(self.measurement, str):
2475                    mes = self.measurement
2476                df = df[df[f'{mes}'] == self.threshold]
2477
2478            if is_list_of_lists(self.measurement):
2479                if isinstance(self.threshold, list) or is_list_of_lists(self.threshold):
2480                    if len(self.measurement) == len(self.threshold):
2481                        for idx, var in enumerate(self.measurement):
2482                            df = df[df[var[idx]] > self.threshold[idx]]
2483                        after = len(df)
2484                    elif len(self.measurement) == len(self.threshold)*2:
2485                        th_idx = 0
2486                        for idx, var in enumerate(self.measurement):
2487                            if idx % 2 != 0:
2488                                th_idx += 1
2489                                thd = self.threshold
2490                                if isinstance(thd, list):
2491                                    thd = thd[0]
2492                                df[f'threshold_measurement_{idx}'] = df[self.measurement[idx]]/df[self.measurement[idx+1]]
2493                                print(f"mean threshold_measurement_{idx}: {np.mean(df['threshold_measurement'])}")
2494                                print(f"median threshold measurement: {np.median(df[self.measurement])}")
2495                                df = df[df[f'threshold_measurement_{idx}'] > thd]
2496                        after = len(df)
2497            
2498            elif isinstance(self.measurement, list):
2499                df['threshold_measurement'] = df[self.measurement[0]]/df[self.measurement[1]]
2500                print(f"mean threshold measurement: {np.mean(df['threshold_measurement'])}")
2501                print(f"median threshold measurement: {np.median(df[self.measurement])}")
2502                df = df[df['threshold_measurement'] > self.threshold]
2503                after = len(df)
2504                self.measurement = 'threshold_measurement'
2505                print(f'Removed: {before-after} rows, retained {after}')
2506            
2507            else:
2508                print(f"mean threshold measurement: {np.mean(df[self.measurement])}")
2509                print(f"median threshold measurement: {np.median(df[self.measurement])}")
2510                before = len(df)
2511                if isinstance(self.threshold, str):
2512                    if self.threshold == 'q1':
2513                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.1)
2514                    if self.threshold == 'q2':
2515                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.2)
2516                    if self.threshold == 'q3':
2517                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.3)
2518                    if self.threshold == 'q4':
2519                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.4)
2520                    if self.threshold == 'q5':
2521                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.5)
2522                    if self.threshold == 'q6':
2523                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.6)
2524                    if self.threshold == 'q7':
2525                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.7)
2526                    if self.threshold == 'q8':
2527                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.8)
2528                    if self.threshold == 'q9':
2529                        self.threshold = df[self.measurement].quantile(0.9)
2530                print(f"threshold: {self.threshold}")
2531
2532                df = df[df[self.measurement] > self.threshold]
2533                after = len(df)
2534                print(f'Removed: {before-after} rows, retained {after}')
2535
2536            df = df.dropna(subset=['png_path'])
2537            if self.image_type:
2538                before = len(df)
2539                if isinstance(self.image_type, list):
2540                    for tpe in self.image_type:
2541                        df = df[df['png_path'].str.contains(tpe)]
2542                else:
2543                    df = df[df['png_path'].str.contains(self.image_type)]
2544                after = len(df)
2545                print(f'image_type: Removed: {before-after} rows, retained {after}')
2546
2547            self.filtered_paths_annotations = df[['png_path', self.annotation_column]].values.tolist()
2548        else:
2549            conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path)
2550            c = conn.cursor()
2551            if self.image_type:
2552                c.execute(f"SELECT png_path, {self.annotation_column} FROM png_list WHERE png_path LIKE ?", (f"%{self.image_type}%",))
2553            else:
2554                c.execute(f"SELECT png_path, {self.annotation_column} FROM png_list")
2555            self.filtered_paths_annotations = c.fetchall()
2556            conn.close()
2557
2558    def load_images(self):
2559        for label in self.labels:
2560            label.config(image='')
2561
2562        self.images = {}
2563        paths_annotations = self.filtered_paths_annotations[self.index:self.index + self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols]
2564
2565        adjusted_paths = []
2566        for path, annotation in paths_annotations:
2567            if not path.startswith(self.src):
2568                parts = path.split('/data/')
2569                if len(parts) > 1:
2570                    new_path = os.path.join(self.src, 'data', parts[1])
2571                    self.adjusted_to_original_paths[new_path] = path
2572                    adjusted_paths.append((new_path, annotation))
2573                else:
2574                    adjusted_paths.append((path, annotation))
2575            else:
2576                adjusted_paths.append((path, annotation))
2577
2578        with ThreadPoolExecutor() as executor:
2579            loaded_images = list(executor.map(self.load_single_image, adjusted_paths))
2580
2581        for i, (img, annotation) in enumerate(loaded_images):
2582            if annotation:
2583                border_color = self.active_color if annotation == 1 else 'red'
2584                img = self.add_colored_border(img, border_width=5, border_color=border_color)
2585
2586            photo = ImageTk.PhotoImage(img)
2587            label = self.labels[i]
2588            self.images[label] = photo
2589            label.config(image=photo)
2590
2591            path = adjusted_paths[i][0]
2592            label.bind('<Button-1>', self.get_on_image_click(path, label, img))
2593            label.bind('<Button-3>', self.get_on_image_click(path, label, img))
2594
2595        self.root.update()
2596
2597    def load_single_image(self, path_annotation_tuple):
2598        path, annotation = path_annotation_tuple
2599        img = Image.open(path)
2600        img = self.normalize_image(img, self.normalize, self.percentiles, self.normalize_channels)
2601        img = img.convert('RGB')
2602        img = self.filter_channels(img)
2603        img = img.resize(self.image_size)
2604        return img, annotation
2605    
2606    @staticmethod
2607    def normalize_image(img, normalize=False, percentiles=(1, 99), normalize_channels=None):
2608        """
2609        Normalize an image based on specific channels (R, G, B).
2610
2611        Args:
2612            img (PIL.Image or np.array): Input image.
2613            normalize (bool): Whether to normalize the image or not.
2614            percentiles (tuple): Percentiles to use for intensity rescaling.
2615            normalize_channels (list): List of channels to normalize. E.g., ['r', 'g', 'b'], ['r'], ['g'], etc.
2616
2617        Returns:
2618            PIL.Image: Normalized image.
2619        """
2620        img_array = np.array(img)
2621
2622        if normalize:
2623            if img_array.ndim == 2:  # Grayscale image
2624                p2, p98 = np.percentile(img_array, percentiles)
2625                img_array = rescale_intensity(img_array, in_range=(p2, p98), out_range=(0, 255))
2626            else:  # Color image or multi-channel image
2627                # Create a map for the color channels
2628                channel_map = {'r': 0, 'g': 1, 'b': 2}
2629                
2630                # If normalize_channels is not specified, normalize all channels
2631                if normalize_channels is None:
2632                    normalize_channels = ['r', 'g', 'b']
2633                
2634                for channel_name in normalize_channels:
2635                    if channel_name in channel_map:
2636                        channel_idx = channel_map[channel_name]
2637                        p2, p98 = np.percentile(img_array[:, :, channel_idx], percentiles)
2638                        img_array[:, :, channel_idx] = rescale_intensity(img_array[:, :, channel_idx], in_range=(p2, p98), out_range=(0, 255))
2639
2640        img_array = np.clip(img_array, 0, 255).astype('uint8')
2641
2642        return Image.fromarray(img_array)
2643
2644    
2645    def add_colored_border(self, img, border_width, border_color):
2646        top_border = Image.new('RGB', (img.width, border_width), color=border_color)
2647        bottom_border = Image.new('RGB', (img.width, border_width), color=border_color)
2648        left_border = Image.new('RGB', (border_width, img.height), color=border_color)
2649        right_border = Image.new('RGB', (border_width, img.height), color=border_color)
2650
2651        bordered_img = Image.new('RGB', (img.width + 2 * border_width, img.height + 2 * border_width), color=self.fg_color)
2652        bordered_img.paste(top_border, (border_width, 0))
2653        bordered_img.paste(bottom_border, (border_width, img.height + border_width))
2654        bordered_img.paste(left_border, (0, border_width))
2655        bordered_img.paste(right_border, (img.width + border_width, border_width))
2656        bordered_img.paste(img, (border_width, border_width))
2657
2658        return bordered_img
2659    
2660    def filter_channels(self, img):
2661        r, g, b = img.split()
2662        if self.channels:
2663            if 'r' not in self.channels:
2664                r = r.point(lambda _: 0)
2665            if 'g' not in self.channels:
2666                g = g.point(lambda _: 0)
2667            if 'b' not in self.channels:
2668                b = b.point(lambda _: 0)
2669
2670            if len(self.channels) == 1:
2671                channel_img = r if 'r' in self.channels else (g if 'g' in self.channels else b)
2672                return ImageOps.grayscale(channel_img)
2673
2674        return Image.merge("RGB", (r, g, b))
2675
2676    def get_on_image_click(self, path, label, img):
2677        def on_image_click(event):
2678            new_annotation = 1 if event.num == 1 else (2 if event.num == 3 else None)
2679            
2680            original_path = self.adjusted_to_original_paths.get(path, path)
2681            
2682            if original_path in self.pending_updates and self.pending_updates[original_path] == new_annotation:
2683                self.pending_updates[original_path] = None
2684                new_annotation = None
2685            else:
2686                self.pending_updates[original_path] = new_annotation
2687            
2688            print(f"Image {os.path.split(path)[1]} annotated: {new_annotation}")
2689            
2690            img_ = img.crop((5, 5, img.width-5, img.height-5))
2691            border_fill = self.active_color if new_annotation == 1 else ('red' if new_annotation == 2 else None)
2692            img_ = ImageOps.expand(img_, border=5, fill=border_fill) if border_fill else img_
2693
2694            photo = ImageTk.PhotoImage(img_)
2695            self.images[label] = photo
2696            label.config(image=photo)
2697            self.root.update()
2698
2699        return on_image_click
2700
2701    @staticmethod
2702    def update_html(text):
2703        display(HTML(f"""
2704        <script>
2705        document.getElementById('unique_id').innerHTML = '{text}';
2706        </script>
2707        """))
2708
2709    def update_database_worker(self):
2710        conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path)
2711        c = conn.cursor()
2712
2713        display(HTML("<div id='unique_id'>Initial Text</div>"))
2714
2715        while True:
2716            if self.terminate:
2717                conn.close()
2718                break
2719
2720            if not self.update_queue.empty():
2721                AnnotateApp.update_html("Do not exit, Updating database...")
2722                self.status_label.config(text='Do not exit, Updating database...')
2723
2724                pending_updates = self.update_queue.get()
2725                for path, new_annotation in pending_updates.items():
2726                    if new_annotation is None:
2727                        c.execute(f'UPDATE png_list SET {self.annotation_column} = NULL WHERE png_path = ?', (path,))
2728                    else:
2729                        c.execute(f'UPDATE png_list SET {self.annotation_column} = ? WHERE png_path = ?', (new_annotation, path))
2730                conn.commit()
2731
2732                AnnotateApp.update_html('')
2733                self.status_label.config(text='')
2734                self.root.update()
2735            time.sleep(0.1)
2736
2737    def update_gui_text(self, text):
2738        self.status_label.config(text=text)
2739        self.root.update()
2740
2741    def next_page(self):
2742        if self.pending_updates:
2743            self.update_queue.put(self.pending_updates.copy())
2744        self.pending_updates.clear()
2745        self.index += self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols
2746        self.prefilter_paths_annotations()  # Re-fetch annotations from the database
2747        self.load_images()
2748
2749    def previous_page(self):
2750        if self.pending_updates:
2751            self.update_queue.put(self.pending_updates.copy())
2752        self.pending_updates.clear()
2753        self.index -= self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols
2754        if self.index < 0:
2755            self.index = 0
2756        self.prefilter_paths_annotations()  # Re-fetch annotations from the database
2757        self.load_images()
2758
2759    def shutdown(self):
2760        self.terminate = True
2761        self.update_queue.put(self.pending_updates.copy())
2762        if not self.pending_updates:
2763            self.pending_updates.clear()
2764            self.db_update_thread.join()
2765            self.root.quit()
2766            self.root.destroy()
2767            print(f'Quit application')
2768        else:
2769            print('Waiting for pending updates to finish before quitting')
2770            
2771    def train_and_classify(self):
2772        """
2773        1) Merge data from the relevant DB tables (including png_list).
2774        2) Collect manual annotations from png_list.<annotation_column> => 'manual_annotation'.
2775           - 1 => class=1, 2 => class=0 (for training).
2776        3) If only one class is present, randomly sample unannotated images as the other class.
2777        4) Train an XGBoost model.
2778        5) Classify *all* rows -> fill XGboost_score (prob of class=1) & XGboost_annotation (1 or 2 if high confidence).
2779        6) Write those columns back to sqlite, so every row in png_list has a score (and possibly an annotation).
2780        7) Refresh the UI (prefilter_paths_annotations + load_images).
2781        """
2782
2783        # Optionally, update your GUI status label
2784        self.update_gui_text("Merging data...")
2785
2786        from spacr.io import _read_and_merge_data  # Adapt to your actual import
2787
2788        # (1) Merge data
2789        merged_df, obj_df_ls = _read_and_merge_data(
2790            locs=[self.db_path],
2791            tables=['cell', 'cytoplasm', 'nucleus', 'pathogen', 'png_list'],
2792            verbose=False
2793        )
2794
2795        # (2) Load manual annotations from the DB
2796        conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path)
2797        c = conn.cursor()
2798        c.execute(f"SELECT png_path, {self.annotation_column} FROM png_list WHERE {self.annotation_column} IS NOT NULL")
2799        annotated_rows = c.fetchall()  # e.g. [(png_path, 1 or 2), ...]
2800        conn.close()
2801
2802        # dict {png_path -> 1 or 2}
2803        annot_dict = dict(annotated_rows)
2804
2805        # Add 'manual_annotation' to merged_df
2806        merged_df['manual_annotation'] = merged_df['png_path'].map(annot_dict)
2807
2808        # Subset with manual labels
2809        annotated_df = merged_df.dropna(subset=['manual_annotation']).copy()
2810        # Convert "2" => "0" for binary classification
2811        annotated_df['manual_annotation'] = annotated_df['manual_annotation'].replace({2: 0}).astype(int)
2812
2813        # (3) Handle single-class scenario
2814        class_counts = annotated_df['manual_annotation'].value_counts()
2815        if len(class_counts) == 1:
2816            single_class = class_counts.index[0]  # 0 or 1
2817            needed = class_counts.iloc[0]
2818            other_class = 1 if single_class == 0 else 0
2819
2820            unannotated_df_all = merged_df[merged_df['manual_annotation'].isna()].copy()
2821            if len(unannotated_df_all) == 0:
2822                print("No unannotated rows to sample for the other class. Cannot proceed.")
2823                self.update_gui_text("Not enough data to train (no second class).")
2824                return
2825
2826            sample_size = min(needed, len(unannotated_df_all))
2827            artificially_labeled = unannotated_df_all.sample(n=sample_size, replace=False).copy()
2828            artificially_labeled['manual_annotation'] = other_class
2829
2830            annotated_df = pd.concat([annotated_df, artificially_labeled], ignore_index=True)
2831            print(f"Only one class was present => randomly labeled {sample_size} unannotated rows as {other_class}.")
2832
2833        if len(annotated_df) < 2:
2834            print("Not enough annotated data to train (need at least 2).")
2835            self.update_gui_text("Not enough data to train.")
2836            return
2837
2838        # (4) Train XGBoost
2839        self.update_gui_text("Training XGBoost model...")
2840
2841        # Identify numeric columns
2842        ignore_cols = {'png_path', 'manual_annotation'}
2843        feature_cols = [
2844            col for col in annotated_df.columns
2845            if col not in ignore_cols
2846            and (annotated_df[col].dtype == float or annotated_df[col].dtype == int)
2847        ]
2848
2849        X_data = annotated_df[feature_cols].fillna(0).values
2850        y_data = annotated_df['manual_annotation'].values
2851
2852        # standard train/test
2853        X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(
2854            X_data, y_data, test_size=0.1, random_state=42
2855        )
2856        model = XGBClassifier(use_label_encoder=False, eval_metric='logloss')
2857        model.fit(X_train, y_train)
2858
2859        # Evaluate
2860        preds = model.predict(X_test)
2861        print("=== Classification Report ===")
2862        print(classification_report(y_test, preds))
2863        print("=== Confusion Matrix ===")
2864        print(confusion_matrix(y_test, preds))
2865
2866        # (5) Classify ALL rows
2867        all_df = merged_df.copy()
2868        X_all = all_df[feature_cols].fillna(0).values
2869        probs_all = model.predict_proba(X_all)[:, 1]
2870        # Probability => XGboost_score
2871        all_df['XGboost_score'] = probs_all
2872
2873        # Decide XGboost_annotation
2874        def get_annotation_from_prob(prob):
2875            if prob > 0.9:
2876                return 1  # class=1
2877            elif prob < 0.1:
2878                return 0  # class=0
2879            return None  # uncertain
2880
2881        xgb_anno_col = [get_annotation_from_prob(p) for p in probs_all]
2882        # Convert 0 => 2 if your DB uses "2" for the negative class
2883        xgb_anno_col = [2 if x == 0 else x for x in xgb_anno_col]
2884
2885        all_df['XGboost_annotation'] = xgb_anno_col
2886
2887        # (6) Write results back to png_list
2888        self.update_gui_text("Updating the database with XGBoost predictions...")
2889        conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path)
2890        c = conn.cursor()
2891        # Ensure columns exist
2892        try:
2893            c.execute("ALTER TABLE png_list ADD COLUMN XGboost_annotation INTEGER")
2894        except sqlite3.OperationalError:
2895            pass
2896        try:
2897            c.execute("ALTER TABLE png_list ADD COLUMN XGboost_score FLOAT")
2898        except sqlite3.OperationalError:
2899            pass
2900
2901        # Update each row
2902        for idx, row in all_df.iterrows():
2903            score_val = float(row['XGboost_score'])
2904            anno_val  = row['XGboost_annotation']
2905            the_path  = row['png_path']
2906            if pd.isna(the_path):
2907                continue  # skip if no path
2908
2909            if pd.isna(anno_val):
2910                # We set annotation=NULL but do set the score
2911                c.execute("""
2912                    UPDATE png_list
2913                       SET XGboost_annotation = NULL,
2914                           XGboost_score       = ?
2915                     WHERE png_path = ?
2916                """, (score_val, the_path))
2917            else:
2918                # numeric annotation + numeric score
2919                c.execute("""
2920                    UPDATE png_list
2921                       SET XGboost_annotation = ?,
2922                           XGboost_score       = ?
2923                     WHERE png_path = ?
2924                """, (int(anno_val), score_val, the_path))
2925                
2926        self.annotation_column = 'XGboost_annotation'
AnnotateApp( root, db_path, src, image_type=None, channels=None, image_size=200, annotation_column='annotate', normalize=False, percentiles=(1, 99), measurement=None, threshold=None, normalize_channels=None) 
2213    def __init__(self, root, db_path, src, image_type=None, channels=None, image_size=200, annotation_column='annotate', normalize=False, percentiles=(1, 99), measurement=None, threshold=None, normalize_channels=None):
2214        self.root = root
2215        self.db_path = db_path
2216        self.src = src
2217        self.index = 0
2218
2219        if isinstance(image_size, list):
2220            self.image_size = (int(image_size[0]), int(image_size[0]))
2221        elif isinstance(image_size, int):
2222            self.image_size = (image_size, image_size)
2223        else:
2224            raise ValueError("Invalid image size")
2225        
2226        self.orig_annotation_columns = annotation_column
2227        self.annotation_column = annotation_column
2228        self.image_type = image_type
2229        self.channels = channels
2230        self.normalize = normalize
2231        self.percentiles = percentiles
2232        self.images = {}
2233        self.pending_updates = {}
2234        self.labels = []
2235        self.adjusted_to_original_paths = {}
2236        self.terminate = False
2237        self.update_queue = Queue()
2238        self.measurement = measurement
2239        self.threshold = threshold
2240        self.normalize_channels = normalize_channels
2241        print('self.normalize_channels',self.normalize_channels)
2242        style_out = set_dark_style(ttk.Style())
2243        self.font_loader = style_out['font_loader']
2244        self.font_size = style_out['font_size']
2245        self.bg_color = style_out['bg_color']
2246        self.fg_color = style_out['fg_color']
2247        self.active_color = style_out['active_color']
2248        self.inactive_color = style_out['inactive_color']
2249
2250        if self.font_loader:
2251            self.font_style = self.font_loader.get_font(size=self.font_size)
2252        else:
2253            self.font_style = ("Arial", 12)
2254        
2255        self.root.configure(bg=style_out['inactive_color'])
2256
2257        self.filtered_paths_annotations = []
2258        self.prefilter_paths_annotations()
2259
2260        self.db_update_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.update_database_worker)
2261        self.db_update_thread.start()
2262
2263        # Set the initial window size and make it fit the screen size
2264        self.root.geometry(f"{self.root.winfo_screenwidth()}x{self.root.winfo_screenheight()}")
2265        self.root.update_idletasks()
2266
2267        # Create the status label
2268        self.status_label = Label(root, text="", font=self.font_style, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2269        self.status_label.grid(row=2, column=0, padx=10, pady=10, sticky="w")
2270
2271        # Place the buttons at the bottom right
2272        self.button_frame = Frame(root, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2273        self.button_frame.grid(row=2, column=1, padx=10, pady=10, sticky="se")
2274
2275        self.next_button = Button(self.button_frame, text="Next", command=self.next_page, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, highlightbackground=self.fg_color, highlightcolor=self.fg_color, highlightthickness=1)
2276        self.next_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2277
2278        self.previous_button = Button(self.button_frame, text="Back", command=self.previous_page, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, highlightbackground=self.fg_color, highlightcolor=self.fg_color, highlightthickness=1)
2279        self.previous_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2280
2281        self.exit_button = Button(self.button_frame, text="Exit", command=self.shutdown, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, highlightbackground=self.fg_color, highlightcolor=self.fg_color, highlightthickness=1)
2282        self.exit_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2283        
2284        self.train_button = Button(self.button_frame,text="Train & Classify (beta)",command=self.train_and_classify,bg=self.bg_color,fg=self.fg_color,highlightbackground=self.fg_color,highlightcolor=self.fg_color,highlightthickness=1)
2285        self.train_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2286        
2287        self.train_button = Button(self.button_frame,text="orig.",command=self.swich_back_annotation_column,bg=self.bg_color,fg=self.fg_color,highlightbackground=self.fg_color,highlightcolor=self.fg_color,highlightthickness=1)
2288        self.train_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2289        
2290        self.settings_button = Button(self.button_frame, text="Settings", command=self.open_settings_window, bg=self.bg_color, fg=self.fg_color, highlightbackground=self.fg_color,highlightcolor=self.fg_color,highlightthickness=1)
2291        self.settings_button.pack(side="right", padx=5)
2292
2293        # Calculate grid rows and columns based on the root window size and image size
2294        self.calculate_grid_dimensions()
2295
2296        # Create a frame to hold the image grid
2297        self.grid_frame = Frame(root, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2298        self.grid_frame.grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, padx=0, pady=0, sticky="nsew")
2299
2300        for i in range(self.grid_rows * self.grid_cols):
2301            label = Label(self.grid_frame, bg=self.root.cget('bg'))
2302            label.grid(row=i // self.grid_cols, column=i % self.grid_cols, padx=2, pady=2, sticky="nsew")
2303            self.labels.append(label)
2304
2305        # Make the grid frame resize with the window
2306        self.root.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
2307        self.root.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)
2308        self.root.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
2309
2310        for row in range(self.grid_rows):
2311            self.grid_frame.grid_rowconfigure(row, weight=1)
2312        for col in range(self.grid_cols):
2313            self.grid_frame.grid_columnconfigure(col, weight=1)
